title_english: God is love, His mercy abounds
passage_english: FOR LOVE IS OF GOD. 1 JOHN 4:7
passage_yoruba: IFE NI OLORUN”. 1 JOHANU 4:7.
verses_english:
God is love, His mercy abounds,
Illuminating our paths,
Oh divine peace us He granted,
Of divine love is our God.

Death is virulently hostile,
Men abound in decadence,
His mercies ever endureth,
Of divine love is our God.

When the darkness overwhelmed us,
His charity we receive,
And His Light He beamed upon us,
Of divine love is our God.

Oh what a great hope and comfort,
He attached to sacred lusts,
His glory shinning all around
Of divine love is our God.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ife l‘Olorun, aanu Re,
Tan si ona wa gbogbo,
O fun wa ni alaafia,
Ife ni Olorun wa.

Iku n doro pupopupo,
Eniyan si n dibaje;
Sugbon aanu Re wa titi,
lfe ni Olorun wa.

Lakoko t’o dab’o sokun,
A n ri imole Re fun wa,
O tan imole Re fun wa,
lfe ni Olorun wa.

O so 'reti, at‘itunu,
Mo aniyan aye wa,
Ogo Re n tan nibi gbogbo,
lfe ni Olorun wa.
(Amin).

title_english: MUCH as the stars my sins abound
passage_english:
JESUS, MASTER, HAVE MERCY ON US.
LUKE 17:13
passage_yoruba: JESU, BABA, SAANU FUN WA. LUKU 17:13
verses_english:
MUCH as the stars my sins abound,
Much as the ocean sands,
But the compassion of the Lord
Is much and more than all.

Mannaseh, Paul and Magdalene,
Thou forgivest them all,
That have I read, and thus believe,
Thou hast forgiven me.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ese mi po bi irawo,
Bi ‘yanrin let‘okun,
Sugbon iyonu Olorun,
O papoju bee lo.

Manase, Paul, oun Magdalen,
lwo dariji won,
Mo ti kaa, mo gbagbo pe,
O ti dariji mi.
(Amin).

title_english: Salvation though, Salvation though
passage_english: WHAT MUST I DO TO BE SAVED? ACTS 16:30
passage_yoruba:
KINNI KI EMI KI O SE LATI LA?" –
ISE 16:30
verses_english:
Salvation though, Salvation though,
The sinner doth desire,
From all the evil of our heart,
We’re condemned and perish.

The sinful acts we perpetrate,
Speaks audibly always,
No salvation is found there.
Of Salvation nay of work.

We sacrifice and still appease,
We sing and still we danced,
But no salvation there is found,
In all but all in vain.

Where else can salvation be found,
Reveal Reveal to us,
Above the sky beneath the sea,
Reveal though if you know.

Christ Jesus is Saviour divine,
Christ Jesus is our Lord Upon,
His hand salvation lie,
For unto us sinners.

Draw nigh to Him with your requests,
Whole love is found in Him,
Foulest sinners like thou He calls,
Salvation come receive.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Igbala ni, igbala,
Awa elese n fe,
Nitori ninu buburu,
T‘a se l‘awa n segbe.

lse owo wa ti a n se,
O n wi nigbagbogbo,
Pe, igbala ko si nibe,
Ise ko le gba ni.

Awa n sebo, awa n rubo,
A n korin, a si n jo,
Sugbon a ko ri igbala,
Ninu gbogbo wonyii.

Nibo ni igbala gbe wa?
Fi han ni, fi han ni,
B’o wa loke, bi isale,
B'o ba mo, wi fun wa.

Jesu ni se Olugbala,
Jesu I'Oluwa wa;
lgbala wa li owo Re,
Fun awa elese.

Wa nisisiyi, wa toro,
lfe wa ninu Re,
Eyin t’o buru l’ O n pe pe,
E wa gba igbala.
(Amin).

title_english: WE love all the earthly stock below
title_yoruba: A wa fe ohun aye yii
passage_english: LOVE NOT THE WORLD. 1JOHN. 2:15
passage_yoruba: E MASE FE AYE. 1JOHN. 2:15
verses_english:
WE love all the earthly stock below, Cherished by lusty eyes,
We love to tarry here on earth,
Sav'ring It‘s deadly chills.

Why covet we in bitter chase,
When sacred home exists,
There shall no sin or evil found,
No peril there abide.

O! what a lux‘y there abound,
There, all our wish to know,
The joy, the love and charity,
Abundant!y is found.

The threat of death and deadly pangs,
Here on earth not in heaven,
The sacred saints in light array,
ln sweet immortal praise.

The holy path of Christ to tread,
Prepar'd abroad for us,
Peaceful, blissful abode on high,
The Sacred throne of God.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
A wa fe ohun aye yii,
Won dara l‘oju wa,
A fe k‘a duro pe titi,
Laifi won sile lo.

Nitori kinni a n se bee?
Aye kan wa loke,
Nibe l'ese oun buburu
Ati ewu ko si.

Aye t’o wa loke orun,
Awa I ba je mo on!
Ayo, ife inu rere,
Gbogbo re wa nibe.

Iku, o wa ni aye yii,
Ko si loke orun,
Eniyan Olorun wa n be,
Ni aaye ni aiku.

K’a ba ona ti Jesu lo,
Eyi t'O la fun wa,
S’ibi rere, sibi sinmi,
S’ile Olorun wa.
(Amin).

title_english: The time of morning and of joy
passage_english: Thy will be done" - Matt. 26:42
passage_yoruba: IFE TIRE NI KI A SE- MATT. 26:42
verses_english:
The time of morning and of joy,
In thine stock do all lay,
My comfort from Thine hand doth come,
In Thine command forth go.

If Thou will from me to retrieve,
I shall never be crossed,
When all yet I nay doth possess,
All but Thine possession.

Nay not ever will I blaspheme,
If the earth fly away,
Eternal joy I shall all seek,
From Thee and Thee alone.

The earth and its fullness of nought,
All but bitter savour,
Much as I would the flower to reap,
But Thorn all that I met.

Perfect joy nay is here to find,
Honey ladden with gall,
Amidst all changing tides of life,
Be Thou my all in all.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
lgba aro ati ayo,
Lowo Re ni o wa,
Itunu mi t'owo Re wa,
O si lo l’ase Re.

Bi O fe gba won lowo mi,
Emi ki o binu,
Ki emi ki o to ni won,
Tire ni won ti se.

Emi ki yoo so buburu,
B’ aye tile fo lo;
Emi o w'ayo ailopin,
Ni odo Re nikan.

Ki l’aye ati ekun re?
Adun kikoro ni
‘Gbati mo fe ja itanna,
Mo b’egun esusu.

Pipe ayo ko si nihin,
Ororo da l’oyin,
Laarin gbogbo ayida yii,
‘Wo ma se gbagbe mi.
(Amin).

title_english: Miserable sinner poor I am
passage_english: be merciful to me a sinner! Luke 18:13
passage_yoruba: Saanu fun mi, emi elese. luku 18:13
verses_english:
Miserable sinner poor I am
A mighty loving friend I have
Saviour of this world is His name
Limitless is His love to us.

He sees me as a wanderer
He brought me into His sheepfold
With His pure blood He redeemed me
He vanquish’d all my foes for me.

He gave me joy of heart in that
Shortly from now I know I’ll be
With Him on His high Throne above
Immeasurable grace is this.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Otosi elese ni mi,
Mo l’ore Alagbara kan,
Olugbala l’oruko Re;
Ife Tire ko nipekun.

O ri mo sina kakiri,
O mu mi wo agbo Re wa,
O fie je mimo ra mi,
O si segun ota fun mi.

O mu okan mi yo wipe,
Nisisiyi l’emi o wa
Pelu Re l’ori ’te l’orun;
Oore- ofe yii ti po to!
(Amin).

title_english: The One who made the blind to see
passage_english:
WHO HEALETH ALL THY DISEASES.
PSALM 103:3
passage_yoruba: ENITI O SI TAN GBOGBO ARUN RE " ORIN DAFIDI 103:3
verses_english:
The One who made the blind to see,
And made the simple wise,
And He who the light created,
For all in darkness dwell.

The One who can give strength and health,
To the infirm and sick,
And He who can bring back to life,
The ones who once were dead.

The One who deliverance bestow'd,
And mixed him that did fall,
And changed the sorrow of today,
To songs and Psalms of praise.

Thou great physician of my soul,
To Thee we our song raise,
For ever more, world without end,
Thine e’er will be the praise.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Enit‘o la ‘ju afoju,
Ti O mu ope gbon,
At’enit'O da imole,
Fun eni okunkun.

Enit'O le fi agbara,
F’awon olokunrun,
Ti O si fi emi iye,
Fun awon to ti ku.

Eni fi ‘dasile f'okan,
T'O gb’eni subu n de,
T’O si pa ibanuje da,
S’orin pelu iyin.

‘Wo Onisegun okan mi,
Si O l’awa n korin,
Titi aye o fi d’opin,
Tire l’ope O se.
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, and shall it ever be
title_yoruba: Jesu, O ha le je bee pe
passage_english: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me ….. of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed. Matt. 8:28
passage_yoruba: Enikeni ti o ba tiju mi, Omo eniyan yio tiju re pelu.  Matt. 8:38
verses_english:
Jesus, and shall it ever be, 
A mortal man ashamed of Thee, 
Ashamed of Thee, whose Angels praise, 
Whose glories shine through endless days?

Ashamed of Jesus! – just as soon 
Let midnight be ashamed of noon; 
‘Tis midnight with my soul till He, 
Bright morning star, bid darkness flee.

Ashamed of Jesus, that dear friend 
On whom my hopes of Heaven depend! 
No! when I blush, be this my shame, 
That I no more revere His name.

Ashamed of Jesus! – yes I may, 
When I’ve no guilt to wash away, 
No tear to wipe, no good to crave, 
No fears to quell, no soul to save.

Till then – nor is my boasting vain – 
Till then I boast a Saviour slain; 
And oh may this my glory be, 
That Jesus is not ashamed of me! 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, O ha le je bee pe
Ki eni kiku tiju Re
Tiju Re! ‘Wo t‘Angeli n yin,
Ogo Eni n ran titi lae.

Ki n tiju Jesu! O ya se
Ki a le tiju irawo;
Oun ni n tan imole orun
S’ inu okan okunkun mi.

Ki n tiju Jesu! Ore ni,
Eni mo n wo lati d‘orun!
Ewoo onigba mo ba n tiju,
Ki n ye bowo f’oruko Re ko?

Ki n tiju Jesu! Emi le,
Bi n ko l‘ese lati wenu,
Ti n ko ni toro ire kan,
Ti nko l’okan lati gbala.

Bi beeko-mo n hale lasan,
Lasan ko l‘Olugbala ku
A! k‘eyii je isogo mi
Pe, Jesu ko si tiju mi
(Amin).

title_english: Pass me not, O gentle Savior
passage_english: THAT WHOSOEVER SHALL CALL ON THE NAME OF THE LORD SHALL BE DELIVERED. JOEL 2:32
passage_yoruba: enikeni ti o pe oruko oluwa, a o gba la joeli 2:32.
verses_english:
Let me at thy throne of mercy
find a sweet relief;
kneeling there in deep contrition,
help my unbelief.

Trusting only in thy merit,
would I seek thy face;
heal my wounded, broken spirit,
save me by thy grace.

Thou the spring of all my comfort,
more than life to me,
whom have I on earth beside thee?
Whom in heaven but thee?
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ma koja mi, Olugbala
Gbo adura mi;
‘Gbat‘ Iwo ba n p‘ elomiran,
Mase koja mi.

Chorus:
Jesu! Jesu! Gbo adura mi
‘Gbat‘ Iwo ba n p'elomiran,
Mase koju mi.

N‘ite aanu, Je k‘emi ri
Itura didun,
Teduntedun ni mo wole
Joo, ran mi lowo

N‘igbekele itoye Re
L‘em‘ o w‘oju Re;
Wo ‘banuje okan mi san,
F’ ife Re gba mi.

‘Wo orisun itunu mi,
Ju ‘ye fun mi lo,
Tani mo ni laye lorun
Bikose iwo?
(Amin).

title_english: Loving Saviour, hear my cry
passage_english: HEAR MY PRAYER, O LORD, AND LET MY CRY COME UNTO THEE. PS. 102:1
passage_yoruba: Gbo adura mi, oluwa si je ki igbe mi ki o wa sode re. ps. 102.1
verses_english:
Loving Saviour, hear my cry,
Hear my cry, hear my cry;
Trembling to Thine arms I fly:
O save me at the Cross!
I have sinn'd, but Thou hast died,
Thou hast died, Thou hast died;
In Thy mercy let me hide:
O save me at the Cross!

Chorus:
Lord Jesus, receive me,
No more would I grieve Thee,
Now, blessed Redeemer,
O save me at the Cross!

Tho' I perish I will pray,
I will pray, I will pray;
Thou of life the Living Way:
O save me at the Cross!
Thou hast said Thy grace is free,
Grace is free, grace is free:
Have compassion, Lord on me:
O save me at the Cross!

Wash me in Thy cleansing blood,
Cleansing blood, cleansing blood;
Plunge me now beneath the flood:
O save me at the Cross!
Only faith will pardon bring,
Pardon bring, pardon bring:
In that faith to Thee I cling:
O save me at the Cross!

Chorus:
Lord Jesus, receive me,
No more would I grieve Thee,
Now, blessed Redeemer,
O save me at the Cross!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Olugbala, gbohun mi
Gbohun mi, gbohun mi,
Mo wa sodo Re, gbami,
Nibi agbelebu
Emi se, sugbon, O ku;
Iwo ku, Iwo ku,
Fi aanu Re pa mi mo
Nibi agbelebu,

Chorus:
Oluwa, joo gba mi,
Nk’ yoo bi O ninu mo!
Alabukun, gba mi
Nibi agbelebu.

Bi un o ba tile segbe
Un o bebe! Un o bebe!
Iwo li Ona iye,
Nibi agbelebu,
Oore-ofe Re t‘a gba,
Lofe ni! Lofe ni;
F‘oju aanu Re wo mi,
N‘ibi agbelebu.

F‘eje mimo Re we mi,
Fi we mi! Fi we mi!
Ri mi sinu ibu Re,
Nibi agbelebu
‘Gbagbo l‘o le fun wa ni
Dariji! Dariji!
Mo f‘igbagbo ro mo O
N‘ibi agbelebu.

Chorus:
Oluwa, joo gba mi,
Nk’ yoo bi O ninu mo!
Alabukun, gba mi
Nibi agbelebu.
(Amin).

title_english: Great King of nations, hear our prayer
passage_english: LORD, HEAR; O LORD, FORGIVE. DANIEL 9:10
passage_yoruba: OLUWA GBO, OLUWA DARIJI. DANIEL 9:19
verses_english:
Great King of nations, hear our prayer,
While at your feet we fall,
And humbly, with united cry,
To you for mercy call,
The guilt is ours, but grace is yours,
O turn us not away;
But hear us from your lofty throne,
And help us when we pray.

Our fathers' sins were manifold,
And ours no less we own,
Yet wondrously from age to age
Your goodness has been shown.
When dangers, like a stormy sea,
Beset our country round,
To you we looked, to you we cried,
And help in you was found.

With one consent we meekly bow
Beneath your chast'ning hand,
And, pouring forth confession meet,
Mourn with our mourning land.
With pitying eye behold our need,
As thus we lift our pray'r;
Correct us with your judgments, Lord,
Then let your mercy spare.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ese awon baba wa po,
Tiwa ko si kere
Sugbon lati irandiran
L‘O ti f‘oore Re han
Nigba ewu, b‘omi jija
Yi ilu wa yii ka,
Iwo l‘a wo, t‘a si kepe;
K‘a maa ri ‘ranwo Re.

L‘ohun kan gbogbo wa wole
Labe ibawi Re;
Gbogbo wa n jewo ese wa,
A n gbaawe fun ‘le wa,
F‘oju aanu wo aini wa
Bi a ti n kepe O;
Fi idajo Re ba wa wi,
Da wa si l‘aanu Re.
(Amin).

title_english: Oh! How we Thine people oh Lord
passage_english: LET NOT THOSE WHO SEEK THAT BE CONFOUNDED - PSALM. 69:6
passage_yoruba: Mase je ki awon ti n wa O ki o daamu” – ORIN DAFIDI 69:6
verses_english:
Oh! How we Thine people oh Lord
Bow down before Thine feet,
Thine abundant mercies O! Lord,
Is all and all our trust.

Thine judgement dreadful awful,
Revealeth all Thine power,
Yet our nation by mercy is saved,
And all by faith we pray.

God by what merit art we saved,
We all wretched ingrates,
Thine warnings let us hark we plead,
When Thine mercies abound.

Our wickedness of great degree Overwhelming our land,
Wickedness of our land so great,
Behold how great it is.

Oh Lord we plead Thee just by grace,
May all our souls repent,
May we unto Thine Word harken,
And Thine face may we seek.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Woo bi awa enia Re,
Ti wole l'ese Re;
Olorun! Kiki aanu Re,
Ni igbekele wa.

ldajo t'o ba ni leru,
N fi agbara Re han;
Sibe, aanu da ‘lu wa si,
Awa si n gbadura.

Olorun, o se da wa si,
Awa alaimoore?
Joo, je k‘a gbo ikilo Re,
Nigbati aanu wa.

lwa buburu ti po to,
Yika ile wa yii!
'Buburu ile wa lo to ‘yii,
Woo b’o ti buru to.

Oluwa, fi oore-ofe,
Yi wa l’okan pada!
Ki a le gba oro Re gbo,
K’a si wa oju Re.
(Amin).

title_english: O word of words the sweetest
passage_english: COME UNTO ME, ALL YE THAT LABOUR AND ARE HEAVY LADEN. MATT. 11:28
passage_yoruba: wa sodo mi gbogbo eyin ti n sise, ti a si di eru wiwo le lori. matt. 11:28
verses_english:
O word of words the sweetest,
In which by faith
All promise, all fulfilment,
And end of mystery;
Lamenting or rejoicing,
With doubt or terror nigh,
I hear the “Come!” of Jesus,
And to His cross I fly.

Chorus:
Come, oh come to Me,
Come, oh come to Me,
Weary, heavy laden,
Come, oh come to Me.

O soul! why shouldst thou wander
From such a loving Friend?
Cling closer, closer to Him,
Stay with Him to the end.
Alas! I am so helpless,
So very full of sin,
For I am ever wand’ring,
And coming back again.

O each time draw me nearer,
That soon the “Come” may be
Naught but a gentle whisper,
To one close, close to Thee;
Then, over sea and mountain,
Far from or near my home,
I’ll take Thy hand and follow,
At that sweet whisper “Come!”
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
‘Wo oro t’ odun julo,
Ninu eyii t’a ri
Ileri at’ imuse
Awamaridi ni.
Nigba ekun at‘ayo,
‘Yemeji at'eru,
Mo gbo Jesu wipe, "Wa"
Mo si lo sodo Re.

Emi mi, ma sako lo
Kuro lod‘Ore yii,
Sunmo On, a! Sunmo On
Baa gbe titi d‘opin;
A! Alailera l’ emi,
Ese mi papoju
Mo n’ sako nigba gbogbo;
Mo si tun pada wa.

Maa fa mi sunm’ odo Re
Ki “Wa yii ba le je”
Ohun ti a fo jeejee
F‘eni t‘o sunmo O;
Okun ati oke nla,
Ki yio da mi duro,
Lati di owo Re mu,
Nigbat’ O wipe, “Wa”
(Amin).

title_english: I am Thine, O Lord, I have heard Thy voice
passage_english: DRAW ME, WE WILL RUN AFTER THEE. SONG OF SOLOMON 1:4
passage_yoruba: fa mi, awa o sare to o. orin solomon 1:4
verses_english:
I am Thine, O Lord, I have heard Thy voice,
And it told Thy love to me;
But I long to rise in the arms of faith
And be closer drawn to Thee.

Chorus:
Draw me nearer, nearer blessèd Lord,
To the cross where Thou hast died.
Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer blessèd Lord,
To Thy precious, bleeding side.

Consecrate me now to Thy service, Lord,
By the power of grace divine;
Let my soul look up with a steadfast hope,
And my will be lost in Thine.

O the pure delight of a single hour
That before Thy throne I spend,
When I kneel in prayer, and with Thee, my God
I commune as friend with friend!

There are depths of love that I cannot know
Till I cross the narrow sea;
There are heights of joy that I may not reach
Till I rest in peace with Thee.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, emi sa ti gbohun Re,
Oun n so ife Re si mi;
Sugbon mo fe n de l’apa igbagbo
Ki n le tubo sunmo O.

Chorus:
Fa mi mora, mora, Oluwa,
Sib’ gbelebu t’O ku.
Fa mi mora, mora, Oluwa
Sib’ eje Re t’o n’ iye.

Ya mi si mimo fun ise Tire,
Nipa oore-ofe Re;
Je ki n fi okan igbagbo w’oke,
K’ife mi si je Tire.

A! Ayo mimo ti wakati kan
Ti mo lo nib’ite Re,
’Gba mo ngbadura, si  O Olorun,
Ti a soro bi ore!

Ijinle ife n be ti n ko le mo
Titi un o fi koja odo;
Ayo giga ti emi ko le so
Titi un o fi de ’sinmi.
(Amin).

title_english: Ye servants of the Lord
passage_english: TEACHING THEM TO OBSERVE ALL THINGS. MATT. 28:20
passage_yoruba: E MAA KO WON LATI MAA KIYESI OHUN GBOGBO. MATT. 28:20.
verses_english:
Ye servants of the Lord
Hear ye the Master's call;
Follow where ever He leads you
He calls you to His way.

The Father you worship
Has the power to bestow;
With complete trust in His promise
Fight manfully like men.

Go, manifest the Lord
Also His great mercy
Among the miserable sinners
Of Adam's fallen race.

In the name of our Lord
We will wish you `God speed`
We pray Him who has sent you out
To prosper all your work.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Eyin ‘ranse Kristi,
Gbo ohun ipe Re:
E tele ‘bi t’o fona han,
A n pe yin s’ona Re.

Baba ti eyin n sin,
O n’ipa to fun yin;
N ‘igbekele ileri Re,
E ja bi okunrin.

Lo f‘Olugbala han,
Ati aanu nla Re.
F‘awon otosi elese.
Ninu omo Adam‘.

L‘oruko Jesu wa,
A ki yin, “Ona re!”
A n be Enit‘ o ran yin lo,
K‘o busi ise yin.
(Amin).

title_english: Grace! 'tis a charming sound
title_yoruba:
Oore-ofe! ohun
Adun ni l‘eti wa
passage_english: THE GRACE OF OUR LORD JESUS CHRIST BE WITH YOU. 1 COR. 16:23
passage_yoruba: k’oore-ofe jesu krist oluwa wa, ki o pelu gbogbo yin. 1 kor. 16:23
verses_english:
Grace! 'tis a charming sound,
Harmonious to the ear;
Heav'n with the echo shall resound,
And all the earth shall hear.

Chorus:
Saved by grace alone!
This is all my plea:
Jesus died for all mankind,
And Jesus died for me.

'Twas grace that wrote my name
In Thy eternal book;
'Twas grace that gave me to the Lamb,
Who all my sorrows took,

Grace taught my wand'ring feet
To tread the heav'nly road;
And new supplies each hour I meet,
While pressing on to God.

Grace taught my soul to pray
And made mine eyes o'erflow;
'Twas grace which kept me to this day,
And will not let me go.

Oh, let Thy grace inspire
My soul with strength Divine!
My all my powers to Thee aspire,
And all my days be Thine.

Chorus:
Saved by grace alone!
This is all my plea:
Jesus died for all mankind,
And Jesus died for me.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oore-ofe! ohun
Adun ni l‘eti wa;
Gbohun-gbohun re yoo gba orun kan
Aye o gbo pelu.

Chorus:
Oore-ofe sa
N‘igbekele mi,
Jesu ku fun araye,
O ku fun mi pelu.

Oore-ofe lo ko
Oruko mi l‘orun
L‘o fi mi fun Odagutan,
T‘o gba iya mi je.

Oore-Ofe to mi
S‘ona alaafia,
O n toju mi lojojumo
Ni irin ajo mi.

Oore-ofe ko mi
Bi a ti ‘gbadura;
O pa mi mo titi d‘oni,
Ko si je ki n sako.

Je k‘ oore-ofe yii
F‘agbara f’okan mi;
Ki n le fi gbogbo ipa mi
At‘ ojo mi fun O.

Chorus:
Ore-Ofe sa
N‘igbekele mi,
Jesu ku fun araye,
O ku fun mi pelu.
(Amin).

title_english: Sing them over again to me
title_yoruba: E tun won ko fun mi, ki n gbo
passage_english: SEARCH THE SCRIPTURES; FOR IN THEM YE THINK YE HAVE ETERNAL LIFE. JOHN 5:39
passage_yoruba: e maa wa inu iwe mimo, nitori ninu won l’eyin ni iye ainipekun. john 5:39
verses_english:
Sing them over again to me,
Wonderful words of Life;
Let me more of their beauty see,
Wonderful words of Life;
Words of life and beauty
Teach me faith and duty:
Beautiful words, wonderful words,
Wonderful words of Life,
Christ, the blessed One, gives to all,
Wonderful words of Life;
Sinner, list to the loving call,
Wonderful words of Life.
All so freely given,
Wooing us to Heaven:
Beautiful words, wonderful words,
Wonderful words of Life,

Sweetly echo the Gospel call,
Wonderful words of Life;
Offer pardon and peace to all,
Wonderful words of Life.
Jesus, only Saviour,
Sanctify for ever:
Beautiful words, wonderful words,
Wonderful words of Life,
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
E tun won ko fun mi, ki n gbo
Oro ‘yanu t‘ Iye!
Je ki n si tun ewu won ri
Oro ‘yanu t‘ Iye!
Oro iye ati’ ewa
Ti nko mi n’igbagbo
Oro didun! Oro ‘yanu
Oro ‘yanu t’ Iye.

Kristi nikan lo n fi fun ni;
Oro ‘yanu t‘iye!
Elese gbo ‘pe ife naa,
Oro ‘yanu t‘iye;
L‘ofe la fi fun wa
K’ ole to wa s‘orun.
Oro didun! Oro ‘yanu
Oro ‘yanu t’ Iye.

Gbe ohun ihinrere naa,
Oro ‘yanu t‘iye
F’igbala lo gbogbo eniyan,
Oro ‘yanu t‘iye
Jesu Olugbala
We wa mo titi lae!
Oro didun! Oro ‘yanu
Oro ‘yanu t’ Iye.
(Amin).

title_english: Master, speak! Thy servant heareth
title_yoruba: Maa wi, ‘tori ranse Re n gbo
passage_english: THEN SAMUEL ANSWERED, SPEAK; FOR THY SERVANT HEARETH. I SAMUEL 3:10
passage_yoruba: nigbana ni samueli dahun pe, maa wi; nitori ti iranse re n gbo. i sam 3:10
verses_english:
Master, speak! Thy servant heareth,
Waiting for Thy gracious word,
Longing for Thy voice that cheereth;
Master! let it now be heard.
I am listening, Lord, for Thee:
What hast Thou to say to me?

Speak to me by name, O Master,
Let me know it is to me;
Speak, that I may follow faster,
With a step more firm and free,
Where the Shepherd leads the flock,
In the shadow of the rock.

Master, speak! Though least and lowest,
Let me not unheard depart;
Master, speak! For O, Thou knowest
All the yearning of my heart,
Knowest all its truest need:
Speak! and make me blest indeed.

Master, speak! and make me ready,
When Thy voice is truly heard,
With obedience glad and steady
Still to follow every word.
I am listening, Lord, for Thee:
Master, speak! O, speak to me!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Maa wi, pe mi, Oluwa mi,
Je ki n le mo ohun Re:
Maa wi, ki n yara tele O,
Ki n sun m ‘O girigiri
Nibiti O n to agbo Re;
Labe ibi itura.

Maa wi, yala l‘ohun jeje
Ma je k‘emi lo laigbo;
Maa wi, Oluwa, Iwo mo
Gbogbo ero okan mi,
Iwo mo ohun ti mo fe
So mi di eni ‘bukun.

Maa wi, je ki emi mura
Bi mo ba ti gbohun Re;
Pelu ‘gboran ati ayo,
Ni ki n fi te l‘oro Re
Mo teti sile Oluwa
Maa wi, Oluwa maa wi
(Amin).

title_english: My trust I place now and ever
title_yoruba: Mo fi gbogbo okan mi tan
passage_english: JESUS SAID UNTO HIM, THOU SHALT LOVE THE LORD THY GOD WITH ALL THY HEART, AND WITH ALL THY SOUL, AND WITH ALL THY MIND. MATTHEW 22:37
passage_yoruba: Jesu si wi fun won pe, ki iwo ki o fi gbogbo aya re ati gbogbo okan re ati gbogbo inu re fe olorun oluwa re. matt. 22:37
verses_english:
My trust I place now and ever
In One my soul can deliver,
A Refuge strong failing never,
For His Word is sure

Chorus:
I am Alpha and Omega,
The beginning and the ending,
Which is and which was,
And which is to come
I am Alpha and Omega
The beginning and the ending
The Almighty, the Almighty,`
Saith the Lord.

My heart with joy now is telling
Of Him who finds there a dwelling,
Whose love is gently compelling,
On his word to rest.

Jehovah, God! Still attend me,
From doubt and fear still defend me
Faith to sustain ever send me,
That my soul fail not.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo fi gbogbo okan mi tan
Enit‘o le gb‘emi mi la,
Aabo nla ti ki ye laelae
Oro Re daju.

Chorus:
Em’ ni Alfa, at‘Omega,
Ipilese ati opin,
Ti O wa to ti wa,
Ti O si n bo wa,
Em’ ni Alfa, at‘Omega,
Ipilese ati opin
Olodumare, Olodumare
L‘Oluwa wi.

Okan mi n so pelu ayo.
Ti eniti n gbe inu mi,
Ife ‘niti n tel’oro Re.
Lati mu un duro.

Jehofa, Olorun, gba mi
Lowo ‘yemeji at‘eru;
Fi ‘gbagbo gbigbona fun mi,
K‘okan mi duro.
(Amin).

title_english: The God who led His people thro' the parted sea
title_yoruba: Oluwa to mu Israeli la okun ja
passage_english: AND THE CHILDREN OF ISRAEL WENT INTO THE MIDST OF THE SEA UPON THE DRY GROUND. EXODUS 14:22
passage_yoruba: awon omo israeli si lo sinu aarin okun ni ile gbigbe. eksd. 14:22.
verses_english:
The God who led His people thro' the parted sea,
And from Egyptian bondage set His children free,
Who rain'd down bread from heaven all the pilgrim way
is the God to whom I pray.

Chorus:
Just the same today, just the same today,
As when He led His children thro' the sea,
His trustful child l'll be, For in His word I see,
The God who doeth wonders,
Is just the same today.

The God who rescued Daniel from the lion's den,
And from the fiery furnace sav'd the three young men,
Who speaks, and constellations will His voice obey
Is the God to whom I pray.

The God who stills the tempest with a word divine,
And on the clouds of sorrow, makes His rainbows shine,
Who from the tomb of Jesus rolled the stone away,
Is the God to whom I pray.

The God who clothes the lily in its robe of snow,
Who in the barren desert makes His rivers flow,
The God who lifts the sinner from the miry clay,
Is the God to whom I pray.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa to mu Israeli la okun ja,
Ti o si gba won kuro li oko eru,
Ti o n ro ‘jo ounje sile lati orun,
Oun ni mo n gbadura si.

Chorus:
Okannaa loni, okannaa loni
Bakan naa ni Olorun ti mo n gbadura si
B’ akoko t’ O sin Israeli la okun ja,
Omo Re ni un o je, ‘tori oro Re so,
Pe, okannaa ni Olorun iyanu loni.

Olorun t’ O gba Daniel lowo kiniun,
T’o si yo awon meta n’nu ina ileru,
Eniti awon irawo n gba Tire gbo,
Oun ni mo n gbadura si.

Olorun to f’ oro Re da afefe duro,
To si so ‘banuje oni ‘dayo lola,
Eniti o yi okuta ‘boji kuro,
Oun ni mo n gbadura si.

Olorun to wo itanna igbe laso,
Eniti o si mu omi san l’aginju,
To we elese mo ninu eeri re,
Oun ni mo n gbadura si.
(Amin).

title_english: There is a fountain filled with blood.
title_yoruba: Isun kan wa to kun feje
passage_english: IN THAT DAY THERE SHALL BE A FOUNTAIN OPENED TO THE HOUSE OF DAVID AND TO THE INHABITANTS OF JERUSALEM FOR SIN AND FOR UNCLEANNESS. ZECHARIAH 13:1
passage_yoruba:
LI OJO NAA ISUN KAN YIO SI SILE FUN ILE DAFIDI ATI FUN AWON ARA JERUSALEMU, FUN ESE ATI FUN IWA AIMO. SEKARIAH
13:1
verses_english:
There is a fountain filled with blood
Drawn from Immanuel's veins;
And sinners, plunged beneath that flood,
Lose all their guilty stains:

Chorus:
He was wounded for our transgressions,
He was bruised for our iniquites,
The chastisement of our peace was upon Him,
And with His stripes we are heal'd
He was wounded for our transgressions,
And with His stripes we are heal'd,
With His stripes we are heal'd.

The dying thief rejoiced to see
That fountain in his day;
And there may I, though vile as he,
Wash all my sins away

Thou dying Lamb, Thy precious blood
Shall never lose its power
Till all the ransomed church of God
Be saved, to sin no more.

Then in a nobler, sweeter song
I'll sing Thy pow'r to save:
When this poor, lisping, stamm'ring tongue.
Lies silent in the grave.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Isun kan wa to kun feje,
To t ‘iha Jesu yo;
Elese m’ookun ninu re,
O bo ninu ebi.

Chorus:
A saa logbe, ‘tori ‘rekoja,
A si paa lara, tori ese wa,
Ina alaafia wa n be lara Re
Ina Re lo n wo wa san;
A sa l‘ogbe tori ‘rekoja,
Ina Re lo n wo wa san,
Ina Re n wo wa san.

Ole ni lor‘agbelebu,
Yo lati ri ‘sun naa,
Bi mo kun f’ese bi tire,
Mo le we n‘nu eje naa.

Gba mo fi’gbagbo ri ‘sun naa,
Ti n san fun eje Re
Irapada d‘orin fun mi,
Ti un o maa ko titi.

Agbara ti o wa n‘n‘ eje yii,
Yoo wa titi laelae,
Tit‘awon eni ‘rapada,
Yoo bo sinu ogo.
Amin.

title_english: We are never never weary of the grand old song;
title_yoruba: Ko su wa lati maa ko orin ti igbani
passage_english:
Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.
JOHN 14:1
passage_yoruba:
E mase jeki okan yin daru, e gba olorun gbo, e gba mi gbo pelu.
John 14:1
verses_english:
Chorus:
O the children of the Lord have a right to shout and sing
For the way is growing bright, and our souls are on the wing
We are going by and by to the palace of the king;
Glory to God, Hallelujah!

We are lost amid the rapture of redeeming love,
Glory to God, Hallelujah
We are rising on its pinions to the hills above;
Glory to God, Hallelujah!

We are going to the palace that is built of gold
Glory to God Hallelujah!
Where the King in all His splendour we shall soon behold
Glory to God, Hallelujah!

There we’ll shout redeeming mercy in a glad new song,
Glory to God, Hallelujah!
There we’ll sing the praise of Jesus with the blood-wash’d throng,
Glory to God, Hallelujah!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ko su wa lati maa ko orin ti igbani
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya,
A le fi igbagbo k’orin naa soke kikan
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya!

Chorus:
Omo olorun ni eto lati maa bu s’ayo
Pe ona yii n ye wa si,
Okan wa n saferi Re
Nigbose a o de afin Oba wa Ologo,
Ogo f’Olorun, Halleluya!

Awa n be n’nu ibu ife t’o ra wa pada,
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya!
Awa yoo fi iye goke lo soke orun
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya!

Awa n lo si afin kan ti a fi wura ko,
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya!
Nibiti ao ri Oba Ogo n’nu ewa Re
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya!

Nibe a o korin titun t’aanu to da wa n de
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya!
Nibe awon ayanfe yoo korin, yin Kristi
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya!.
(Amin).

title_english: There's One above all earthly friends
passage_english: BUT WITH THE PRECIOUS BLOOD OF CHRIST, AS OF A LAMB WITHOUT BLEMISH AND WITHOUT SPOT. 1 PETER 1:19
passage_yoruba: BIKOSE EJE IYEBIYE, BI TI ODO-AGUNTAN TI KO LI ABUKU, TI KO SI LI ABAWON, ANI EJE KRISTI. 1 PETERU 1:19
verses_english:
There's One above all earthly friends
Whose love all earthly love transcends,
It is my Lord and Christ divine,
My Lord because, I know He's mine.

Chorus:
I know He's mine, this friend so dear,
He lives with me He's ever near;
Ten thousand charms, around Him shine,
And, best of all, I know He's mine.

He's mine because He died for me
He saved my soul, He set me free,
With joy I worship at His shrine,
And cry, `Praise God,` I know He's mine.

He's mine because He's in my heart,
And never, never will we part,
Just as the branch is to the vine,
I'm joined to Christ, I know He's mine.

Some day upon the street of gold
Mine eyes His glory shall behold
Then while His arms around me twine,
I'll cry for joy, `I know He's mine.`
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Kristi mimo, Oluwa mi,
Ife Re ju t‘araye lo;
Ore otito li O je
Mo mo pe Oluwa mi ni,

Chorus:
Oun je t‘emi, Ore mi owon,
O n ba mi gbe nigba-gbogbo;
Ogo didan wa yi ka,
Ju gbogbo re, Oun je temi.

Temi ni O sa ku fun mi,
O gba mi, O si da mi n‘de,
Pelu ayo ni mo n ke pe,
Ogo ni fun Olorun mi.

Temi ni O n gbe okan mi
A ki yoo pinya tit‘aye,
Bi eka l‘ara ajara
Beeni mo je lara Kristi.

Lojo kan n’ ilu didan ni,
Oju mi yoo ri ogo Re;
Nigbana un o ro mo l‘orun,
Un o fo f‘ayo p‘On je t‘emi.
(Amin).

title_english: Once I fought to conquer sin,
passage_english: BUT HE WAS WOUNDED FOR OUR TRANSGRESSIONS, HE WAS BRUISED FOR OUR INIQUITIES: THE CHASTISEMENT OF OUR PEACE WAS UPON HIM; AND WITH HIS STRIPES WE ARE HEALED. ISAIAH 53:5.
passage_yoruba: sugbon a sa li ogbe nitori irekoja wa, a pa a li ara nitori aisedede wa; ina alaafia wa wa lara re, ati nipa ina re li a fi mu wa larada. isaiah 53:5.
verses_english:
Chorus:
He took my sins away,
Took them all away,
Christ the Saviour took my sins away,
Contentment fills my soul,
His spirit has control,
Since Jesus took my sins away.

O the wonder working pow'r,
In that happy, blessed hour
When my Saviour spoke to me,
And I heard the precious word
From this wonder working Lord,
When from sin He set me free.

Are you struggling for the right,
Jesus has the power and might;
He will help you conquer sin;
He will take its pow'r away,
He will come with you to stay
And He will give you peace within
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Lekan mo ba ese ja,
‘Gbat‘o n joba l‘okan mi;
Tit‘Olugbala fi de
O si segun gbogbo won
Nigbat‘ O gbo ebe mi
O si ko ese mi lo.

Chorus:
O ko ese mi lo,
O ko gbogbo re,
Kristi Jesu ko ese mi lo,
Itelorun ti de,
Emi Re ti bori
Bi Jesu ti k ‘ese mi lo.

Agbara ise ‘yanu
Ni wakati didun naa
Ti Jesu ba mi soro,
Mo gboro ‘yebiye naa
Lati enu Oluwa mi
‘Gbati O da mi ni de.

Iwo n ja fun rere bi?
Jesu ni gbogbo ipa
Yoo segun ese fun o.
Oun yoo gba agbara re,
Oun yoo si ba O gbe
Yoo si fun o ni ‘sinmi.
(Amin).

title_english: When upon life's billows you are tempest tossed
title_yoruba: Nigbati ‘gbi aye yii ba n yi lu O
passage_english: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.Matt. 14:27
passage_yoruba: Sugbon loju kanna ni jesu wi fun won pe, e tujuka, emi ni; e ma beru. Matt. 14:2
verses_english:
When upon life's billows you are tempest tossed,
When you are discouraged, thinking all is lost,
Count your many blessings, name them one by one,
And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done.

Are you ever burdened with a load of care?
Does the cross seem heavy you are called to bear?
Count your many blessings, ev'ry doubt will fly,
And you will be singing as the days go by.

When you look at others with their lands and gold,
Think that Christ has promised you His wealth untold;
Count your many blessings, money cannot buy
Your reward in heaven, nor your home on high.

So, amid the conflict, whether great or small,
Do not be discouraged, God is over all;
Count your many blessings, angels will attend,
Help and comfort give you to your journey's end.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Nigbati ‘gbi aye yii ba n yi lu O
To si dabi eni pe gbogbo re pin
Ka bukun re, siro won lokookan
Ise Oluwa yoo je yanu fun O

Chorus:
Ka ‘bukun re ka won lokookan
Ka ‘bukun re, wo ‘se Olorun
Ka ‘bukun re ka won lokankan
Ka ‘bukun re wa r’ise t’ Olorun se.

Eru aniyan ha n wo ‘kan re lorun?
Ise t’a pe o si ha soro fun o?
Ka ‘bukun re, ‘yemeji yoo si fo lo
Orin iyin ni yoo si gbenu re kan.

‘Gbat’ o ba n wo awon oloro aye
Ronu oro ti Jesu ti se ‘leri
Ka ibukun re, owo ko le ra won
Ere re l’ orun ati le re l’oke.

Ninu gbogbo ayidayida aye
Mase foya, Olorun tobi julo
Ka ibukun re, awon angeli’ yoo to o
Won yoo si ran o lowo titi dopin.
(Amin).

title_english: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice
title_yoruba: E yo n’nu Oluwa, e yo
passage_english: REJOICE, AND BE EXCEEDING GLAD: FOR GREAT IS YOUR REWARD IN HEAVEN. MATT. 5:12
passage_yoruba:
e maa yo, ki eyin ki o si for fun ayo; nitori ere yin po ni orun.
matt. 5:12
verses_english:
Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice,
All ye that are upright in heart;
And ye that have made Him your choice,
Bid sadness and sorrow depart.

Chorus:
Rejoice, rejoice,
Be glad in the Lord and rejoice;
Rejoice, rejoice,
Be glad in the Lord and rejoice

Be joyful, for He is the Lord,
On earth and in Heaven supreme;
He fashions and rules by His word—
The ‘Mighty’ and ‘Strong’ to redeem.

What though in the conflict for right
Your enemies almost prevail?
God’s armies, just hid from your sight,
Are more than the foes which assail.

Though darkness surround you by day,
Your sky by the night be o’ercast,
Let nothing your spirit dismay,
But trust till the danger is past.

Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice,
His praises proclaiming in song;
With harp and with organ and voice
The loud hallelujahs prolong!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
E yo n’nu Oluwa, e yo
Eyin t’okan re se deedee
Eyin t’o ti yan Oluwa
Le ‘banuje at’ aro lo.

Chorus:
E yo! e yo!
E yo n’nu Oluwa e yo
E yo! E yo!
E yo n’nu Oluwa e yo.

E yo ‘tori Oun l’Oluwa
L’aye ati l’orun pelu
Oro Re bor’ohun gbogbo
O lagbara lati gbala.

Gbati e ba n ja ija rere
Ti ota fere bori yin
Ogun Olorun t’e ko ri
Poju awon ota yin lo.

B’okunkun ti le yi o ka
Pelu isudede gbogbo
Mase je k’okan re damu
Sa gbekel’Oluwa d’opin.

E yo ninu Oluwa, e yo
E korin iyin re kikan
Fi duru ati ohun ko
Halleluya lohun gooro.
(Amin).

title_english: When Jesus comes to reward His servants
title_yoruba: Gba jesu de lati fere fun wa
passage_english: Look, I am coming soon! My reward is with me, and I will give to each person according to what they have done” Rev. 22:12
passage_yoruba: Emi n bo kankan; ere mi si n be pelu mi, lati san an fun olukuluku gegebi ise re yio ti ri” Ifi. 22:12
verses_english:
When Jesus comes to reward His servants,
Whether it be noon or night,
Faithful to Him will He find us watching,
With our lamps all trimmed and bright?

Chorus:
O can we say we are ready, brother?
Ready for the soul’s bright home?
Say, will He find you and me still watching,
Waiting, waiting when the Lord shall come?

If, at the dawn of the early morning,
He shall call us one by one,
When to the Lord we restore our talents,
Will He answer thee—“Well done”?

Have we been true to the trust He left us?
Do we seek to do our best?
If in our hearts there is naught condemns us,
We shall have a glorious rest.

Chorus:
O can we say we are ready, brother?
Ready for the soul’s bright home?
Say, will He find you and me still watching,
Waiting, waiting when the Lord shall come?
(Amen)

Blessèd are those whom the Lord finds watching,
In His glory they shall share;
If He shall at the dawn or midnight,
Will He find us watching there?
verses_yoruba:
Gba jesu de lati fere fun wa
Yala osan tab’ ale,
Yoo ha ba wa, ka maa f’ooto sona
Katupa wa si maa jo

Chorus:
A ha le wipe, a setan ara
Fun ‘le wa didan loke?
Wi yoo ha ba wo at’emi nsona
N sona, n sona gb’Oluwa o de?

N je bo ba je ooro kutukutu,
To ba pe wa ni kokan,,
‘Gbat’ a ba da talenti wa pada,
Yoo ha wi fun o O seun?’’

A ha s’ooto s’eyii, to fi fun wa
Gbogbo ipa wa la n sa
Ti ko ba si da lebi l’okan wa 
‘Sinmi ologo l’ao ni

‘Bukun l’awon ti krist’ ri t’o nsona
Won o pin nin’ ogo Re;
Bi laaro tabi oganjo oru
Yoo ha ba wa be n sona

Chorus:
A ha le wipe, a setan ara
Fun ‘le wa didan loke?
Wi yoo ha ba ‘wo at’emi n sona
N sona, n sona gb’Oluwa o de?
(Amin)

title_english: Let me come closer to Thee, Jesus
title_yoruba: Je ki n sunmo O l‘ojojumo
passage_english: A PEOPLE NEAR UNTO HIM. PRAISE YE THE LORD. PSALM 148:14
passage_yoruba: ani awon eniyan ti o sunmo odo re, e fi iyin fun oluwa. orin dafidi 148:14
verses_english:
Let me come closer to Thee, Jesus,
Oh, closer day by day;
Let me lean harder on Thee, Jesus,
Yes, harder all the way.

Let me show forth Thy beauty, Jesus,
Like sunshine on the hills!
Oh, let my lips pour forth Thy sweetness
In joyous, sparkling rills!

Yes, like a fountain, precious Jesus,
Make me and let me be;
Keep me and use me daily, Jesus,
For Thee, for only Thee.

In all my heart and will, O Jesus,
Be altogether King!
Make me a loyal subject, Jesus,
To Thee in every thing.

Thirsting and hung'ring for Thee, Jesus,
With blessed hunger here,
Looking for home on Zion's mountain,
No thirst, no hunger there.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Je ki n sunmo O l‘ojojumo
Jesu Olugbala
Je ki n gbara le O sii, Jesu
Ni gbogbo ona mi.

Je ki n fi ewa Re han Jesu,
Bi oorun l’or’ oke
Je ki ete mi so adun Re,
Pelu ayo tooto,

Je ki n dabi orisun omi,
Jesu Olugbala
Maa lo mi lojojumo Jesu,
Fun ogo Re nikan.

L’okan ati l‘ero mi Jesu,
J‘oba patapata
Je ki n j’eni olooto, Jesu,
Si O l‘ohun gbogbo.

title_english: Ho, reapers in the whitened harvest
passage_english: IN MY FATHER'S HOUSE ARE MANY MANSIONS. JOHN 14:2
passage_yoruba: ninu ile baba mi opolopo ibugbe li o wa. johanu 14:2
verses_english:
Ho, reapers in the whitened harvest
Oft, feeble, faint, and few;
Come, wait upon the blessed Master,
Our strength He will renew.

Chorus
For they that wait upon the Lord
Shall renew their strength;
They shall mount up with wings,
They shall mount up with wings as eagles
They shall run and not be weary
They shall walk and not faint;
They shall run and not be weary
They shall walk and not faint;
They shall run and not be weary
Shall walk and not faint.

Too oft a weary and discouraged,
We pour a sad complaint;
Believing in a living Saviour,
Why should we ever faint?

Rejoice! for He is with us alway,
Lo, even to the end!
Look up! take courage and go forward
All needed grace He'll send!
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
Eyin olukore n’nu oko
T‘aare fere mu tan
E roju duro de Oluwa,
Yoo s‘agbara d'otun.

Chorus:
Awon t‘o duro de Oluwa,
Yoo s‘agbara won d‘otun,
Won o fi iye fo,
Won o fi iye fo bi idi,
Won o sa won ki yoo kaare
Won o rin ki yoo re won
Won o sa won ki yoo kaare
Won o rin ki yoo re won
Won o sa won ki yoo kaare
Yoo rin, ki o re won.

Nigba aare ati ‘rewesi,
A n gbokan wa si O;
Leyin ta gba Olugbala gbo,
Ki l‘a o tun beru.

E yo! O n ba wa gbe lojojo
Ani ‘titi d‘opin;
Woke! E si maa tesiwaju.
Yoo fun yin lagbara.
(Amin).

title_english: There is a Home eternal
passage_english: FOR OUR CONVERSATION IS IN HEAVEN; FROM WHENCE ALSO WE LOOK FOR THE SAVIOUR, THE LORD JESUS CHRIST. PHILIP. 3:20
passage_yoruba: NITORI ILU-IBILE WA N BE LI ORUN LATI IBITI AWA PELU GBE N FOJUSONA FUN OLUGBALA JESU KRISTI OLUWA. FILLIPI 3:20
verses_english:
There is a Home eternal,
Beautiful and bright,
Where sweet joys supernal
Never are dimm’d by night;
White-rob’d angels are singing
Ever around the bright throne;
When, O when shall I see thee,
Beautiful, beautiful Home?

Chorus
Home, Beautiful Home!
Brigh,t beautiful Home!
Home, home of our Saviour,
Bright, beautiful Home!

Flow’rs are ever springing
In that Home so fair,
Thousands of children are singing
Praises to Jesus there;
How they swell the glad anthems
Ever around the bright throne;
When, O when shall I see thee,
Beautiful, beautiful Home?

Soon shall I join that anthem,
Far beyond the sky;
Christ became my ransom,
Why should I fear to die?
Soon my eyes shall behold Him
Seated upon the bright throne;
Then, O then shall I see thee,
Beautiful, beautiful Home?
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ile ailopin kan wa,
To dan to dara
Nib‘ayo pipe wa,
Ko si oru nibe,
Awon Angeli si n korin
Nigbagbogbo yi ‘te ka,
Nigbawo ni un o ri O
Ile didan, didan yii?

Chorus
Ile didan yii,
Ile mimo yii,
Ile igbala wa,
Ibugbe ogo!

Laipe un o dapo mo won
Ni oke orun,
Kristi ni ‘gbala mi
Eese ti un o beru?
Laipe oju mi yoo ri
B‘o ti joko lori ‘te;
‘Gbanaa emi o ri O
Ile didan didan yii.
(Amin).

title_english: Redemption! oh, wonderful story
passage_english: BEFORE THE LORD: FOR HE COMETH, FOR HE COMETH TO JUDGE THE EARTH: HE SHALL JUDGE THE WORLD WITH RIGHTEOUSNESS, AND THE PEOPLE WITH HIS TRUTH. PS 96:13.
passage_yoruba: Nitori oluwa, nitoriti n bowa, nitori ti n bowa se idajo aye: yoo fi ododo se idajo aye, ati ti eniyan ni yoo fi otito re se. ps. 96:13.
verses_english:
Redemption! oh, wonderful story
Glad message for you and for me;
That Jesus has purchased our pardon,
And paid all the debt on the tree.

No longer shall sin have dominion,
Though present to tempt and annoy;
For Christ, in His blessed redemption,
The power of sin shall destroy.
verses_yoruba:
Irapada itan iyanu
Ihin ayo fun gbogbo wa
Jesu ti ra ‘dariji fun wa
O san gbese naa lori ‘gi

Chorus:
A! Elese gba ihin naa gbo
Joo gba ihin ooto naa gbo
Gbeke re le Olugbala re
To mu igbala fun o wa

O mu wa tinu ‘ku bo si ‘ye
O si so wa d’om’Olorun
Orisun kan si fun elese
We nin’eje naa ko si mo

Ese ki yoo le joba wa mo
B’o ti wu ko dan wa wo to
Nitori Kristi fi ‘rapada
Pa ‘gbara ese run fun wa

Gba aanu t’Olorun fi lo o
Sa wa s’odo Jesu loni
‘Tori yoo gb’eni t’o ba too wa
Ki yoo si da pada laelae.
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus is coming! O sing the glad word!
title_yoruba: Jesu  n bo! ko oro ayo naa
passage_english: nAND THE STARS SHALL FALL FROM HEAVEN, AND THE POWERS OF THE HEAVENS SHALL BE SHAKEN. MATT. 24:19.
passage_yoruba: awon irawo oju orun yoo ja sile, ati agbara ti nbe li orun li a o si mi titi. matt 24:29
verses_english:
Jesus is coming! O sing the glad word!
Coming for those He redeemed by His blood,
Coming to reign as the glorified Lord!
Jesus is coming again!

Chorus:
Jesus is coming, is coming again!
Jesus is coming again!
Shout the glad tidings o’er mountain and plain!
Jesus is coming again!

Jesus is coming! The dead shall arise,
Loved ones shall meet in a joyful surprise,
Caught up together to Him in the skies
Jesus is coming again!

Jesus is coming! His saints to release;
Coming to give to the warring earth peace:
Sinning and sighing, and sorrow shall cease.
Jesus is coming again.

Jesus is coming! The promise is true;
Who are the chosen, the faithful, the few,
Waiting and watching, prepared for review?
Jesus is coming again!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu  n bo! ko oro ayo naa,
N bo f‘awon to f’eje Re rapada,
N bo lati joba b‘Oluwa ogo.
Jesu yoo tun pada wa.

Chorus:
Jesu yoo tun wa, yoo tun pada wa,
Jesu yoo tun pada wa,
Ho iho ayo naa ka ‘bi gbogbo,
Jesu yoo tun pada wa.

Jesu nbo! Oku yoo jinde,
Awon ore yoo pade pel’ ayo,
Won o goke s‘odo Re ni sanma,
Jesu yoo tun pada wa.

Jesu mbo lati da ayanfe n de,
Lati f‘ alaafia f’aye ija,
Ese aro, ‘banuje yio d‘opin,
Jesu yoo tun pada wa.

Jesu n bo, ileri naa j‘ooto,
Tal‘awon die t‘a yan ti n sooto,
Ti n duro ti n sona fun ibewo,
Jesu yoo tun pada wa.
(Amin).

title_english: Yield not to temptation, for yielding is sin
title_yoruba: Ma f' ara fun 'danwo, tori ese ni
passage_english: THEN SAITH JESUS UNTO HIM, GET THEE HENCE, SATAN. MATT. 4:10
passage_yoruba: nigbana ni jesu wi fun un pe, pada kuro leyin mi satani. matt. 4:10
verses_english:
Chorus:
Ask the Savior to help you,
Comfort, strengthen and keep you;
He is willing to aid you, He will carry you through.

Shun evil companions, bad language disdain,
God’s name hold in reverence, nor take it in vain;
Be thoughtful and earnest, kindhearted and true,
Look ever to Jesus, He’ll carry you through.
verses_yoruba:
Ma f' ara fun 'danwo, tori ese ni
Isegun kan yoo tun fun o l’agbara
Ja bi okunrin si bori ‘fekufe
Sa teju mo Jesu yoo mu o la ja.

Chorus:
'Beere ranwo at’ agbara lodo Olugbala
O se tan fun ‘ranwo
Yoo mu o la ja.
Ma k’egbe buburu, ma soro ibi
Ma se pe oruko Olorun lasan
Je eniti n ronu at' olotito
Sa teju mo Jesu yoo mu o la ja.

Olorun yoo fi ade f' eniti segun
Ao fi ‘gbagbo segun b’ ota nde si wa
Kristi yoo so agbara wa dotun
Sa teju mo Jesu yoo mu o la ja.	
(Amin)

title_english: Simply trusting every day
passage_english: IN THEE, O LORD, DO I PUT MY TRUST; LET ME NEVER BE ASHAMED: DELIVER ME IN THY RIGHTEOUSNESS. PS 31:1.
passage_yoruba: 'OLUWA, IWO NI MO GBEKE MI LE, MASE JE KI OJU KI O TI MI, GBA MI NINU ODODO RE'. PS 31:1.
verses_english:
Simply trusting every day,
Trusting through a stormy way;
Even when my faith is small,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.

Chorus:
Trusting as the moments fly,
Trusting as the days go by;
Trusting Him whate’er befall,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.

Trusting Him while life shall last,
Trusting Him till earth be past;
Till within the jasper wall,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
Sa gbekele l'ojoojo
Gbekele laarin 'danwo
Bi 'gbagbo tile kere
Gbekele Jesu nikan

Chorus:
Gbekele ni gbagbogbo
Gbekelee lojojumo
Gbekele lonakona
Gbekele Jesu nikan.

Emi Re n tan imole
Si okan okunkun mi;
Lowo Re n ko le subu
Gbekele Jesu nikan.

B'ona ba mo un o korin
B'o ba di un o gbadura,
L'aarin ewu un ke pe E
Gbekele Jesu nikan

Gbekelee titi dopin
Tit'aye yoo fi koja
Ti ao si de 'nu ogo
Gbekele Jesu nikan.
(Amin).

passage_yoruba: OLUBUKUN LI ENITI O N BO WA LI ORUKO OLUWA; AWA TI FI IBUKUN FUN O LATI ILE OLUWA WA” ORIN DAFIDI 118:26
verses_english: Oops! No English Translation for this Hymn
verses_yoruba:
Ayo b’aye / Oluwa de
Olorun Alagbara Baba at' ayeraye
Omo Alade alaafia
K’olukuluku okan / ma jafara,
Olorun Alagbara Baba At’ayeraye,
Omo Alade Alafia.

Ayo b’aye Olu/gbala joba
Olorun Alagbara Baba at’ ayeraye
Omo Alade alaafia
Eyini le omi oke / E yin in logo
Olorun Alagbara Baba At’ayeraye,
Omo Alade Alafia.

Oore-ofe ato otito / l’ O fi joba
Olorun Alagbara Baba at’ ayeraye
Omo Alade alaafia
Ododo Jesu nikan / lo n gba wa la
Olorun Alagbara Baba At’ayeraye,
Omo Alade Alafia.
(Amin)

title_english: 'Tis the promise of God, full salvation to give
passage_english: WITH LONG LIFE WILL I SATISFY HIM, AND SHEW HIM MY SALVATION. PSALM 91:16
passage_yoruba: EMI GIGUN LI EMI O FI TE E LORUN EMI O SI FI IGBALA MI HAN AN. ORIN D. 91:16
verses_english:
'Tis the promise of God, full salvation to give
Unto him who on Jesus, His Son, will believe.

Tho' the pathway be lonely, and dangerous, too,
Surely Jesus is able to carry me through.

Many loved ones have I in yon heavenly throng 
They are safe now in glory and this is their song.

Little children I see standing close by their King,
And He smiles, as their song of salvation they sing.

There are prophets and kings in that throng I behold,
And they sing as they march through the streets of pure gold.

There's a part in that chorus for you and for me,
And the theme of our praises forever will be.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Igbala kikun ni Olorun se 'leri
F'eniti o ba gba Jesu omo Re gbo.

Chorus:
Alleluyah O pari, mo gba Omo gbo,
Mo ri 'gbala ninu eje Olugbala.
Alleluyah o pari, mo gba Omo gbo.
Mo ri igbala ninu eje Olugbala.

Bi ona mi tile kun fun ewu pupo.
Dajudaju Jesu yoo mu mi laaja.

Olufe pupo ni mo ni lode.
Won wa ninu ogo-eyii si l‘orin won.

Awon omode duro l'egbe Oba won
O n rerin si won bi won ti n ko orin won.

Woli at' Oba wa ni ipejopo naa,
Won n korin bi won ti n la ‘ta wura koja.

Awa pelu ni lati ko n'nu orin naa
Oro orin iyin wa titi lae l’eyii.
(Amin).

title_english: Praise Him! praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!
title_yoruba: Fi iyin fun Jesu Olurapada wa
passage_english: I heard a great voice of much people in heaven, saying, Alleluia; Salvation, and glory, and honour, and power, unto the Lord our God. rev. 19:1
passage_yoruba: Mo gbo ohun nla kan lo orun n wipe halleluyah; tioluwa olorun wa ni igbala, ati ola ati agbara Ifi. 19:1
verses_english:
Praise Him! praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!
Sing, ye saints! His wonderful love proclaim!
Hail Him! hail Him! mightiest angels in glory;
Strength and honor give to His holy name!
Like a shepherd, Jesus will feed His people,
In His arms He carries them all day long;
O ye saints that live in the light of His presence,
Praise Him! praise Him! ever in joyful song!

Praise Him! praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer,
Heavenly portals, loud with hosannas ring!
Jesus, Savior, reigneth forever and ever;
Crown Him! crown Him! Prophet and Priest and King!
Death is vanquished! Tell it with joy, ye faithful,
Where is now thy victory, boasting grave?
Jesus lives! No longer thy portals are
cheerless;
Jesus lives, the mighty and strong to save.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Fi iyin fun Jesu Olurapada wa,
Ki aye ko kiki ife Re nla ;
Fi iyin fun n eyin Angeli Ologo,
F’ola at’ogo fun oruko Re,
B’olus’agutan, Jesu yoo to omo Re 
Apa Re lo n gbe won le lojoojo
Eyin eniyan mimo ti n gb’oke Sion
Fi iyin fun un pelu orin ayo

Fi iyin fun, Jesu Olurapada wa,
Fun wa, O t’eje Re sile, O ku
Oun ni apata, ati ‘reti ‘gbala wa,
Yin Jesu ti a kan m’agbelebu;
Olugbala t’O f’ara da irora nla
Ti a fi ade egun de lori
Eniti a pa nitori awa eda
Oba ogo n joba titi laelae.

Fi iyin fun, Jesu Olurapada wa
Ki ariwo iyin gba orun kan
Jesu Oluwa n joba lae ati laelae,
Se e l’Oba gbogb’eyin alagbara
Asegun iku fi ayo royin naa ka
Isegun re ha da isa oku?
Jesu ye ko tun si wahala fun wa mo
Tori O lagbara lati gbala.
(Amin).
Posted by

title_english: Jesus is coming with joy in the sky
passage_english: BEFORE THE LORD: FOR HE COMETH, FOR HE COMETH TO JUDGE THE EARTH: HE SHALL JUDGE THE WORLD WITH RIGHTEOUSNESS, AND THE PEOPLE WITH HIS TRUTH. PS. 96:13
passage_yoruba: niwaju oluwa: nitori o n bowa nitori ti nbowa se idajo aye: yoo fi ododo se idajo aye ati ti eniyan ni yio fi otito se. orin dafidi 96:13.
verses_english:
Jesus is coming with joy in the sky
Oh happy day! oh, happy day!
Then all who love Him shall heaven-ward fly:
Oh happy day! happy day!
Upward shall fly to the Lord in the air,
Together with Jesus we all shall be there,
Far from the earth and from sorrow and care:
Oh happy day! happy day!

Parents and children shall then again meet;
Oh happy day! oh happy day!
Sisters and brothers oh, it will be sweet!
Oh happy day! happy day!
We missed them on earth, to Jesus they went;
We love them as ever their absence lament
Soon we shall meet them and then be content,
Oh happy day! happy day!
Are we all ready, should Jesus now call?
Oh happy day! oh happy day!
Would each one answer, the great and the small?
Oh happy day! happy day!
We long to rise up and with thee to be,
Thy face, blessed Jesus Our Saviour to see
Would you then, dear children, sing sweetly with me?
Oh happy day! happy day!

Some would stay weeping unable to sing,
Oh happy day! oh happy day!
Yet all may rejoice and their glad praises bring;
Oh happy day! happy day!
For Jesus still waits, He tarries that we
May trust in His name, and thus ready may be,
When brightly beaming, His glory we see:
Oh happy day! happy day! (Amen)
verses_yoruba:
Jesu mbo l‘ofurufu pel‘ayo,
Ojo ayo! ojo ayo!
Awon to fee yoo fo lo pade Re,
Ojo ayo! Ojo nla.
Won yoo pade Oluwa ni sanma,
Gbogbo wa pelu Jesu yoo wa nibe,
Ao bo lowo aniyan at‘aro;
Ojo ayo! Ojo nla!

Awon obi omo yoo tun pade;
Ojo ayo! Ojo ayo!
Arakunrin pelu arabinrin,
Ojo ayo! Ojo nla
Won mbe l‘odo Krist‘ a ko ri won mo,
Ibanuje ni lilo won je fun wa;
Sugbon ao pade laipe pel‘ayo,
Ojo ayo! ayo nla!

Gbogbo wa ha setan fun bibo Re?
Ojo ayo! Ojo ayo!
Omode ati agba ha setan?
F’ojo nla! Ojo ayo!
A n fe lati wa lodo Re laelae
Ka le maa wo oju ati ewa Re,
Eyin ara, e ba mi yo n’itori
Ojo nla naa tao pade.

Awon miran ko ni le ba wa ko
Orin ayo ti ojo naa!
Sugbon gbogbo wa ni ayo n be fun
Ojo ayo! Ojo nla;
Tori Jesu n duro sibesibe,
Kale mura tan nipa agbara Re,
Ninu ogo didan Re k‘a le ni
Ibugbe loke orun.
(Amin).

title_english: Glory to God in the highest
passage_english: HEARD I SAYING, BLESSING, AND HONOUR, AND GLORY, AND POWER, BE UNTO HIM THAT SITTETH UPON THE THRONE, AND UNTO THE LAMB. REV. 5:13
passage_yoruba: ki a fi ibukun ati ola, ati ogo ati agbara fun eniti o joko lori ite fun odo-aguntan. ifihan 5:13
verses_english:
Glory to God in the highest!
Glory to God! Glory to God!
Glory to God in the highest!
Shall be our song today;
Another year’s rich mercies prove
His ceaseless care and boundless love;
So let our loudest voices raise
Our glad and grateful song of praise.

Chorus:
Glory to God in the highest!
Glory to God in the highest!
Glory, glory, glory, glory,
Glory be to God on high!

Glory to God in the highest!
Glory to God! Glory to God!
Glory to God in the highest!
Shall be our song today;
The song that woke the glorious morn
When David’s greater Son was born;
Sung by a heavenly host, and we
Would join th’angelic company.

Glory to God in the highest!
Glory to God! Glory to God!
Glory to God in the highest!
Shall be our song today;
O, may we, an unbroken band,
Around the throne of Jesus stand,
And there with angels and the throng
Of His redeemed ones, join the song.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ogo f‘Olorun loke orun,
Ogo, ogo ni f’ Olorun
Ogo f‘Olorun l’ok‘orun,
Li orin wa loni
Orin ti owuro ayo
Ti a bi Omo Dafidi
Ti ogun orun ko, awa.
Si fe dapo mo ogun naa.

Chorus:
Ogo, f’Olorun l’ok‘orun
Ogo, f’Olorun l’ok‘orun
Ogo, ogo, ogo, ogo,
Ogo, f’Olorun l’oke,

Ogo f’ Olorun l’ok‘orun
Ogo, ogo ni f‘Olorun
Ogo f‘Olorun l’ok‘orun
Li orin wa loni.
Aanu ti a ri gba fi han
Bi ife Re ti tobi to.
Je ki a gbohun wa soke
Korin iyin Olugbala.

Ogo f‘Olorun l’ok‘orun
Ogo, ogo ni f‘Olorun
Ogo f‘Olorun l’ok‘orun
Li orin wa loni.
Je ki awa le duro pe
Niwaju ‘te Olugbala
K‘a korin pel‘awon Angel‘,
At‘awon eni ‘rapada.
(Amin).

title_english: Trust not in physicians, for trusting is sin
passage_english: IN MY DISTRESS I CRIED TO THE LORD, AND HE HEARD ME. PS 120:1
passage_yoruba: NINU IPONJU MI EMI KE PE OLUWA, O SI DA MI LOHUN” PS. 102:1
verses_english:
Trust not in physicians, for trusting is sin
One vict'ry will give you more strength to o'ercome
Just look up in faith and you will conquer through
Just keep close to Jesus, He will carry you through.

Chorus
Ask the Saviour to help you,
To uphold and deliver,
He is willing to heal you,
He will carry you through.

Refrain altogether, from using med'cine,
Trust fully on the arm of the Lord alone
Be faithful, stand boldly and with a pure heart
Just keep close to Jesus, He will carry you through.

The Lord will give strength to all those who believe
We'll conquer, we'll triumph, all through faith alone;
God gives us the promise our strength to renew
Just keep close to Jesus, He will carry you through.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
Ma gbekel‘onisegun tori‘ ese ni
Isegun kan yoo tun fun o Lagbara
Woke pelu’gbagbo wo yoo si bori
Sa sunmo Jesu sii Oun yio mu O laja

Chorus
Beere pe k‘Olugbala
Ko di o mu ko gba o
Oun fe mu o lara da
Yio mu o laja

Ko ona ogun sile patapata
Gbekele agbara Olorun Nikan
J‘olooto, si duro pel’ okan funfun
Sa sunmo Jesu si, Oun yoo mu o laja

Olorun yo f‘okun f‘eni to gbagbo
A o segun ao bori nipa Igbagbo
Olorun yoo so agbara wa d’otun
Sa sunmo Jesu si, Oun yo mu o laja
(Amin).

title_english: O for a faith that will not shrink
passage_english: IF YE SHALL ASK ANY THING IN MY NAME, I WILL DO IT. JOHN 041
passage_yoruba: BI EYIN BE BEERE OHUNKOHUN LI ORUKO MI, EMI O SE E. JOHN 14:14
verses_english: / C.M.

O for a faith that will not shrink,
Tho' pressed by ev'ry foe,
But in the hour of grief or pain
Will lean upon its God.

This is incomprehensible
Yet will I fear no foe,
With God all things are possible
His words shall never fail.

Lord, give us such a faith as this
That faith that never fails
A faith that keeps the narrow way,
Till life's last spark is fled.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Igbagbo tori ‘leri naa
Ti ko ka soro si,
T‘o n wo Olorun nikan soso,
T‘o nwipe, ao segun.

A! Eyii koja oye mi
Sugbon n ki yoo beru
Tor‘ Oluwa ti se ileri,
Oro Re kii tase

Igbagbo nla ti kii tase
Baba joo fifun mi,
Igbagbo to n duro gangan
Titi yoo fi segun.
Amin.

title_english: He will answer every pray'r
passage_english: AND I SAY UNTO YOU, ASK, AND IT SHALL BE GIVEN YOU; SEEK, AND YE SHALL FIND; KNOCK, AND IT SHALL BE OPENED UNTO YOU. LUKE 11:9
passage_yoruba: EMI SI WI FUN YIN, E BEERE, A O SI FIFUN YIN; E WA KIRI, EYIN O SI RI, E KANKUN A O SI SI SILE FUN YIN. LUKU 11:9
verses_english:
He will answer every pray'r,
This, His promise and His will
He has never changed nor failed
Glory, glory to His name.

He will answer every pray'r,
To His promise I will cling
I know He'll ne'er deceive me,
Glory, glory to His name.

He will answer every pray'r
Let us ask from Him in faith
With His Holy Spirit's help
Glory, glory to His name.

He will answer every pray'r,
Come thou to the mercy seat,
Blest assurance you'll receive
Glory, glory to His name.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Yoo dahun gbogb’ adura
Ileri at ‘ife Re
Ko sa ti yipada ri
Ogo, ogo f’ooko Re

Yoo dahun gbogb’ adura
Un o ro mo ileri Re
Mo mo Oun ko je da mi
Ogo, ogo f’ooko Re

Yoo dahun gbogb’ adura
Je k’a beere ni ‘gbagbo
Emi Re n ran ni lowo
Ogo, ogo f’ooko Re

Yoo dahun gbogb’ adura
Wa si’bi ite aanu
O ri idaniloju
Ogo, ogo f’ooko Re
(Amin).

title_english: I always go to Jesus
passage_english:
GOD IS OUR REFUGE AND STRENGTH, A VERY PRESENT HELP IN TROUBLE.
PS. 46:1
passage_yoruba: “OLORUN LI AABO WA ATI AGBARA, LOWOLOWO IRANLOWO NI IGBA IPONJU.” PS 46:1
verses_english:
I always go to Jesus,
When troubled or distressed,
I always find a refuge,
Upon His loving breast,
I tell Him all my trials,
I tell Him all my grief,
And while my lips are speaking,
He gives my heart relief.

When full of dread forebodings,
And flowing o'er my tears
He calms away my sorrow,
And hushes all my fears,
He comprehends my weakness,
The peril I am in,
And He supplies the armour,
I need to conquer sin.

I always go to Jesus,
No matter when or where
I seek His gracious presence,
I'm sure to find Him there
In times of joy or sorrow,
Whate'er my need may be,
I always go to Jesus,
And Jesus comes to me.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
‘Gbati ‘danwo yi mi ka
Odo Kristi ni mo n lo;
Ni ookan aya Re ni
Iba isadi mi,
Mo s’okan mi paya fun un,
O mo gbogbo edun mi;
Bi mo ti n so nkan wonyi,
O m’ edun mi kuro.

‘Gbati mo kun fun eru
Ti mo n sunkun pere,
O tan ibanuje mi,
O le eru mi lo,
O r’ewu to yi mi ka,
Ati ilera mi,
O fun mi l’ohun ija
Lati segun ese.

Un o sa lo sodo Jesu,
Nibi t’ o wu ko je,
Un o sa maa wa oju Re,
O daju pe un o ri,
‘Banuje ni tab’ ayo?
Ohun to wu ko je,
Odo Re sa ni un o lo,
Oun yoo si to mi wa.
(Amin).

title_english: Gladly, gladly, toiling for the Master
passage_english: REJOICE, AND BE EXCEEDING GLAD: FOR GREAT IS YOUR REWARD IN HEAVEN. MATT. 5:12
passage_yoruba: E MAA YO, KI ENYIN KI O SI FO FUN AYO: NITORI ERE NYIN PO LI ORUN. MATT. 5:12
verses_english:
Gladly, gladly, toiling for the Master
Go we forth with willing hands to do,
Whatsoe'er to us He hath appointed
Faithfully our mission we'll pursue

Chorus:
Toiling for Jesus
Joyfully we go, yes joyfully we go,
Toiling for Jesus,
In His vineyard here below.

Sweetly, sweetly, we will tell the story
Of His love to mortals here below;
Christ, the brightness of the father's glory
Freely here His blessings will bestow.

Meekly, meekly, toiling for the Master,
Walking, faithfully the path He trod;
Leading wanderers to the dear Redeemer
Pointing sinners to the Lamb of God.

Chorus:
Toiling for Jesus
Joyfully we go, yes joyfully we go,
Toiling for Jesus,
In His vineyard here below.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Pelu ayo l’ao sise f’Oluwa
Pelu ife I’ ao fowo wa se
Isekise ti O ba yan fun wa,
L’ ododo l’ ao sise, ‘ranse wa

Chorus:
Sise fun Jesu,
Layo l’ ao lo, layo l’ ao lo,
Sise fun Jesu,
Ninu ogba Re laye,

Pelu adun li ao so itan naa,
T’ife nla Re s’awa eniyan,
Kristi, itansan Ogo ti Baba,
Lofe l’oun O fi ‘bukun fun wa

Pelu ‘rele l’ao sise f’Oluwa,
A o fi otito rin lona Re
A o to asako sod’ Olugbala,
A o f’ Od’agutan han elese.

Chorus:
Sise fun Jesu,
Layo l’ ao lo, layo l’ ao lo,
Sise fun Jesu,
Ninu ogba Re laye,
(Amin).

title_english: Tell it to Jesus, all of thy sorrow
passage_english: AND ABRAM SAID, LORD GOD, WHAT WILT THOU GIVE ME, SEEING I GO CHILDLESS. GENESIS 15:2
passage_yoruba: abraham si wipe, oluwa olorun kinni iwo o fi  fun mi, emi sa n lo li ailomo. genesisi 15:2
verses_english:
Tell it to Jesus, all of thy sorrow,
All of thy cares whate'er they be;
Surely and sweetly, He will deliver
He will sustain and comfort thee.

Chorus:
Tell it to Jesus,
Tell it to Jesus
Tell it to Jesus,
He will hear, Only believe
Him trust and receive Him,
He will sustain and comfort thee.

Tell it to Jesus, He is thy Saviour,
Tell it, and His salvation see;
Do not deny Him, do not defy Him
He will sustain and comfort thee.

Tell it to Jesus, He is a refuge,
Into His arms for mercy flee;
Tell it believing, tell it receiving
Grace to sustain and comfort thee.

Chorus:
Tell it to Jesus,
Tell it to Jesus
Tell it to Jesus,
He will hear, Only believe
Him trust and receive Him,
He will sustain and comfort thee.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
So gbogbo ‘banuje re fun Jesu
Ati gbogbo aniyan re;
Dajudaju yoo da O n‘ide,
Oun yoo si tu o ninu

Chorus:
So won fun Jesu,
So won fun Jesu,
So won fun Jesu,
Oun yoo gbo, sa gbekele E
Ki o si gba A gbo;
Oun yoo si tu O ninu.

So won fun Jesu Olugbala re
So won k‘o si ri ‘gbala Re;
Mase se Jesu, mase d‘oju tii,
Oun yoo si tu o ninu.

So fun Jesu, Oun ni aabo re,
O n wa aanu? Lo sodo Re
So fun Jesu, gbagbo ‘wo o si ri
Oore-ofe ati ‘tunu.

Chorus:
So won fun Jesu,
So won fun Jesu,
So won fun Jesu,
Oun yoo gbo, sa gbekele E
Ki o si gba A gbo;
Oun yoo si tu o ninu.
(Amin).

title_english: Hear the footsteps of Jesus, He is now passing by
title_yoruba: Gbo iro ese Jesu O nkoja lo bayi
passage_english: AND, BEHOLD, THERE CAME A LEPER AND WORSHIPPED HIM, SAYING, LORD, IF THOU WILT, THOU CANST MAKE ME CLEAN. MATT. 8:2
passage_yoruba: si wo o, adete kan wa, o teriba fun un, o wipe, oluwa bi iwo ba fe, iwo le so mi di mimo. matt. 8:2
verses_english:
Hear the footsteps of Jesus, He is now passing by,
Bearing balm for the wounded, healing all who apply;
As He spake to the suff’rer, who lay at the pool,
He is saying this moment, wilt thou be made whole?

Chorus:
Wilt thou be made whole?
O come, weary suff’rer,
O come, sin-sick soul;
See the life-stream is flowing,
See the cleansing waves roll,
Step into the current and thou shalt be whole.

’Tis the voice of that Savior, Whose merciful call
Freely offers salvation, To one and to all;
He is now beck’ning to Him, Each sin-tainted soul,
And lovingly asking, Wilt thou be made whole?

Are you halting and struggling, Overpowr’d by your sin,
While the waters are troubled, can you not enter in?
Lo, the Savior stands waiting, to strengthen your soul;
He is earnestly pleading, wilt thou be made whole?
verses_yoruba:
Gbo iro ese Jesu O nkoja lo bayi,
O ni tura f‘agbogbe, O n sawotan
arun;
B’o ti so f‘alaisan ni leti adagun,
O n wi bee nisisiyii “O n fe ‘wosan
bi”?

Chorus:
O n fe ‘wosan bi? 2ce
Wa, alailera, wa
Wa, elese wa
Wo omi iye ti n san,
Omi iwenumo,
Wo inu re, iwo yoo si ri ‘wosan

Ohun Olugbala ni ipe aanu Re,
Mu igbala ofe wa fun gbogbo
eniyan;
O n pe gbogbo okan ti eru ese
N pa,
O n fi fe beere pe “O n fe ‘wosan
bi”?

Ara un ni o, eru ese n wo o l‘orun,
O ko ha le wo’nu omi ni bi o ti n
ru?
Woo Oluwa n duro, lati fun o lokun,
O si n fi ‘fe beere pe “O n fe ‘wosan
bi"?

Ran wa lowo Jesu k’a gbekel‘oro
Re,
Je ki emi iwosan ba le wa loni yii,
We abaawon ese nu si sakoso wa,
So f‘okan to n wa O pe “O n fe ‘wosan
bi”?
(Amen).

title_english: I will praise the Lord for His love to me
title_yoruba: Em’o yin Oluwa fun ife Re
passage_english: And Mary said, My soul doth magnify the Lord. luke 1:47
passage_yoruba: Maria si dahun, o ni, okan mi yin oluwa logo luku 1:47
verses_english:
I will praise the Lord for His love to me,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
In the fount that flows from the cross so free,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
Chorus:
Glory, glory, glory to the Lamb,
I am saved from sin and He makes me what I am;
Oh, glory, glory, glory to the Lamb,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.

I am saved by grace, and to Him brought near,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
I would sing so loud that the world might hear,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.

What a constant peace in my heart I feel,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
There’s a holy joy I can ne’er reveal,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.

I will lift my voice while on earth I stay,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer.
Then my soul shall sing in the realms of day,
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Em’o yin Oluwa fun ife Re
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada
Eje naa to n san nib’agbelebu
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada

Chorus:
Ogo, ogo, fun Odagutan
O gba mi lowo ese mo si di mimo
Ogo, ogo, ogo f’ Odagutan
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada

Oore-ofe mu mi sunm’odo Re
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada
Em’ o korin soke aye yoo gbo
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada

Alaafia wo lo to yii lokan mi!
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada
Ayo mimo naa ko se f’enu so
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada

Emi o maa gbohun iyin soke
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada
Okan mi yoo ma korin lojoojo
A we mi nin’ eje Olurapada
(Amin).

title_english: By childlike faith in Christ the Lord
passage_english: BY FAITH ENOCH WAS TRANSLATED THAT HE SHOULD NOT SEE DEATH; AND WAS NOT FOUND. HEBREWS 11:5
passage_yoruba: nipa igbagbo li a si enoku nipo pada ki o mase ri iku; a ko si rii. hebERU 11:5
verses_english:
By childlike faith in Christ the Lord,
We have from sin salvation;
By fully trusting in His word,
We pass from condemnation.

How simple is the way of life,
’Tis only to believe Him;
’Twill end your sorrow and your strife
If you will but receive Him.

We walk by faith, and not by sight:
How grand is this revealing!
’Tis God’s own way, and must be right,
’Tis wrong to trust in feeling.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
Nipa igbagbo ninu Kristi
Awa bo lowo ese.
Nipa gbigbekel ‘Oro Re
Awa bo lowo ebi.

Chorus:
A n rin nipa gbagbo lairi
Eyii l’ona Olorun pe
A n rin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi
A n to Kristi ‘Imole.

Ona iye ti rorun to,
K’a gbekele Krist‘ nikan;
Aro oun Ija re yoo pin
Bi iwo ba je gba A.

Iku Jesu lo san gbese
Kii se ara oun ‘ronu,
O ti ru ebi ese wa;
A! Fi okan re fun Un.

A n rin nipa gbagbo lairi,
Imo yii ti tobi to;
Ona Olorun paa l‘eyii,
Ma gbekele ero re.
(Amin).

title_english: When we walk with the Lord
passage_english: THAT YE WHICH HAVE FOLLOWED ME, IN THE REGENERATION WHEN THE SON OF MAN SHALL SIT IN THE THRONE OF HIS GLORY, YE ALSO SHALL SIT UPON TWELVE THRONES. MATT. 19:28
passage_yoruba: “eyin ti e n to mi lehin, ni igba atunbi nigbati omo eniyan yio joko lori ite ogo re eyin o si joko pelu lori ite mejila”. matt. 19:28
verses_english:
When we walk with the Lord
In the light of His Word,
What a glory He sheds on our way!
While we do His good will,
He abides with us still,
And with all who will trust and obey.

Chorus:
Trust and obey,
For there’s no other way
To be happy in Jesus,
But to trust and obey.

Not a shadow can rise,
Not a cloud in the skies,
But His smile quickly drives it away;
Not a doubt or a fear,
Not a sigh or a tear,
Can abide while we trust and obey.

Not a burden we bear,
Not a sorrow we share,
But our toil He doth richly repay;
Not a grief or a loss,
Not a frown or a cross,
But is blessed if we trust and obey.

But we never can prove
The delights of His love
Until all on the altar we lay;
For the favor He shows,
For the joy He bestows,
Are for them who will trust and obey.

Then in fellowship sweet
We will sit at His feet.
Or we’ll walk by His side in the way.
What He says we will do,
Where He sends we will go;
Never fear, only trust and obey.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbat’a b’Oluwa rin
N’nu ‘mole oro Re,
Ona wa yio ti ma mole to!
Gbat’a ba n se’fe Re,
Oun yoo maa ba wa gbe,
Ati awon t’o gbeke won le E.

Chorus:
Sa gbekele E,
Ona miran ko si
Lati l’ayo n’nu Jesu,
Ju pe k’a gbeke le E.

Ko s’ohun t’o le de,
L’oke tabi ni’le
T’o le ko agbara Re loju;
Iyemeji eru,
Ibanuje, ekun
Ko le duro bi a ba gbekele E.

Ko si wahala mo,
Tabi ibanuje
O ti san gbogbo gbese wonyii
Ko si arokan mo,
Tabi ifajuro
Sugbon ‘bukun b’a ba gbekele E.

A ko le f’enu so
Bi’ fe Re ti po to
Titi a o fi f’ara wa rubo
Aanu ti o n fi han,
At’ayo t’o n fun mi
Je ti awon ti o gbekele E.

Ni ‘dapo pelu Re
Ao joko l’ese Re.
Tabi ki a maa rin pelu Re.
Awa yoo gbo Tire,
Ao jise t’ O ran wa;
Ma beru sa gbekele nikan.
(Amin).

title_english: Christ, our mighty captain, leads against the foe
passage_english: Christ, our mighty captain, leads against the foe. deut. 31:3
passage_yoruba: oluwa olorun re, oun ni yoo rekoja saju re. deut. 31:3
verses_english:
Christ, our mighty captain, leads against the foe,
We will never falter when He bids us go;
Tho’ His righteous purpose we may never know,
Yet we’ll follow all the way.

Fierce the battle rages—but ’twill not be long,
Then triumphant, shall we join the blessèd throng,
Joyfully uniting in the victor’s song—
If we follow all the way.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Kristi balogun wa niwaju ogun,
B’O ba ran wa ni’se a ko ni beru,
Bi ‘ohun t’O fe se ko tile ye wa,
Sibe a o tele E titi.

Chorus:
Te siwaju! Lase Oluwa.
Te siwaju! Si ‘le ‘ileri naa;
Te siwaju! Ko orin soke,
Pelu Kristi, isegun daju.

Gbogbo ifeju esu ko le mi wa,
Bi Kristi je asa at’ apata wa;
Ao maa fi ida-emi bi a ti n lo,
A o maa tele titi.

E jeki a gbe asia wa soke
Ibi ko le de ibiti o ba wa,
Kristi, Balogun wa ti segun aye,
A o maa tele titi.

B’ ogun naa tile le ko ni pe pari,
Nigbana, ao dapo pel’ awon mimo,
Lati fi ayo ko orin isegun,
Bi a ba tele E titi.
(Amin)

title_english: In this world there are burdens we must bear
title_yoruba: Ibanuje po fun wa laye yii
passage_english: LET NOT YOUR HEART BE TROUBLED: YE BELIEVE IN GOD, BELIEVE ALSO IN ME. JOHN 14:1
passage_yoruba: E MASE JE KI OKAN YIN DARU, E GBA OLORUN GBO, E GBA MI GBO PELU. JOHANU 14:1
verses_english:
In this world there are burdens we must bear,
And our eyes are made wet and dim with tears;
There's no grief, neither sorrow over there,
In that land where there are no days nor years

Chorus:
In that land where there are no days nor years,
Neither sorrow nor anguish or tears;
We shall dwell there in peace and our joys ne'er shall cease
In that land where there are no days nor years.

Though we toil, oft our labour seems in vain,
We have faith though no fruit our visions cheer,
But the Lord will all mystery make plain,
In that land where there are no days nor years.

So we smile as we labour day by day,
And forget all our sorrows, griefs and fears,
For when all earthly things have passed away,
We shall dwell where there are no days nor years
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ibanuje po fun wa laye yii,
Ekun m‘oju wa tutu o si su;
‘Banuje at‘aro ko si lohun
Nile naa nibiti ko si odun.

Chorus:
Nile naa nibiti ko si odun,
Tabi ibanuje at‘ekun;
Ao gbe be l‘alaafia ayo wa yo po
Ni ‘le naa nibiti ko si odun.

Bi a n sise, t‘ise wa ko si han,
A ni ‘gbagbo, ba ko tile r‘eso;
Sugbon Oluwa yoo f‘asiri han
Ni ‘le naa nibiti ko si odun.

A tujuka li enu ise wa,
A gbagbe 'banuje at‘eru wa;
Tori bi nkan aye ba n koja lo,
Ao gbe nibiti ko si odun.
(Amin).

title_english: Whoever receiveth the Crucified One
title_yoruba: Enikeni ti o ba gba Jesu gbo
passage_english: By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went. – HEB. 11:8
passage_yoruba: NIPA IGBAGBO NI ABRAHAMU, NIGBATI A TI PE E LATI JADE LO SI IBI TI OUN YOO GBA FUN ILE-INI, O GBO, O SI JADE LO, LAI MO IBITI OUN N RE. HEB. 11:8
verses_english:
Whoever receiveth the Crucified One,
Whoever believeth, on God's only Son,
A free and a perfect salvation shall have:
For He is abundantly able to save.

Chorus
My brother, the Master is calling for thee;
His grace and His mercy are wondrously free!
His blood as a ransom for sinners He gave,

Whoever receiveth the message of God,
And trusts in the power of the soul cleansing blood,
A full and eternal redemption shall have:
For He is both able and willing to save

Whoever repents and forsakes ev'ry sin,
And opens his heart for the Lord to come in,
A present and perfect salvation shall have:
For Jesus is ready this moment to save.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Enikeni ti o ba gba Jesu gbo;
T’o si gba ise ori agbelebu,
Yio ri igbala kikun gba l‘ofe,
‘Tori Kristi lagbara lati gbala.

Chorus:
Eyin ayanfe, Olugbala n pe yin
Oor‘-ofe ati aanu Re je ‘yanu
O ta eje Re sile fun ‘rapada
O si ni agbara lati gbani la.

Enikeni t’o ba gba ihinrere,
T’o si gbekele eje Re fun wenu
Yoo ri irapada ti ayeraye
‘Tori Oun ni agbara lati gbala.

Enit’o ba ko gbogb‘ ese re sile
Ti o s‘okan re paya f‘Oluwa,
Yoo ni igbala pipe nisisiyii;
‘Tori Oun ti mura tan lati gbala.
(Amin).

title_english: Rise, ye children of salvation
passage_english: WHEREFORE TAKE UNTO YOU THE WHOLE ARMOUR OF GOD, THAT YE MAY BE ABLE TO WITHSTAND IN THE EVIL DAY, AND HAVING DONE ALL, TO STAND. EPHESIANS 6:13
passage_yoruba: NITORINAA E GBE GBOGBO IHAMORA OLORUN WO, KI EYIN KI O LE DURO TIIRI SI OJO IBI NIGBATI EYIN BA SI TI SE OHUN GBOGBO TAN, KI E SI DURO. EFESU 6:13
verses_english:
Rise, ye children of salvation,
All who cleave to Christ the Head,
Wake, arise! O mighty nation,
Ere the foe on Zion tread
Chorus:
Pour it forth our mighty anthem,
Like the thunders of the sea
Through the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we
More than conquerors are we
More than conquerors are we
Through the blood of Christ our ranson,
More than conquerors are we.

Saints and heroes long before us,
Firmly on this ground have stood;
See their banners waving o'er us,
Conquerors through Jesus' blood

Deathless, we are all unfearing,
Life laid up with Christ in God;
In the morn of His appearing
Floweth forth a glory flood

Soon we all shall stand before Him,
See and know our glorious Lord;
Soon in joy and light adore Him,
Each receiving his reward

Chorus:
Pour it forth our mighty anthem,
Like the thunders of the sea
Through the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we
More than conquerors are we
More than conquerors are we
Through the blood of Christ our ranson,
More than conquerors are we.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
E dide, omo igbala,
Eyin te fe Oluwa
Dide ilu alagbara,
Ki ota to de Sion
Chorus:
F’agbara re korin kikan,
Bi iro omi okun,
Nipa eje Kristi Jesu
Awa ju asegun lo
Awa ju asegun lo
Awa ju asegun lo
Nipa eje Kristi Jesu,
Awa ju asegun lo.

Egbe mimo ti igbani
Ti won ti rin ona yii,
W’asia won ti n fe lele,
A segun nipa Kristi.

A ti gbe ‘ku mi ni ‘segun
Iye wa n be n’nu Kristi
Lojo ‘farahan Oluwa
A o ho iho ayo.

Laipe ao de ‘bi ite Re
Ao si mo Oba Ogo,
Nibe ao ke, “Kabiyesi”
Gbogbo wa yoo gba ere.
(Amin).

title_english: They that trust in the Lord are secure
passage_english: BY FAITH THE WALLS OF JERICHO FELL DOWN, AFTER THEY WERE COMPASSED ABOUT SEVEN DAYS. HEB. 11:30
passage_yoruba: nipa igbagbo li awon odi jeriko wo lule, leyin igbati a yi won ka ni ijo meje heb. 11:30
verses_english:
They that trust in the Lord are secure,
Tho' the storm rages dark o'er the sea;
For this anchor of promise is sure
''My grace is sufficient for thee''.

Chorus:
My grace is sufficient for thee,
My grace is sufficient for thee,
Oh, matchless, boundless grace of God,
My grace is sufficient for thee.

What a boon to the pilgrim opprest,
What a balm such a promise must be
To the laden ones seeking for rest,
''My grace is sufficient for thee''

In the race for the prize, fainting soul,
Though a weary you bow down the knee,
Rise again, and press on to the goal;
''My grace is sufficient for thee''

Neither trial nor doubt brings dismay,
Nor from danger that comes will I flee,
For I stand on this promise today-
''My grace is sufficient for thee'
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Awon to gbekele Oluwa
Yio bori igbi idanwo;
Nitori ileri yii daju,
“Ore-ofe mi to fun o”,
Chorus:
Oore – Ofe mi to fun o
Oore – Ofe mi to fun o
Oore – Ofe ti ko legbe
Oore – Ofe mi to fun o

Ileri rere li eyii je
Fun awon ero mimo l’ona,
Ti eru n pa, to si n wa ‘sinmi,
Öore – Ofe mi to fun o.

Laarin ire ije ti iye,
Bi aare tile mu o subu,
Tun dide ko si te siiwaju,
Oore – Ofe mi to fun o

Idanwò ati iyemeji
At’ ewu ko le ba mi leru
‘Tori mo di ileri yii mu
Oore – Ofe mi to fun o
(Amin)

title_english: Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus
passage_english: GREATER LOVE HATH NO MAN THAN THIS, THAT A MAN LAY DOWN HIS LIFE FOR HIS FRIENDS. JOHN 15:13
passage_yoruba: KO SI ENIKAN TI O NI IFE TI O TOBI JU, EYII LO, PE ENIKAN FI EMI RE LELE NITORI AWON ORE RE. JOHANU 15:13.
verses_english:
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus,
When the cares of life upon you roll,
He will heal the wounded heart,
He will strength and grace impart:
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus!

Chorus
The best Friend to have is Jesus!
The best Friend to have is Jesus!
He will help you when you fall!
He will hear you when you call,
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus.

What a Friend I have found in Jesus!
Peace and comfort to my soul He brings;
Leaning on His mighty arm,
I will fear no ill nor harm:
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus!

Though I pass through the night of sorrow,
And the chilly waves of Jordan roll.
Never need I shrink nor fear
For my Saviour is so near:
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus!

When at last to our home we gather
With the loved ones who have gone before,
We will sing upon the shore
Praising Him for evermore;
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu l‘ore to dara julo
 Gbati ‘gbi aye ba yi lu o;
Yoo wo okan to gbogbe san,
Yoo si fi agbara fun un;
Jesu l‘ore to dara julo

Chorus:
Jesu l‘ore to dara ju,
Jesu l‘ore to dara ju, 
Oun ki y’o je k’o subu 
Yoo gbo ‘gbati o ba pee;
Jesu l‘ore to dara julo.

Ore pataki ni Jesu je,
O f‘alaafia kun okan mi,
Nigbekele apa Re
N ko je beru ibikan;
Jesu l‘ore to dara julo

Bi ‘banuje tile de ba mi
Ti igbi Jordan si n yi lu mi,
Emi ko gbodo beru,
Oluwa n be nitosi;
Jesu l‘ore to dara julo.,

‘Gbati a ba de ‘le wa orun
Pelu awon t’o ti lo saju,
Ao korin l‘ebute Re,
Ao si maa yin in titi;
Jesu l‘ore to dara julo
(Amin).

title_english: We are watching, we are waiting,
title_yoruba: Awa n sona awa n duro
