passage_english: BUT THE END OF ALL THINGS IS AT HAND 1 PETER 4:7
passage_yoruba: OPIN OHUN GBOGBO KU SI DEDE 1 PETERU 4:7
verses_english:
We are watching, we are waiting,
Till the mists shall clear away,
And our Lord shall come in glory
With His saints in bright array;
When the trump of resounding
Shall be heard on ev'ry shore,
And the dead in Christ shall waken, to be with Him evermore.
 Chorus:
We are watching, we are waiting,
For the dawning of that glorious day;
For the coming of our Saviour,
With His saints in bright array.

We are looking for the coming,
Of our great and glorious King,
Who shall banish from His presence
Ev'ry dark and evil thing;
When His justice and His mercy
Shall prevail in all the world,
And o'er ev'ry tribe and nation
Shall His banner be unfurl'd.

Now by faith we catch a vision
Of that glad millennial reign,
And behold the ransom'd millions
Who shall follow in His train:
And our hearts cry out, 'Come quickly!'
That His beauty we may see,
And be with our Lord in glory,
Through a blest eternity.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Awa n sona awa n duro
Titi ‘boji yoo fi ya,
T‘Oluwa pelu awon ayanfe yoo
de n‘nu ogo,
Nigbati ao gbo ipe Olorun
Jakejado,
Oku n‘nu Kristi yoo si ji lati wa
lodo Re lae.
Chorus:
Awa n sona, awa n duro,
Fun imole ti ojo nla naa,
Fun bibo Olugbala wa
Pelu awon ayanfe.

Awa n wo ona fun bibo Oba wa,
nla Ologo,
Eniti yoo le ibi ati okunkun lo
jinna,
Gbati ododo ati aanu Re yoo
bori l‘aye
Ti asia Re yoo si maa fe lori
gbogbo aye.

Awa fi ‘gbagbo wo ‘joba Re ti
egberun odun,
Eniti opo awon emewa Re ti a
ti rapada,
Okan wa si ke pe ‘Maa bo ka ba
le ri ogo Re’
Ka le maa gbe ninu ogo ti
ayeraye.
(Amin).

title_english: I am the Way,' the Saviour said
passage_english: HE SAITH UNTO HIM, FOLLOW ME MATT. 9:9
passage_yoruba: O SI WI FUN UN PE, MAA TO MI LEYIN MATT. 9:9
verses_english:
'I am the Way,' the Saviour said.
And I would follow on,
Content to know that after night
Shall break a glorious dawn.

Chorus:
I am the Way, the Truth and the life,
No man cometh unto the Father but by me,
I am the Way, the Truth and the Life,
No man cometh unto the Father but by me.

'I am the Truth,' then Truth shall be
A beacon light to guide.
My bark across the stormy sea
To where still waters glide.

'I am the Life,' there is no death,
For me to fear, nor dread.
Since by His all atoning blood.
My life to His is wed.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu wipe Oun li ona,
Emi si fe tele E;
Mo mo pe leyin okunkun
Imole yoo si de.

Chorus:
Oun li ona, ooto ati iye,
Ko s‘ona mi s‘odo Baba a f‘odo Re,
Oun li ona, ooto ati iye,
Ko s‘ona mi s‘odo Baba, a f‘odo Re.

Oun li ooto, ooto yoo si
Je ‘mole ti n to mi,
Oko mi yoo koja okun
Sile alaafia.

Oun ni Iye ko si iku
Ti yoo fo mi laya
Nitori nipa eje Re,
Mo n gbe ‘nu Re titi.
(Amin).

title_english: My sins, O the peace giving thought
passage_english: THE BLOOD OF JESUS CHRIST HIS SON CLEANSETH US I JOHN 1:7
passage_yoruba: EJE JESU KRISTI OMO RE NI N WE WA I JOHANNU 1:7
verses_english:
My sins, O the peace giving thought,
Are buried beneath the wild wave,
Since God in His mercy has brought
His wonderful power to save.

Chorus:
Thou wilt cast all their sins into the depths of the sea,
'Tis the word of the Lord, and sufficient for me,
Though the billows may roar and may break on the shore,
They are lost in its depths, and can reach me no more,
Of the place where they're buried, only God holds the key,
In the depths, the depths of the sea.

No more shall they rise to distress
Or trouble the peace of my soul,
As o'er them in power to bless
God's waves of forgiveness shall roll.

No tempest can bring to the light
The sins He buries for aye
My soul precious is in His sight,
And He will protect it alway.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ero didun ni t‘ese mi.
T‘a sin s‘abe omi okun
‘Gbati agbara Olorun
Dide fun ‘gbala okan mi.
 Chorus:
Iwo yoo ran ese won lo
s‘ogbun okun,
Ileri Oluwa ni, o si to fun mi,
B‘omi okun tile nho pelu
bibi re,
Yoo rele, yoo si gbe, ko le de
odo mi,
Nitori Olorun nikan lo ka’ wo igbi,
Omi nla ti inu okun.

Won ki yoo tun gbogun ti mi,
Tabi yo okan mi lenu,
‘Tori agbara Olorun
Ni yoo mu idariji wa.

Ko si wahala to le mu
Ese mi wa si iranti,
Okan mi sowon loju Re,
Yoo dabo bo nigbagbogbo.
(Amin).

title_english: I hear the Saviour say
passage_english: AND HE MARVELLED BECAUSE OF THEIR UNBELIEF MARK 6:6
passage_yoruba: ENU SI YA A NITORI AIGBAGBO WON MARKU 6:6
verses_english:
I hear the Saviour say,
Thy strength indeed is small,
Child of weakness, watch and pray,
Find in me thine all in all.
 Chorus:
Jesus paid it all,
All to him I owe;
Sin had left a crimson stain,
He washed it white as snow.

Lord, now indeed I find
Thy power, and thine alone,
Can change the leper's spots,
And melt the heart of stone.

When from my dying bed
My ransomed soul shall rise,
“Jesus died my soul to save,”
Shall rend the vaulted skies.

And when, before the throne,
I stand in him complete,
I’ll lay my trophies down
All down at Jesus’ feet.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo gbo Jesu wipe
“Agbara re kere”
Alaare sora gbadua,
Pipe re n be lodo mi.
 Chorus:
Jesu san gbogbo
‘Gbese ti mo je,
Ese ti m‘abawon wa
O fo mi fun bi sno.

Oluwa, tooto mo mo
P‘agbara Re nikan
Le s‘adete di mimo,
O le m‘okan lile ro.

Gbati ‘pe keyin ba dun
To n pe mi sodo Re,
Jesu ti san gbogbo re,
E m‘o ba goke orun.

Niwaju ‘te un o duro
N‘nu pipe ewa Kristi
Un o fi ade ogo ni
Lele li ese Jesu.
(Amin).

title_english: Praise the king of Glory
title_yoruba: E yin Oba ogo, oun li Olorun
passage_english: PRAISE YE THE LORD. O GIVE THANKS UNTO THE LORD PS. 106:1
passage_yoruba: E FI IYIN FUN OLUWA! E FI OPE FUN OLUWA PS. 106:1
verses_english:
Praise the king of Glory, He is God alone,
Praise Him for the wonders He to us hath shown;
For His promised presence, All the pilgrim way,
For the flaming pillar, And the cloud by day.
Chorus:
Praise Him, shining angels, Strike your harps of gold,
All His hosts adore Him, who His face behold;
Through His great dominion, while the ages roll,
All His works shall praise Him (2ce)
Bless the Lord, my soul!

Praise Him for the trials, Sent as chords of love,
Binding us more closely, To the things above;
For the faith that conquers, Hope, that naught can dim,
For the land where loved ones, Gather unto Him.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
E yin Oba ogo, oun li Olorun
Yin In fun 'se iyanu ti O ti fihan
O wa pel’awon ero mimo lona
O si je imole won l'osan l'oru.
 Chorus:
Eyin Angeli didan, lu duru wura
Ki gbogbo yin juba, te n wo oju Re
Ni gbogbo 'joba Re, b'aye ti n yi lo
Ise Re yoo maa yin
Ise Re yoo maa yin
Fi ibukun fun Oluwa okan mi.

E yin fun rapada ti gbogbo okan
E yin fun orisun imularada
Fun inu rere ati itoju Re
Fun 'daniloju pe O n gbo adura,

E yin fun idanwo bi okun ife,
T'o n so wa po m’awon ohun orun
Fun 'gbagbo ti n segun , 'reti ti kii sa
Fun ile ogo to O ti pese fun wa.
(Amin).

title_english: O there's no sorrow in heaven
passage_english: SEAL NOT THE SAYINGS OF THIS PROPHECY REV. 22:10
passage_yoruba: MASE FI EDIDI DI ORO ISOTELE IFIHAN 22:10
verses_english:
O there's no sorrow in heaven,
No parting and no goodbye;
To those with sins all forgiven,
There'll be no tears in the sky.

Chorus:
No sorrow is found in that city,
No heartache and no goodbye;
For all will be bright in that city of light,
For there are no tears in the sky.

O there's no sad disappointment,
No eyes fill'd with tears to dry,
For there will be glad contentment,
There are no tears in the sky.

Up there no hearts that are broken,
There no one to breathe a sigh,
No unkind word will be spoken,
There'll be no tears in the sky.

Here hearts are sorrow'd by sadness,
For lov'd ones and friends must die;
But there is sunshine and gladness,
There'll be no tears in the sky.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ibanuje ko si lorun,
Beeni ko si ipinya
Fun awon ta ti dariji;
Ekun ki yoo si lorun.

Chorus:
Ibanuje ko si ni ‘lu naa,
Beeni ailera ko si,
Tori gbogbo ilu naa je imole
Tori ekun ko si lorun.

Aisedeede ko si nibe,
Ko s‘oju to n‘omije
Tori itelorun yoo wa;
Ekun ki yoo si lorun.

Ko si ‘robinuje l‘oke,
Ko si si imi edun;
A ki yio soro kikoro,
Ekun ki yio si lorun.

‘Banuje kun okan wa nihin,
‘Tori ipinya ti mbe;
Sugbon ayo l‘o wa l‘ohun,
Ekun ki yoo si lorun.
(Amin).

title_english: When the trumpet of the Lord shall sound
title_yoruba: ‘Gbati ipe Oluwa ba dun t’ aye yoo si fo lo
passage_english: A LITTLE WHILE, AND YE SHALL NOT SEE ME: AND AGAIN, A LITTLE WHILE, AND YE SHALL SEE ME, BECAUSE I GO TO THE FATHER. JOHN 16:16
passage_yoruba: nigba die, enyin ki o si ri mi; ati nigba die ewe, e o si ri mi, nitori ti emi n lo sodo baba. john 16:16
verses_english:
When the trumpet of the Lord shall sound, and time shall be no more,
And the morning breaks, eternal, bright and fair;
When the saved of earth shall gather over on the other shore,
And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.
Chorus:
When the roll is called up yonder,
When the roll is called up yonder,
When the roll is called up yonder,
When the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.

On that bright and cloudless morning when the dead in Christ shall rise,
And the glory of his resurrection share;
When his chosen ones shall gather to their home beyond the skies,
And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.

Let us labor for the Master from the dawn till setting sun,
Let us talk of all his wondrous love and care;
Then when all of life is over, and our work on earth is done,
And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
‘Gbati ipe Oluwa ba dun t’ aye yoo si fo lo
Ti imole ojo titun yoo si de;
Nigbati awon omo igbala, ba pejo loke
Ta ba si p’oruko nibe oun wa n’be.
 Chorus:
‘Gbat’ a ba p’oruko l’ ohun
Gbat’ a ba p’oruko l’ ohun 
Gbat’ a ba p’oruko l’ ohun
Nipa oore-ofe nikan un o wa n’be.

L’ooro ojo naa t’awon oku n’nu Kristi yoo jinde,
Ti won yoo si pin n’nu ogo ajinde 
‘Gbati awon ayanfe yoo pejo si ode orun,
T’a ba si p’oruko l’ohun un o wa n’be.

Je ki a fi gbogbo akoko wa sise f'Oluwa
Je ki a royin ife iyanu Re;
Nigbati a ba si pari ire-ije wa l’ aye 
T’a ba si p’oruko l’ohun un o wa n’be.
(Amin).

title_english: If all my sins could be written down
title_yoruba: Bi a ba ko ese mi sile
passage_english: FOR IF YE FORGIVE MEN THEIR TRESPASSES, YOUR HEAVENLY FATHER WILL ALSO FORGIVE YOU. MATT. 6:14
passage_yoruba: nitori bi enyin ba fi ese awon eniyan ji won, baba nyin ti mbe li orun yio fi ese ti nyin ji yin. matt. 6:14
verses_english:
If all my sins could be written down,
So I might their blackness see,
No joy of earth could my sorrows drown,
But God has forgiven me
 Chorus:
He blotted them out with His precious blood,
He wash'd my sins away,
And now I belong to the Lord for ever
And He is mine today.

If I could measure from west to east,
To see where my sins might be,
I could not find them the worst or least,
For God has forgiven me.

Since God remembers my sins no more,
But buried them in the sea,
I'll sing His praises, His name adore,
For God has forgiven me
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Bi a ba ko ese mi sile,
 Ki n si ri bo ti po to, 
Ibanuje mi yoo ti po to? 
Sugbon Baba ti we mi,
Chorus:
 O f’eje Re iyebiye we mimo
 O ko ese mi lo,
Nisisiyii mo di t‘Oluwa laelae
Oun na si je temi.

Bi mo ba le wo yi kaa kiri
Lati wa ese mi ri,
N ko le ri okan soso n‘nu re
Mo ti gba idariji.

Baba ko ranti ese mi mo,
Won ti lo s‘okun ‘gbagbe.
Un o korin iyin s‘oruko Re
 O sa ti dariji mi.
(Amin).

title_english: When you start for the land of heavenly rest
title_yoruba: Gbati o ba n lo sile sinmi orun
passage_english: FOR AS MANY AS ARE LED BY THE SPIRIT OF GOD, THEY ARE THE SONS OF GOD. ROM 8:14
passage_yoruba: nitori iye awon ti a n se amona fun lati odo emi olorun wa, awon ni ise omo olorun. rom. 8:14.
verses_english:
When you start for the land of heavenly rest,
Keep close to Jesus all the way;
For He is the guide, and He knows the way best,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.
Chorus:
Keep close to Jesus, keep close to Jesus,
Keep close to Jesus all the way;
By day or by night never turn from the right,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.

Never mind the storms of trials as you go,
Keep close to Jesus all the way;
’Tis a comfort and joy His favor to know,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.

To be safe from the darts of the evil one,
Keep close to Jesus all the way;
Take the shield of faith till the victory is won,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.

We shall reach our home in Heaven by and by,
Keep close to Jesus all the way;
Where to those we love we’ll never say goodbye,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbati o ba n lo sile sinmi orun,
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin
‘Tori Oun ni Oluto to mona ju
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin.
Chorus:
F’ara mo Jesu, F’ara mo Jesu
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin
L’osan tabi l’ oru ma se ya kuro,
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin.

Ma se ronu wahala ati’ ponju,
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin,
O dara lati ri oju rere Re,
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin.

Ki o ba le bo lowo ofa esu
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin,
Gbe apata igbagbo fun isegun,
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin,

Awa yoo de’le wa orun nigbose
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin,
Nibiti a kii wipe o digbose
Sunmo Jesu titi dopin.
(Amin).

title_english: When all my labours and trials are o'er
title_yoruba: Gbat‘ise oun danwo mi ba pari
passage_english: I WILL COME AGAIN, AND RECEIVE YOU UNTO MYSELF; THAT WHERE I AM, THERE YE MAY BE ALSO. JOHN 14:3
passage_yoruba: EMI O SI MU N YIN LO SODO EMI TIKARAMI; PE NIBITI EMI GBE WA, KI ENYIN LE WA NIBE PELU. JOHANU 14:3.
verses_english:
When all my labours and trials are o'er,
And I am safe on that beautiful shore,
Just to be near the dear Lord I adore,
Will thro' the ages be glory for me.
Chorus:
O that I will be glory for me,
Glory for me, glory for me;
When by His grace I shall look on His face,
That will be glory, be glory for me.

When, by the gift of His infinite grace,
I am accorded in Heaven a place,
Just to be there and to look on His face,
Will thro' the ages be glory for me.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbat‘ise oun danwo mi ba pari
Ti mo si gun s‘ebute rere naa;
Ki n sa le sunm‘Oluwa ti mo fe,
Eyii yoo je ogo fun mi,
Chorus:
Eyii yoo je ogo fun mi,
Ogo fun mi, ogo fun mi,
Ti un o w‘oju Re nipa oor‘ofe
Eyii yoo je ogo fun mi.

Nigba oore-ofe Re ailopin
B’a fi ipo kan li orun fun mi,
Ki n sa le wa n‘be lati w‘oju Re
Eyii yoo je ogo fun mi titi.

title_english: How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
passage_english: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. john 14:13
passage_yoruba: ohunkohun ti eyin ba si beere li oruko mi, oun naa li emi o se, ki a le yin baba logo ninu omo. johanu 14:13.
verses_english:
It makes the wounded spirit whole,
Blessed be the name of the Lord;
'Tis manna to the hungry soul,
Blessed be the name of the Lord.

It soothes the troubled sinner's breast,
Blessed be the name of the Lord;
It gives the weary sweetest rest,
Blessed be the name of the Lord.

Then will I tell the sinners round,
Blssed be the name of the Lord;
What a dear Saviour I have found,
Blessed be the name of the Lord.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
B’oruko Jesu ti dun to,
Ogo ni fun Oruko Re
O tan ‘banuje at’ogbe
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
Chorus:
Ogo f’ooko Re, ogo f’ooko Re
Ogo f’oruko Oluwa
Ogo f’ooko Re, ogo f’ooko Re
Ogo f’oruko Oluwa

O wo okan to gbogbe san
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
Onje ni f’okan t’ebi n pa
Ogo ni fun oruko Re

O tan aniyan elese,
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
Ofun alaare ni ‘sinmi
Ogo ni fun oruko Re.

N je un o royin naa f’elese,
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
Pe mo ti ri Olugbala
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
(Amin).

title_english: There's a place I love to tarry
passage_english: MY SOUL LONGETH, YEA, EVEN FAINTETH FOR THE COURTS OF THE LORD: MY HEART AND MY FLESH CRIETH OUT FOR THE LIVING GOD PS 84:2
passage_yoruba: OKAN MI N FA NITOOTO, O TILE POUNGBE FUN AGBALA OLUWA, AYA MI ATI ARA MI N KIGBE SI OLORUN ALAAYE. PS 84:2
verses_english:
There's a place I love to tarry
When my soul is sad, oppressed,
'Tis alone with Christ my Saviour,
Where He bids me `Come and rest.
Chorus:
Just to be alone with Jesus,
Just to hear Him softly say:
`Fear not, though the world forsake you,
`Lo I'm with you alway.`

When the cares of life are heavy,
And beneath my cross I bend;
Then I go alone with Jesus,
For He is my dearest Friend.

When the tempter would assail me,
Jesus bids me to Him flee;
He's my Refuge, Friend and Saviour,
He is all in all to me.

Chorus
Just to be alone with Jesus,
Just to hear Him softly say:
`Fear not, though the world forsake you,
`Lo I'm with you alway.`
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ibikan wa ti mo feran,
 ‘Gbati okan mi poruuru
Ki n wa pelu Kristi nikan
Ti o n wipe; “Wa sinmi”.
Chorus:Ki n wa pelu Jesu nikan
Ki n gbohun jeje Re pe,
“Mase beru b’ aye ko o,
Emi wa pelu re”.

‘Gbat’ eru aye ba wuwo,
Ti o si te’ri mi ba,
Un o lo sodo Jesu nikan,
“Tori Ore mi ni Oun”

‘Gbati esu n fe lepa mi,
Jesu wipe ki n sa wa
Oun ni aabo at’ore mi,
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi.
(Amin).

title_english: Listen to the Master's pleading.
title_yoruba: Gbo bi Oluwa ti un bebe
passage_english: GO YE THEREFORE, AND TEACH ALL NATIONS, BAPTIZING THEM IN THE NAME OF THE FATHER, AND OF THE SON, AND OF THE HOLY GHOST. MATT. 28:19
passage_yoruba: nitorina e lo, e maa ko orile-ede gbogbo, ki e si maa baptisi won li oruko baba, ati ni ti omo ati ni ti emi mimo. matt. 28:19
verses_english:
Listen to the Master's pleading,
There is urgent work for all;
Heed the Spirit's interceding,
Give this answer to the call.
Chorus
I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord,
Here am I, send me,
I am willing to be what you'd have me be,
I will go where you want me to go

I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord,
Here am I, send me,
Though the pathway seems dark for Thee I'll do or die,
I am ready for service, Lord.

There's a voice to you now calling,
Will you heed the earnest word?
On the ear 'tis gently falling,
Give this answer to your Lord.

Many souls in sin are dying;
Haste to help them while you may,
For the time is swiftly flying,
Will you now to Jesus say?
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbo bi Oluwa ti un bebe,
Ise wa fun gbogbo wa;
Gbo bi Emi ti n wi,
Je ipe nla bayii pe:
Chorus:
Mo setan lati sise fun O Jesu,
Emi de, ran mi;
Mo n fe lati se ife Re ni pipe,
Un o lo sibi ti O ba ran mi
Mo setan lati sise fun O Jesu
Emi de, ran mi;
Bi ona tile sokunkun, eru ko bami
Mo setan fun ise Jesu.

Ohun kan pe O nisisiyii,
Fi eti si ohun naa;
O n so si o l‘eti jeje,
Je ipe naa bayii pe.

Okan pupo n ku n‘nu ese,
Yara lati se ‘ranwo;
‘Tori akoko n koja lo,
So fun Jesu bayii pe.
(Amin).

title_english: There is sunshine in the valley
passage_english: Who went in the way before you, to search you out a place to pitch your tents in. deut. 1:33.
passage_yoruba: Ti n lo ni ona saju yin,… lati fi ona ti eyin o gba han yin. Deut. 1:33
verses_english:
There is sunshine in the valley,
There is sunshine on the hill.
Jesus brought it to this darkened world below,
There is sunshine in the flowers,
Blooming by the rippling rill,
There is blessed sunshine ev'rywhere I go.
Chorus
Sunshine, sunshine of His love divine,
Sunshine, sunshine beams so brightly shine,
Sunshine, sunshine, in this world below,
Sunshine, sunshine ev'rywhere I go.

There is sunshine on the meadow,
And upon the mossy lane,
Where the birds are warbling notes of joy and praise
There is sunshine on the mountain,
There is sunshine on the plain,
Let all nature now the happy chorus praise.

Tho' the world is full of sunshine
Brightly beaming ev'ryday,
There are souls who live in darkness all the while,
They have never heard of Jesus,
Nor His tender, loving care,
Let us help and cheer them with a sunny smile.

Chorus:
Sunshine, sunshine of His love divine,
Sunshine, sunshine beams so brightly shine,
Sunshine, sunshine, in this world below,
Sunshine, sunshine ev'rywhere I go.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
‘Mole wa l’afonifoji,
‘Mole wa lori oke
Jesu lo mu wa s’aye okunkun yi
‘Mole wa lara itanna
T’o n dagba l’eba odo,
Imole wa nibikibi ti mo nlo
Chorus:
‘Mole, ‘mole ti’ fe Re orun
‘Mole, ‘mole itansan oorun
‘Mole, ‘mole li aye wa yii
‘Mole, ‘mole lona mi gbogbo.

Imole wa lori papa
Ati lori koriko
Nibiti awon eiye n korin iyin
Imole wa lori oke
‘Mole wa ni petele
Je ki gbogbo eda jumo korin Iyin.

B’aye tile kun fun imole
T’ o si n tan lojoojumo
Okan pupo wa n’nu okunkun sibee
Ti ko gb’ oruko Jesu ri
Tabi ife ‘yanu Re
Je ki a fi oro Re ran won l’owo.
(Amin)

title_english: Savior, like a shepherd lead us
passage_english: IN MY FATHER'S HOUSE ARE MANY MANSIONS: IF IT WERE NOT SO, I WOULD HAVE TOLD YOU. I GO TO PREPARE A PLACE FOR YOU. JOHN 14:2
passage_yoruba: ninu ile baba mi opolopo ibugbe li o wa, iba mase bee emi iba ti so fun yin. nitori emi n lo pese aaye sile fun yin. johanu 14:2
verses_english:
Savior, like a shepherd lead us,
Much we need Thy tender care;
In Thy pleasant pastures feed us,
For our use Thy folds prepare.
Chorus:
Blessèd Jesus, blessèd Jesus!
Thou hast bought us, Thine we are. (2x)

We are Thine, Thou dost befriend us,
Be the guardian of our way;
Keep Thy flock, from sin defend us,
Seek us when we go astray.

Early let us seek Thy favor,
Early let us do Thy will;
Blessèd Lord and only Savior,
With Thy love our bosoms fill.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
Oluso-agutan to wa
Awa fe itoju Re
Fun wa ni ibukun t‘a nfe,
Si pese aaye fun wa,
Chorus:
Jesu mimo, Jesu mimo
O ra wa, Tire ni awa (2x)

Tire ni wa fi wa s‘ore,
Maa se amona fun wa,
Gba agbo Re lowo ese.
Wa wa ‘gbat‘ a ba sina

Je ka tete wa oju Re,
Je ka tete se‘fe Re,
Oluwa at' olubukun,
Fi 'fe Re kun okan wa.
(Amin).

title_english: Alas! And did my Savior bleed.
passage_english:
for he shall bear their iniquities.
isaiah 53:11
passage_yoruba: nitori yio ru aisedede won wonni. isaiah 53:11.
verses_english:
Alas! And did my Savior bleed
And did my Sovereign die?
Would He devote that sacred head
For such a worm as I?
Chorus:
At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,
And the burden of my heart rolled away,
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day!

Was it for crimes that I had done
He groaned upon the tree?
Amazing pity! grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!

Well might the sun in darkness hide
And shut his glories in,
When Christ, the mighty Maker died,
For man the creature’s sin.

Thus might I hide my blushing face
While His dear cross appears
Dissolve my heart in thankfulness,
And melt mine eyes to tears.

But drops of grief can ne’er repay
The debt of love I owe:
Here, Lord, I give myself away
’Tis all that I can do.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
O se! Olugbala mi ta
‘Je Re sile O ku,
N je O je f’ori mimo naa
Fun kokoro b‘emi.
Chorus:Nibi agbelebu ni mo ko ri ‘mole.
Ni’be, eru okan mi si fo lo;
Nibe, nipa igbagbo mo riran,
N‘siyii, mo wa l‘alaafia titi.

N je ‘to r‘ese ti mo ti da
L‘O se jiya oro,
Aanu at‘oore ofe yii
Ko se diwon rara.

O to k‘oorun ko s‘okunkun,
K’o f‘ogo re pamo;
Nigba Kristi Eleda nla ku
F’ese awa eda.

Bee l’o ye ki n f’oju pamo
Nibi agbelebu
K’okan mi si yo ni ‘dupe
K’oju mi s’omije.

Sugbon ‘banuje ko le san
‘Gbese‘fe ti mo je,
Kristi mo f‘ara mi fun O
Eyii ni mo le se.
(Amin).

title_english: I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood
title_yoruba: Agbara n be n‘nu eje Jesu,
passage_english: WITH HIS STRIPES WE ARE HEALED. ISAIAH 53:5
passage_yoruba: nipa ina re li a fi mu wa larada. isaiah 53:5
verses_english:
I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood
For He washed my sins away;
And I know there is joy in serving Him
For He turned my night to day.
Chorus:
There is power, power, wonder working power
There is power, power, purifying power,
There is pow'r in Jesus blood.

I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood,
From my guilt He set me free;
When I came unto Him with all my sins
And His blood availed for me.

I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood,
For all things have been made new;
Since His own precious blood has been applied
And has cleansed me through and through.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Agbara n be n‘nu eje Jesu,
Tori o w‘ese mi nu;
Mo si mo pe isin Re li ayo,
O s‘okun mi di ‘mole. 
 Chorus:
 Agbara n be, agbara t‘o n sise yanu
Agbara n be; agbara t’o n we wa mo
Un be ninu eje Jesu.

Agbara n be n‘nu eje Jesu
O gba mi lowo ebi,
‘Gbati mo k‘eru ese mi too wa
Eje Re si we mi mo.

Emi mo ire t‘Eje naa n se,
O ti so wa di titun
Nipa eje Re iyebiye naa,
Mo di mimo titi lae.

title_english: Blessed invitation from the King of Heav'n
passage_english: FOR THE TRANSGRESSION OF MY PEOPLE WAS HE STRICKEN. ISAIAH 53:8
passage_yoruba: nitori irekoja awon eniyan mi li a se lu u. isaiah 53:8
verses_english:
Blessed invitation from the King of Heav'n,
Blessed invitation by the Spirit given,
Falling on the weary like refreshing dew,
Whosoe'er believeth, that means you.
Chorus:
That means you, brother, that means you;
Trust the Saviour's promise tried and true (my brother)
That means you, brother, that means you;
Whosoe'er believeth that means you.

Reconciliation thro' His precious blood
He hath wrought salvation blessed Son of God!
All the work is finished, there is naught to do,
But to claim the blessing, that means you.

Saving all who trust Him to the uttermost,
Boasting is excluded, yet in Him we boast,
Soul, receive the message, wonderful and true,
Whosoe'er believeth that means you.

Doubt His word no longer, come to Him today,
Turning from your sins for ever more away;
Thro' his boundless mercy, all shall be forgiv'n
He will safely guide you home to heaven.

There in realms of glory we will sing His praise,
With the shout of triumph thro' eternal days,
For the invitation, old yet ever new;
Glory, Hallelujah! That means you.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ipe to ni 'bukun lat’oke orun
Ipe to ni bukun li Emi pe wa,
O n fi agbara fun eniti n sare
Enit‘o ba gbagbo fun o ni.
Chorus:
Fun o ni ara fun o ni.
Gbekele leri Re to daju (ara mi)
Fun o ni, ara fun o ni
Enit‘o ba gbagbo, fun o ni.

O ti f‘eje Re ‘yebiye se ‘laja
Omo Olorun ti sise igbala;
Gbogbo ise naa ti pari, o pari
Lati gba bukun naa, fun o ni.

Yoo gba enit‘o ba gbagbo la dopin,
Otito li eyii, o da wa loju;
Gba ise otito ati ‘yanu yii
Enit‘o ba gbagbo, fun o ni.

Ma siyemeji mo, wa do Re loni,
Kuro ninu ese re patapata;
Tori aanu Re nla, yoo dariji o,
Yoo si samona re de orun.

L’ohun n’ile ogo ao korin ‘yin Re,
Li ohun isegun; lae ati laelae,
B‘ipe naa tile pe sibe titun ni,
Ogo, Alleluyah, fun o ni.
(Amin).

title_english: Have you read the story of the Cross
passage_english: AFTER THIS, JESUS KNOWING THAT ALL THINGS WERE NOW ACCOMPLISHED, HE SAITH, I THIRST. JOHN 19:28
passage_yoruba: bi jesu ti mo pe, a ti pari ohun gbogbo tan, o wipe, orungbe n gbe mi. johanu 19:28
verses_english:
Have you read the story of the Cross,
Where Jesus bled and died;
Where your debt was paid by His precious blood
That flowed from His wounded side.
Chorus:
He died of a broken heart for you,
He died of a broken heart;
Upon a tree, for you, for me,
He died of a broken heart.

Have you read how they placed the crown of thorn
Upon His brow for you,
When He prayed, "Forgive them, oh forgive;
They know not what they do?"

Have you read how He saved the dying thief
When hanging on the tree,
When he looked with pleading eyes and said,
"Dear Lord, remember Me?"

Have you read that He looked to heaven and said,
"‘Tis finished?" 'Twas for thee!
Have you ever said, "I thank Thee, Lord,
For giving Thy life for me?"
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
O ti ka itan agbelebu,
Nibiti Jesu ku;
Nibiti eje Re iyebiye
Ti san gbogbo gbese re?
Chorus:
O ku iku ‘banuje fun o,
O ku iku ‘banuje;
A! ife iyanu fun o,
O ku iku ‘banuje.

O ti ka b‘a ti f’ade egun
De ori Re fun o;
‘Gbat‘O gbadura pe, “Dariji won
Won se lai-mokan sa ni.

O ti ka b‘O ti gb‘ole ni la
T‘o n ku lo lori igi;
Nigbati o fi ikaanu wipe,
Oluwa, joo ranti mi.

O ti ka b‘O ti gb‘oju s’oke
T’O wipe, “O pari”
O ti so pe, “Mo dupe Oluwa,
Nitori O ku fun mi”.
(Amin).

title_english: Like a shepherd, tender, true
passage_english: I AM THE GOOD SHEPHERD: THE GOOD SHEPHERD GIVETH HIS LIFE FOR THE SHEEP. JOHN 10:11
passage_yoruba: oluwa li oluso-agutan rere, oluso-agutan rere fie mi re lele nitori awon agutan. johanu 10:11
verses_english:
Like a shepherd, tender, true,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
Daily finds us pastures new,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.
If thick mists are o'er the way
Or the flock 'mid danger feeds,
He will watch them lest they stray,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.

All along life's rugged road,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
Till we reach yon blest abode,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.
All the way, before He's trod,
And He now the flock precedes,
Safe into the folds of God,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.

Through the sunlight ways of life,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads,
Through the warrings and the strife,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.
When we reach the Jordan's tide,
Where life's boundary line recedes,
He will spread the waves aside,
Jesus leads, Jesus leads.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
B‘oluso-agutan rere
Jesu n to wa, Jesu n to wa,
Si papa oko tutu,
Jesu n to wa, O n to wa.
Bi ‘kunku ba bo ona,
T‘ewu si yi agbo ka,
Ki yoo jeki won sina,
Jesu n to wa, O je ki n to wa.

Ninu wahala aye,
Jesu n to wa, Jesu n to wa,
Titi ao fi de oke,
Jesu n to wa, O n to wa.
O ti rin ona naa ri,
O si n ko agutan Re,
Lo sinu agbo t‘orun
Jesu n to wa, O n to wa.

Ninu ‘mole aye yii
Jesu n to wa, Jesu n to wa,
Laarin ogun at‘ija
Jesu n to wa, O n to wa.
‘Gbat‘ a ba d'odo Jordan
Nibiti ajo wa pin,
Yoo si pin omi n‘iya.
Jesu n to wa, O n to wa.
(Amin).

title_english: O Thou in whose presence my soul takes delight
title_yoruba: Iwo niwaju eniti okan mi n yo
passage_english: FOR HIS MERCIFUL KINDNESS IS GREAT TOWARD US, PRAISE YE THE LORD. PS. 117:2
passage_yoruba: nitori iseun aanu re po si wa; e yin oluwa. orin dafidi 117:2
verses_english:
O Thou in whose presence my soul takes delight,
On whom in affliction I call,
My comfort by day and my song in the night,
My hope, my salvation, my all!

Where dost Thou, dear Shepherd, resort with Thy sheep.
To feed them in pastures of love;
Say, why in the valley of death should I weep,
Or alone in this wilderness rove?

He looks! and the thousands of angels rejoice,
And myriads wait for His word;
He speaks! and eternity filled with His voice,
Re-echoes the praise of the Lord.
verses_yoruba:
Iwo niwaju eniti okan mi n yo,
Ti mo n pe nigba iponju,
‘Tunu mi losan at‘orin mi loru,
‘Reti mi at‘igbala mi.

Nibo l’o n ko awon agutan Re lo?
Lati f'ounje ife bo won,
Eese ti un fi sokun lainidi
Tabi nikan rin l‘aginju?

O siju wo, opo Angeli si yo,
Pupo si duro d‘oro Re;
O soro, ayeraye si gbohun Re,
E korin iyin s'Oluwa.

Olugbala emi yoo je Ipe Re,
Emi mo adun ohun Re;
Pa mi mo ‘tori Iwo ni gbogbo mi,
Un o ma yo ninu Re titi.
(Amin).

title_english: Christ is my portion for ever
passage_english: BUT YE ARE NOT IN THE FLESH, BUT IN THE SPIRIT. ROMANS 8:9
passage_yoruba: sugbon eyin ko si ninu ti ara bikose ninu ti emi. romu 8:9
verses_english:
Christ is my portion for ever,
He is my Saviour from sin;
He is my blessed salvation,
I have the witness within.
Chorus:
I have the witness within?
Jesus now saves me from sin?
In His heart I've a place,
I am saved by His grace,
And I have the witness within.

He is my Fortress and Tower
He is my Guide and King;
He is my Shepherd, my Keeper,
Joyfully now I can sing.

Praise the One who redeems me,
Praise to my Crucified Lord,
Now I am saved, Hallelujah,
Praise the wonderful word.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Kristi ni ‘pin mi titi,
Oun lo n gba mi nin‘ese.
O je ona igbala mi,
Eri yii wa l‘okan mi.
Chorus:
Eri yii wa l‘okan mi,
Jesu gba mi lowo ese,
Mo layo l’aya Re,
Oor‘-ofe Re gba mi,
Eri yii si wa l’okan mi.

Oun ni odi agbara mi,
Amona at‘Oba mi.
Oun si ni Olupamo mi,
N je mo le f’ayo korin.

Iyin fun Enit‘O ra mi,
Iyin f‘Eni ti a pa,
Nje emi bo, Halleluyah!
Iyin fun oro‘yanu.
(Amin).

title_english: Just as God who reigns on High
passage_english: AND THE LORD CAME, AND STOOD, AND CALLED AS AT OTHER TIMES. I SAM. 3:10
passage_yoruba: oluwa wa, o si duro, o si pe bi igba ti o koja. i samueli 3:10
verses_english:
Just as God who reigns on High
Spake to men in days gone by,
So the Lord is calling men today;
And, my brother this is true,
Whatso-e'er He says to you
There is but one thing to do, just obey.
Chorus:
Just obey, just obey,
Is the way, God's way;
When His message comes to you,
There is but one thing to do,
Just obey, just obey.

If you're in the Saviour's hands,
You must do as He commands,
For there is no other gospel way;
Never put the message by,
Never stop to reason why,
When the Saviour speaks to you, just obey.

If for mansions fair you sigh
In that land beyond the sky
After time with you has pass'd away;
Tho' the way you may not see,
Christ is calling 'Follow Me'
Faith and duty both will cry just obey.
Chorus:
Just obey, just obey,
Is the way, God's way;
When His message comes to you,
There is but one thing to do,
Just obey, just obey.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
B‘Olorun Oba orun.
Ti maa n soro nigbaani;
O tun n ba wa soro bee loni.
Arakunrin, ooto ni,
Ohun to ba wi fun o;
Ohun kan laigbodo mase—gboran.
Chorus:
Sa gboran, sa gboran,
Eyii ni ‘fe Re.
‘Gbat‘O ba ranse si o,
Ohun kan ni ki o se,
Sa gboran, sa gboran.

Bi o ba je t‘Oluwa,
O ni lati gbo Tire,
Ko s‘ona ‘hinrere miran mo.
Mase sa ase Re ti,
Ma si se lo oro Re,
Gbat‘Olugbala ba n soro, sa gbo.

Bi o ba fe ni ipin,
N‘ilu daradara ni
Leyin aye wa buburu yii;
Bi o ko tile m‘ona,
Krist‘ yoo wipe, “Tele Mi”,
Igbagbo yoo si wipe, “sa gboran”.
Chorus:
Sa gboran, sa gboran,
Eyii ni ‘fe Re.
‘Gbat‘O ba ranse si o,
Ohun kan ni ki o se,
Sa gboran, sa gboran.
(Amin).

title_english: There is vict'ry within my soul
passage_english: FOR AS MANY AS ARE LED BY THE SPIRIT OF GOD, THEY ARE THE SONS OF GOD. ROMANS 8:14
passage_yoruba: nitori iye awon ti a n se amona fun lati odo emi olorun wa, awon ni ise omo olorun. romu 8:14
verses_english:
There is vict'ry within my soul
For the spirit with me abides,
Let the waves of temptation roll,
Jesus keeps me what-e'er betides.
Chorus:
Victory, victory, vict'ry in my soul;
I have glorious victory since Jesus took control,
Victory, victory, sweeping like a flood,
I have glorious victory through Jesus' blood.

Though the conflict be fierce and long,
Though the tempter my heart assail,
In my weakness yet I am strong,
For with Jesus I'll e'er prevail.

I have victory over sin,
I have victory o'er the grave;
Even death now has lost its sting,
Hallelujah! I know I'm saved.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Isegun wa li okan mi,
Nitori Emi n gbe ‘nu mi;
Je ki igbi ‘danwo de,
Jesu mura lati gba mi.
Chorus:
Isegun! Isegun! ‘Segun l‘okan mi,
Mo ni isegun nla ‘tori Jesu gb‘okan mi.
Isegun! Isegun! Bi odo sisan,
Mo ni ‘segun nla ninu eje Jesu.

Bi ‘ja tile t’o si pe,
B‘esu tile b‘okan mi ja;
Sibe mo je alagbara,
Lagbara Jesu ni o segun.

Mo ni ‘segun lori ese,
Mo ni ‘segun lori ‘boji,
Ani iku ko ni ‘pa mo,
Aleluya! emi ti la.
(Amin).

title_english: There is singing up in heaven
passage_english: SANG AS IT WERE A NEW SONG BEFORE THE THRONE. REV. 14:3
passage_yoruba: won si n ko bi enipe orin titun niwaju ite ni. ifihan 14:3
verses_english:
There is singing up in heaven such as we have never known,
Where the angels sing the praises of the Lamb upon the throne,
Their sweet harps are ever tuneful and their voices always clear,
O that we might be more like them while we serve the Master here!
Chorus:
Holy, holy, is what the angels sing,
And I expect to help them make the courts of heaven ring;
But when I sing redemption's story they will fold their wings,
For angels never feel the joys that our salvation brings.

But I hear another anthem blending voices clear and strong,
Unto Him that hath redeem'd us and hath bought us, is the song;
We have come thro' tribulations to this land so fair and bright,
In the fountain freely flowing He hath made our garments white.

Then the angels stand and listen, for they cannot join that song
Like the sound of many waters by that happy, blood-wash'd throng;
For they sing about great trials, battles fought and vict'ries won,
And they praise their great Redeemer who hath said to them, Well done!

So, although I'm not an angel, yet I know that over there
I will join a blessed chorus that the angels cannot share;
I will sing about my Saviour who upon dark Calvary
Freely pardon'd my transgressions, died to set a sinner free.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Orin n be li orun, iru eyii ti awa ko mo,
Nibiti awon Angeli n korin iyin s‘Od’agutan.
Harpu won ni ohun didun, ohun won si dun pelu,
A! ki awa le se bi ti won lati le sin Oluwa.
Chorus:
Mimo, Mimo l‘awon Angeli nko,
Mo si ni ‘reti lati ba won korin li orun,
Sugbon won ko le ba mi korin ti irapada,
‘Tori Angeli ko mo ayo ti ‘gbala mu wa.

Sugbon mo gbo orin miran ti a ko l‘ohun oke
Si Enit‘ ora wa pada t‘O si gba wa lorin wa;
Awa ti la iponju ja wa si ile didan yii,
Nibi orisun ‘ye ti n san l‘O ti fo aso wa mo.

Awon angeli dake, ‘tori won ko le korin naa,
Bi iro omi pupo l‘enu awon t‘a f‘eje ra!
‘Tori won nso ti ‘segun lori ‘danwo at‘ija,
Won si nyin Olurapada ti O ti wipe, O seun.

Bi emi ko tile n se Angeli, mo mo pe lohun
Un o b‘awon mimo korin t‘awon Angeli ko ni ko;
Un o k’orin ti Olugbala ti O ku ni Kalfari
Lati dari ese mi ji mi, lati da mi sile.
(Amin).

title_english: All that draw me I have left behind
title_yoruba: Gbogb‘ ohun to n fa mi, mo f‘ile
passage_english: ABIDE IN ME, AND I IN YOU. JOHN 15:4
passage_yoruba: e maa gbe inu mi, emi o si maa gbe inu yin. johanu 15:4
verses_english:
All that draw me I have left behind
Here in Canaan better joys I find;
Peace abiding, blessings unconfined,
For I'm living in Canaan now.
Chorus:
I am living in Canaan now,
Where the showers of blessing abound,
Where the riches of grace in plenty are found,
I am living in Canaan now.

Safe abiding I will never fear,
For my Saviour ever will be near;
When I call Him He will always hear,
For I'm living in Canaan now.

I am drinking from a ceaseless well,
Here in Canaan where I love to dwell,
So to others I am glad to tell,
That I'm living in Canaan now.

Praises ever I am glad to bring
Unto Jesus, my Redeemer, King;
For His mercies I will shout and sing,
For I'm living in Canaan now.
Chorus:
I am living in Canaan now,
Where the showers of blessing abound,
Where the riches of grace in plenty are found,
I am living in Canaan now.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbogb‘ ohun to n fa mi, mo f‘ile,
Nihin ni Kenaan mo ri ayo;
Alaafia, ‘bukun ‘yebiye,
‘Tori mo gbe Kenaan nisisiyii.
Chorus:
Mo n gbe Kenaan nisisiyii.
Nib’ owara ibukun gbe wa,
Nibi a ni oro opo oor‘ofe,
Mo n gbe Kenani nisisiyii.

Mo n gbe lailewu nko je beru,
Olugbala mi wa nitosi,
Gba mo ba pe yoo gb’adura mi,
‘Tori mo n gbe Kenaani n‘siyi.

Mo mu omi kanga alaigbe,
Ni Kenaan ibugbe ife mi!
Emi o so fun elomiran
Pe emi n gbe n‘ile Kenaani.

Iyin ailopin ni mo mu wa
Fun Jesu, Oba Irapada;
Em‘ o korin opo aanu Re,
‘Tori mo ngbe Kenaani n‘ siyi.
Chorus:
Mo n gbe Kenaan nisisiyii.
Nib’ owara ibukun gbe wa,
Nibi a ni oro opo oor‘ofe,
Mo n gbe Kenani nisisiyii.
(Amin).

title_english: I need not lack for inward power
passage_english: FOR AS MANY AS ARE LED BY THE SPIRIT OF GOD, THEY ARE THE SONS OF GOD. ROM. 8:14
passage_yoruba: awon ti a n se amona fun lati odo emi olorun wa, awon ni i se omo olorun. romu 8:14
verses_english:
I need not lack for inward power
To live a righteous life;
For God is with me
Every hour to help me in the strife.
Chorus:
O that I might fully trust Him!
For I know that He is nigh;
He will never leave me helpless
All my needs He will supply.

I need not lack for friendship true,
For Jesus is my friend;
Though other friends are sometimes few,
He loves us to the end.

I need not lack for joy sublime,
His joy remains in me;
Earths pleasure last but for a time,
His last eternally.

I need not lack for anything,
For God is all in all;
And so each day His praise I sing,
And on His name I call.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Emi ko le sai l‘agbara,
Lati j‘olododo;
‘Tori Olorun n be fun mi,
Lati ran mi lowo.
Chorus:
A! m ba le gbeke mi le E,
Bi Oun ti wa nitosi,
Oun ko ni sai ran mi lowo,
Yoo si pese f‘aini mi.

N ko le sai ma l‘ore tooto,
Jesu li ore mi;
B‘ore miran ko tile si,
Jesu fe wa dopin.

N ko le sai ma layo giga,
Ayo Re wa n‘nu mi;
Kukuru ni ayo t‘aye,
Tire wa titi lae.

N ko le sai ma l‘ohun gbogbo,
Olorun je gbogbo;
Mo n korin ‘yin Re lojoojo,
Mo n pe oruko Re.
(Amin).

title_english: I have a precious Saviour
passage_english: BUT HE WAS WOUNDED FOR OUR TRANSGRESSIONS. ISAIAH 53:5
passage_yoruba: sugbon a saa li ogbe nitori irekoja wa. isaiah 53:5
verses_english:
I have a precious Saviour,
He came from Heav'n above
And died for me on Calvary,
To prove His matchless love.
This love so freely given,
He offers now to you;
Won't you let my Saviour be your Saviour too?
Chorus:
Won't you let Him be your Saviour too?
He would prove a faithful friend to you,
He would purify your soul, keep you ever pure and whole,
Won't you ever let my Saviour be your Saviour too?

I have a loving Saviour,
He hears me when I call;
He helps to bear each load of care,
And lifts me when I fall;
So kind is he, so tender,
Compassionate and true,
Won't you let my Saviour be your Saviour too?

I have a faithful Saviour,
With me He will abide;
And hold my hand until I land
Upon the other side.
Someday in all His glory,
My Saviour I shall view;
Brother, won't you let Him be your Saviour too?
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo ni Olugbala kan,
O wa lati orun,
O ku fun mi ni Kalfari
Lati f’ife Re han;
Iru‘fe t‘o ni si mi
Oun na ‘wo Re si o,
Wo ko ha nigba Jesu ni ni tire.
Chorus:
Wo ko ha ni je ki O gba o,
Oun yoo je ore tooto fun o,
Yoo we okan re mo, yoo si so o di pipe,
Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu mi ni tire?

Mo l‘Olugbala rere,
O n gbohun ipe mi,
O n ru gbogbo wahala mi,
O m‘ese mi duro;
O s‘onimu ‘re tobe,
O l‘aanu at‘ooto,
‘Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu mi ni tire?

Mo l‘Olugbala tooto,
Oun yoo ma ba mi gbe,
Yoo si di owo mi mu
Titi un o fi gunle;
L‘ojo kan n‘nu ogo Re
Un o r‘Olugbala mi,
Ara, ‘wo ko ha ni gba A l‘Oluwa.
(Amin).

title_english: There's a land of peace and plenty
passage_english: PEACE I LEAVE WITH YOU. JOHN 14:27
passage_yoruba: alaafia ni mo fi sile fun yin. joh. 14:27
verses_english:
There's a land of peace and plenty, and its gates are open wide,
And the pure in heart and holy, in its shelter may abide;
It is not thro' gates of glory that a soul must enter in;
But all who would find entrance there must leave the ways of sin.
Chorus:
Come over, come over, to the land of corn and wine,
There is nothing can compare with the many holy pleasures there,
Come over, come over, leave the desert plain below,
And come away, away come over.

There is bread of heaven growing, in its fair and fertile fields,
And the wine of love its vineyard to the thirsting mortal yields;
There are mountain heights of glory that await the trav'lers rod,
And blest retreats where empty souls draw nearer unto God.

Who would stay without its borders, in the desert dark and drear,
When the luscious grapes of Eschol are so very, very near?
Enter in then with rejoicing, for the Lord is on your side,
And in His glorious presence evermore you shall abide.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ile alafia kan wa, ti ‘lekun re si sile,
Eniti okan re funfun, ti o si mo, yoo gbe be;
Ki se enu ona ogo nikan li a ni ba wole,
Sugbon eniti yoo wo ‘be yoo k‘ese sile na.
Chorus:
Wa nihin, wa nihin si‘le eletu loju.
Ko s‘ohun t‘a le fi we adun mimo ti o wa nibe.
Wa nihin, wa nihin, fi asale yii sile;
Si jade wa, jade, jade wa.

Irugbin orun n hu nibe, ni ‘le re ti o lora,
O si n hu igi ajara ti o n tu okan lara;
Oke giga didan wa nbe t‘o je ibi itura,
Aabo t‘o daju ni O je f‘okan t’o sunmo On.

Tani ko fe lo si‘le naa to fe joko s‘asale,
‘Gbati eso ile naa pon, ti ‘be si wa nitosi?
N je fi ayo wo ile, ‘tori Oluwa n bebe fun O,
Niwaju ‘te ogo Re, ni ‘wo o maa gbe titi.
(Amin).

title_english: There's a great day coming
title_yoruba: Ojo nla kan n bo wa
passage_english: FOR HE COMETH TO JUDGE THE EARTH: HE SHALL JUDGE THE WORLD WITH RIGHTEOUSNESS. PS. 96:13
passage_yoruba: nitoriti n bowa se idajo aye; yoo fi ododo se idajo aye ati ti eniyan. od. 96:13
verses_english:
There’s a great day coming,
A great day coming;
There’s a great day coming by and by,
When the saints and the sinners shall be parted right and left,
Are you ready for that day to come?
Chorus:
Are you ready? Are you ready?
Are you ready for the judgment day?
Are you ready? Are you ready?
For the judgment day?

There’s a bright day coming,
A bright day coming;
There’s a bright day coming by and by.
But its brightness shall only come to them that love the Lord.
Are you ready for that day to come?

There’s a sad day coming,
A sad day coming;
There’s a sad day coming by and by,
When the sinner shall hear his doom, "Depart, I know you not!"
Are you ready for that day to come?
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ojo nla kan n bo wa;
Ojo nla kan n bo;
Ojo nla kan n bowa, nigbose,
T‘awon eniyan mimo at‘elese yoo pinya,
Iwo ha setan fun ojo naa?
Chorus:
O ha setan? O ha setan?
O setan fun ojo idajo?
O ha setan? O ha setan?
Fun Ojo ‘dajo.

Ojo didan kan n bo;
Ojo naa n bowa,
Ojo didan kan n bo, nigbose,
Sugbon didan re je ti awon to fe Oluwa,
Iwo ha setan fun ojo naa?

Ojo ‘banuje n bo;
Ojo naa n bo wa,
Ojo ‘banuje n bo nigbose,
Ti elese yoo gbo pe “Lo, Emi ko mo yin ri”,
Iwo ha setan fun ojo na?
(Amin).

title_english: All to Jesus I surrender
title_yoruba: Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu
passage_english: EACH OF YOU SHOULD USE WHATEVER GIFT YOU HAVE RECEIVED TO SERVE OTHERS. 1 PET. 4:10
passage_yoruba: BI OLUKULUKU TI RI EBUN GBA, BEENI KI E MAA SE IPINFUNNI RE LAARIN ARA YIN. 1 PET. 4:10
verses_english:
All to Jesus I surrender,
All to Him I freely give;
I will ever love and trust Him,
In His presence daily live.

Chorus:
I surrender all, I surrender all,
All to Thee, my blessed saviour,
I surrender all.

All to Jesus I surrender,
Humbly at His feet I bow,
Worldly pleasures all forsaken;
Take me, Jesus, take me now.

All to Jesus I surrender,
Make me, Savior, wholly Thine;
Let me feel Thy Holy Spirit,
Truly know that Thou art mine.

All to Jesus I surrender,
Lord, I give myself to Thee;
Fill me with Thy love and power,
Let Thy blessing fall on me.

All to Jesus I surrender,
Now I feel the sacred flame.
Oh, the joy of full salvation!
Glory, glory to His name!

Chorus:
I surrender all, I surrender all,
All to Thee, my blessed saviour,
I surrender all.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu,
Patapata lai ku kan,
Un o ma fee, un ó si gbekele E,
Un o wa lodo Re titi.

Chorus:
Mo fi gbogbo re, Mo fi gbogbo re
Fun O, Olugbala mi ni
Mo fi won sile.

Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu,
Se mi ni Tire nikan
Je ki n kun fun Emi-Mimo,
Ki n mo pe 'Wo je temi'

Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu,
Mo fi ara mi fun o
F'ife at'agbara kun mi,
Ki ibukun Re ba le mi.

Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu,
Mo mo p'Emi ba le mi
A! Ayo igbala kikun!
Ogo, ogo, f'ooko Re.

Chorus:
Mo fi gbogbo re, Mo fi gbogbo re
Fun o, Olugbala mi, ni
Mo fi won sile.
(Amin).

title_english: When the power of God descended
passage_english: AND WHEN THE DAY OF PENTECOST WAS FULLY COME, THEY WERE ALL WITH ONE ACCORD IN ONE PLACE. ACTS 2:1
passage_yoruba: NIGBATI OJO PENTIKOSTI SI DE, GBOGBO WON FI OKAN KAN WA NIBIKAN. ISE APOS. 2:1
verses_english:
When the power of God descended
On the day of Pentecost,
All the day of waiting ended,
They received the Holy Ghost

Chorus:
O Lord, send the power just now,
O Lord send the power just now,
O Lord send the power just now,
And baptize, every one.

Tongues of flame came down upon them,
And they preached the word in power,
Listening multitudes awakened
Turned to God that very hour.

We are waiting Holy Spirit
We are all of one accord,
Lord fulfill just now the promise
That is given in thy Word.

Fill and thrill us with Thy presence,
Grant the blessing that we need
Flood our souls with wondrous glory,
While the prayer of faith we plead.

Chorus:
O Lord, send the power just now,
O Lord send the power just now,
O Lord send the power just now,
And baptize, every one.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbat' agbara Olorun de
Li ojo Pentikosti
Se ifojusona pari
Tori won ri Emi gba

Chorus:
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ki O si Baptis' wa

Ela 'han ina ba le won
Won si wasu oro naa
Opolopo eniyan gbagbo
Won yipada s' Olorun

A n w'ona fun Emi Mimo
Gbogbo wa f'ohun sokan
Mu 'leri naa se Oluwa
Ti a se nin'oro Re

Joo fi agbara Re kun wa
Fun wa n' ibukun t'a n fe
Fi ogo Re kun okan wa
Bi a ti n f' igbagbo bebe

Chorus:
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ran agbara Oluwa
Ki o si Baptis' wa.
(Amin).

title_english: Where He may lead me I will go
title_yoruba: Ona to yan l' emi o to
passage_english: I AM THE DOOR: BY ME IF ANY MAN ENTER IN, HE SHALL BE SAVED. JOHN 10:9
passage_yoruba: EMI NI ILEKUN, BI ENIKAN BA GBA ODO MI WOLE, OUN LI A O GBA LA. JOHANU 10:9
verses_english:
Where He may lead me I will go,
For I have learned to trust Him so,
And I remember 'twas for me,
That He was slain on Calvary.

Chorus:
Jesus shall lead me night and day,
Jesus shall lead me all the way,
He is the truest Friend to me,
For I remember Calvary.

I delight in His command,
Love to be led by His dear hand;
His divine will is sweet to me,
Hallowed by bloodstained Calvary.

Onward I go, nor doubt nor fear,
Happy with Christ my Savior near,
Trusting that I some day shall see,
Jesus my friend of Calvary.
verses_yoruba:
Ona to yan l' emi o to,
'Tori mo gbeke mi le E,
Mo ranti pe nitori mi
Ni o se ku ni Kalfari

Chorus:
Jesu n to mi losan loru
Jesu n to mi l' ona gbogbo,
O je ore tooto fun mi,
'Tori mo ranti Kalfari

Mo ti feran ase Re to,
Mo fe k' owo Re maa to mi,
Ife rere Re ti dun to,
T' O fi han l' oke Kalfari.

Mo n lo pel' okan diduro
Ninu Kristi Olugbala;
Ni igbekele pe laipe
Un o ri Jesu ti Kalfari.

title_english: Do you hear the voice of Jesus
title_yoruba: O gbo ohun Jesu t'O n wi
passage_english: FOR AS THE FATHER RAISETH UP THE DEAD, AND QUICKENETH THEM; EVEN SO THE SON QUICKENETH WHOM HE WILL. JOHN 5:21
passage_yoruba: NITORIPE GEGEBI BABA TI N JI OKU DIDE, BEE NI OMO SI N SO AWON TI O FE DI AAYE. JOHANU 5:21
verses_english:
Do you hear the voice of Jesus,
Bid you leave your life of sin?
He has offered free salvation,
If you'll turn and follow Him.

Chorus:
O, come and follow your Saviour,
Comforter gladly receive;
His voice is calling you wanderer,
Only to ask and believe.

Why not give your heart to Jesus?
He who suffered on the tree;
He has said I freely pardon,
Take your cross and follow Me.

I will come to Thee, dear Jesus,
All my life I'll give to Thee;
I will always love and serve Thee,
O dear Lord just now take me.

Jesus saves me, yes, He saves me,
As He promised He would do,
All the load of sin is lifted,
Come and He will save you too.

Chorus:
O, come and follow your Saviour,
Comforter gladly receive;
His voice is calling you wanderer,
Only to ask and believe.
verses_yoruba:
O gbo ohun Jesu t'O n wi
Pe k'o fi ese sile,
O ti mu 'gbala ofe wa
Bi iwo ba je tele E.

Chorus:
Wa, tele Olugbala re,
Fi ayo gba Olutunu;
Ohun Re n pe o, asako,
Sa beere ki o si gbagbo.

Eese t'o ko f'okan re fun un
Jesu t'o ku l'ori 'gi?
O ni mo ti dariji o
Gb'agbelebu tele mi.

Un o wa s' odo Re Jesu mi,
Un o fi aye mi fun o.
Un o feran Re, un o si sin O,
Gba mi loni Oluwa.

Jesu gba mi la O gba mi.
B'o ti leri lati se,
Gbogb' eru ese li O ru,
Wa, yoo si gba o pelu.

Chorus:
Wa, tele Olugbala re,
Fi ayo gba Olutunu;
Ohun Re n pe o, asako,
Sa beere ki o si gbagbo.

title_english: The days that glide so swiftly
title_yoruba: Akoko wa gbogbo lo n yara sure koja lo
passage_english: THE CHILDREN OF THY SERVANTS SHALL CONTINUE, AND THEIR SEED SHALL BE ESTABLISHED BEFORE THEE. PSALM 102:28
passage_yoruba: AWON OMO AWON IRANSE RE YOO DURO PE, A O SI FI ESE IRU-OMO WON MULE NIWAJU RE. ORIN DAFIDI 102:28
verses_english:
The days that glide so swiftly down the highway
Of the past are filled with many weary hours of pain,
But the love of God grows stronger,
As the waiting hour seems longer,
And though silent be my voice,
My longing heart repeats the strain
Nearer, my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee.

Each moment brings me nearer to the time
When I must leave the scenes of earth that seem so dear to me
But the sight of home is clearer,
And my hope of heaven dearer,
Than the world and all its glory,
And its wealth could ever be.
Nearer, my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee.

So let the ransomed of the Lord repeat
The song of trust, and lean the harder on the word of God
On its promises abiding
As a refuge 'neath it hiding,
Travel bravely on the highway
That the saints and martyrs trod
Nearer, my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Akoko wa gbogbo lo n yara sure koja lo
Won kun fun igba are on 'rora,
Sugbon 'fe Olorun n po si,
B'ojo atipo wa ti n gun
Bi n ko tile fo ohun,
okan mi n so inira naa;
Un o sunmo Olorun,
Un o sunmo O.

Iseju kookan n sun mi mo nigbati un o
pinya
Pelu aye to sowon fun mi yii pinya
Iri ile si n han si mi,
Ireti orun sowon fun mi
Ju ti aye pelu gbogbo ogo ati oro re,
Un o sunmo Olorun,
Un o sunmo O.

Eni 'rapada Oluwa e korin igbagbo
E fi ara ti Oro Olorun,
E duro n'nu ileri Re,
Bi aabo e sa sabe Re
Fi igboya rin ona t'awon ajeriku ti rin
Un o sunmo Olorun,
Un o sunmo O.

title_english: Dear Saviour we our love would show
passage_english: PEACE I LEAVE WITH YOU. JOHN 14:27
passage_yoruba: ALAAFIA NI MO FI SILE FUN YIN. JH 14:27
verses_english:
Dear Saviour we our love would show
That all the world might see
The joy, the rest, the peace they know
Who love and worship Thee.

Chorus:
The world for Christ, the world for Christ
Throughout from sea to sea,
We want the whole wide world
For Christ to set nations free.

Help us the gospel news to tell,
Till not our hearts alone;
But all who come with us to dwell
Thy Sovereign right shall own.

Thy wondrous grace on us bestow,
And fill each heart and mind,
We with zeal may forward go to
Help and bless mankind
verses_yoruba:
Olugbala ao f'ayo han,
Ki gbogbo aye le ri,
Ayo 'sinmi, alaafia
T'awon to fe O ni.

Chorus:
Gbogbo aye, gbogbo aye,
Gbogbo tile, t'okun t'oke,
A fe gbogbo aye fun Kristi
K'orile d'ominira.

Je k'a le soro 'hinrere
Titi gbogb' okan wa
Pelu gbogb' eni yi wa ka
Yoo fi gba O l'Oba.

Jeki 'yanu oore-ofe Re
Kun inu okan wa;
K'awa le fi itara lo
Lati se 'ranlowo.

title_english: My life, my love I give to Thee
passage_english: AM PERSUADED THAT HE IS ABLE TO KEEP THAT WHICH I HAVE COMMITTED UNTO HIM AGAINST THAT DAY. II TIMOTHY 1:12
passage_yoruba: O SI DA MI LOJU PE, OUN LE PA OHUN TI MO FI LE E LOWO MO TITI DI OJO NI. II TIMOTEU 1:12
verses_english:
My life, my love I give to Thee,
Thou Lamb of God who died for me;
O may I ever faithful be,
My Savior and my God!

Chorus:
I'll live for Him who died for me,
How happy then my life shall be!
I'll live for Him who died for me,
My Savior and my God!

I now believe Thou dost receive,
For Thou hast died that I might live;
And now henceforth I trust in Thee,
My Savior and my God!

O Thou who died on Calvary,
To save my soul and make me free,
I'll consecrate my life to Thee,
My Savior and my God!
verses_yoruba:
Mo f'aye ati 'fe mi fun,
Od'atugan to ku fun mi;
Jeki n le je olotito
Jesu Olorun mi.

Chorus:
Un o wa f' eni to ku fun mi,
Aye mi yoo si dun pupo,
Un o wa f' eni to ku fun mi;
Jesu Olorun mi.

Mo gbagbo pe Iwo n gbani,
'Tori 'Wo ku, k'emi le la,
Emi yoo si gbekele O,
Jesu Olorun mi.

Iwo to ku ni Kalfari
Lati so mi d'ominira;
Mo yara mi soto fun O,
Jesu Olorun mi

title_english: Fierce storms may beat around me
title_yoruba: Iji lile le ja yi mi ka
passage_english: A THOUSAND SHALL FALL AT THY SIDE, …… BUT IT SHALL NOT COME NIGH THEE. PSALM 91:7
passage_yoruba: EGBERUN YOO SUBU LI EGBE RE…….. SUGBON KI YOO SUNMO ODO RE. ORIN DAFIDI 91:7
verses_english:
Fierce storms may beat around me,
And temptation strong confound me,
Still I need not fear if my Lord is near,
While His loving voice I hear.

Chorus:
None of these things shall ever move me
While I in Him abide,
He is my comfort and helper
Jesus the crucified.

Friends untrue may oft distress me,
And the cares of life oppress me;
Still I'll trust His love, for He reigns above,
And my faith in Him I'll prove.

Though I may not understand it,
Still His precious word commands it,
In the dark or light, trust by faith not sight
He will bring all things out right.
verses_yoruba:
Iji lile le ja yi mi ka,
Ki 'danwo kikan daamu mi,
Un o je beru b'Oluwa sunmo mi,
Ti mo n gb'ohun ife Re

Chorus:
Ko si nkan to le fo mi l'aya,
Gba mo ba wa n'nu Re
Itunu ati 'ranwo mi,
Jesu t'a kan mo 'gi.

Eniyan le ba mi n'nu je,
K'aniyan aye daamu mi;
Sibe un o gbekele Oba oke,
Un o fi gbagbo n'nu Re han.

Bi o tile sai ti ye mi,
Sibe, oro Re paa lase,
Ki n gbekele ni gbagbo lai tii ri,
Oun yoo tun ona mi se.

title_english: Be not dismayed whate'er betide
passage_english: HE THAT DWELLETH IN THE SECRET PLACE OF THE MOST HIGH SHALL ABIDE UNDER THE SHADOW OF THE ALMIGHTY. PS. 91:1
passage_yoruba: ENITI O JOKO NI IBI IKOKO OGA OGO NI YOO MAA GBE ABE OJIJI OLODUMARE. ORIN DAFIDI 91:1
verses_english:
Through days of toil when heart doth fail,
God will take care of you;
When dangers fierce your path assail,
God will take care of you.
verses_yoruba:
Mase foya ohunkohun,
Olorun yoo to o;
Maa gbe ibi ikoko Re,
Olorun yoo to o;

Chorus:
Olorun yoo to o o
Lojojumo lona gbogbo
Oun yoo maa toju re,
Olorun yoo to o.

'Gbati okan re ba daamu,
Olorun yoo to o o
Gbat'ewu ba wa lona re
Olorun yoo to o o

Bo ti wu ki 'danwo po to,
Olorun yoo to o o
Sinmi alaare laya Re,
Olorun yoo to o o

Chorus:
Olorun yoo to o o
Lojojumo lona gbogbo
Oun yoo maa toju re,
Olorun yoo to o.

title_english: Storms do not alarm me
passage_english: THE LORD, WHICH IS MY REFUGE. PSALM 91:9
passage_yoruba: NITORI IWO OLUWA NI ISE AABO MI. ORIN DAFIDI 91:9
verses_english:
Storms do not alarm me, they sometime must cease,
Trials cannot harm me, for I have blessed peace;
All I've left behind me, I long for no more,
Better things shall find me on Canaan's shore.

Chorus:
Let those who will stay in Egypt land,
I am bound for Canaan,
Where milk and honey flowing, shall every need supply;
All battles fought and the victory won,
Peace and joy my portion,
My soul shall rest on its shore by and by.

Troubles do not fret me, they cannot abide,
Though they may beset me, in Jesus, I will hide,
All the world's commotion about me may roam,
There's no stormy ocean on Canaan's shore.

I in grace abiding, am trying to stay,
In the shadow hiding of Canaan's perfect day;
All I trust may fail me, 'twill matter no more,
Nothing can assail me on Canaan's shore.
verses_yoruba:
N'nu opo oore-ofe, emi fe wa
Li abe ojiji ti Kenaan' ti o pe,
Gbogbo 'gbekele mi le ye, ko je nkan,
Ko s'ohun to le se mi ni Kenaani.

title_english: Conquerors and overcomers now are we
title_yoruba: Asegun ati ajogun li a je
passage_english: THE LORD WORKING WITH THEM, AND CONFIRMING THE WORD. MARK 16:20
passage_yoruba: OLUWA SI N BA WON SISE, O SI N FI IDI ORO NAA KALE. MARK 16:20
verses_english:
Conquerors and overcomers now are we,
Thro' the precious blood of Christ we've victory
If the Lord be for us we can never fail,
Nothing 'gainst His mighty power can e'er prevail.

Chorus:
Conquerors are we, thr'o the blood of Jesus
God will give us victory, thro' the blood of Jesus
Through the Lamb for sinners slain,
Yet who lives and reigns again,
More than conquerors are we,
More than conquerors are we.

In the name of Israel's God we'll onward press,
Overcoming sin and all unrighteousness;
Not to us but unto Him the praise shall be,
For salvation and for blood bought victory.

Unto Him that overcometh shall be given,
Here to eat of hidden manna sent from Heaven,
Over yonder He the victors palm shall bear,
And a robe of white, and golden crown shall wear.

Chorus:
Conquerors are we, thr'o the blood of Jesus
God will give us victory, thro' the blood of Jesus
Through the Lamb for sinners slain,
Yet who lives and reigns again,
More than conquerors are we,
More than conquerors are we.
verses_yoruba:
Asegun ati ajogun li a je
Nipa eje Kristi a ni isegun
Oluwa n be fun wa, a ki yoo subu
Ko s'ohun to le bori agbara Re.

Chorus:
Asegun ni wa nipa Eje Jesu
Baba fun wa ni'segun, nipa eje Jesu
EnitO pa f'elese
Sibe o wa O n joba
Awa ju asegun lo
Awa ju asegun lo

A nlo l'oruko Olorun Isreal'
Lati segun ese at'aisododo
Kii se fun wa, sugbon Tire ni iyin
Fun 'gbala ati 'segun ta f'eje ra.

Enit'o ba si segun li ao fi fun
Lati je manna to t'orun wa nihin
Lorun yoo si gbe imo'pe asegun
Yoo wo'so funfun, yoo si d'ade wura.

Chorus:
Asegun ni wa nipa Eje Jesu
Baba fun wa ni'segun, nipa eje Jesu
EnitO pa f'elese
Sibe o wa O n joba
Awa ju asegun lo
Awa ju asegun lo

title_english: My heart is open to Thee, dear Lord
passage_english: THE EYES OF YOUR UNDERSTANDING BEING ENLIGHTENED. EPH. 1:18
passage_yoruba: KI OJU OKAN YIN LE MOLE. EFE. 1:18
verses_english:
My heart is open to Thee, dear Lord,
Come in, come in,
My faith is clinging to Thy dear word,
Come in, Come in:

Chorus:
Come not to tarry, but stay, dear Lord
All shall be Thine love can afford
Here in my heart ever make Thine abode
Come in, Come in.

Yes, there is room in my heart, dear Lord
Come in, Come in;
Thy presence makes Heaven real to me,
Come in, Come in.

I kept thee standing outside so long
Come in, Come in,
I pray Thee pardon this shameful wrong,
Come in, Come in.

I hear Thee knocking at my heart's door
Come in, Come in,
I'll keep Thee waiting outside no more
Come in, Come in.

Chorus:
Come not to tarry, but stay, dear Lord
All shall be Thine love can afford
Here in my heart ever make Thine abode
Come in, come in.
verses_yoruba:
Okan mi s'ipaya, Oluwa
Wole, Wole,
Igbagbo mi ro mo oro Re
Wole, Wole.

Chorus:
Maa ba mi gbe titi Oluwa
Ohun ti O fe ni un o fe
Fi okan mi se 'bugbe Re laelae
Wole, Wole.

Beeni aaye n be fun Oluwa
Wole, Wole,
'Dide Re mu mi sun mo O si,
Wole, Wole.

Mo da O duro s'ode pe ju
Wole, Wole,
Dari eyii ji mi Oluwa
Wole, Wole.

Mo gbo, O nkan 'lekun, Oluwa
Wole, Wole,
Nko ni da O duro s'ode mo
Wole, Wole.

Chorus:
Maa ba mi gbe titi Oluwa
Ohun ti O fe ni un o fe
Fi okan mi se 'bugbe Re laelae
Wole, Wole.

title_english: Come, soul, and find thy rest
passage_english: GOD BE MERCIFUL TO ME A SINNER. LUKE 18:13
passage_yoruba: OLORUN SAANU FUN MI, EMI ELESE. LUKU 18:13
verses_english:
Come, soul, and find thy rest,
No longer be distressed;
Come to thy Savior's breast;
O don't stay away.

Chorus:
Prayers are ascending now,
Angels are bending now,
Both worlds are blending now,
Don't stay away.

Come, O we pray thee, come,
Come, and no longer roam;
Come now, and start for home,
O don't stay away.
verses_yoruba:
Wa gba isinmi re,
Mase je 'rora mo,
Wa s'odo Jesu re,
Ma se jafara.

Chorus:
Adura, n goke lo,
Angeli 'te 'ri won ba,
Aye dapo mo won,
Mase jafara.

Okunkun laye yii
Laalaa inu re po,
Wa s'agb' Olugbala
Mase jafara.

Igba ko duro pe,
Wawa lakoko n lo,
Idajo si n bo wa,
Mase jafara.

title_english: Once my eyes were blind to the beauty of the Lord
title_yoruba: Leekan, oju mi ti fo s'ogo Oluwa
passage_english: AND WE KNOW THAT THE SON OF GOD IS COME, AND HATH GIVEN US AN UNDERSTANDING, THAT WE MAY KNOW HIM THAT IS TRUE. I JOHN 5:20
passage_yoruba: AWA SI MO PE OMO OLORUN DE, O SI TI FI OYE FUN WA, KI AWA KI O LE MO ENITI ISE OTITO. I JOHANU 5:20
verses_english:
Once my eyes were blind to the beauty of the Lord
Once my ears were closed to the pleading of His word;
Once these hands of mine pressed the thorn-crown on His brow,
But all this He has forgiven, and it's alright now.

Chorus:
Yes, it's alright now, Yes, it's alright now
He has heard my prayer and it's alright now
Yes, it's alright now, yes, it's alright now
All my sins are covered and it's alright now

Once I loved the world with its glitter and its show;
I was captive held with the pleasures here below,
But one day He came, though I cannot tell you how,
With His blood my sins He covered, and it's alright now.

O it is so precious to be alone with Him,
When the shadows fall and my eyes with tears are dim,
Just to feel His hand rest in love upon my brow
And to hear Him gently whisper, 'It is alright now.
verses_yoruba:
Leekan, oju mi ti fo s'ogo Oluwa
Leekan, eti mi ti di s'ohun oro Re
Leekan, mo te ade egun mo o n
li ori,
Sugbon O ti dariji mi, ko tun
si nkan mo.

Chorus:
Ko si nkan mo, beeni, ko si nkan mo
O ti gbo adura mi, ko si nkan mo
Ko si nkan mo, beeni ko si nkan mo
O ti bo gbogb' ese mi ko tun si nkan mo.

Leekan ri, mo fe aye ati ogo re,
Adun aye yi ti de mi ni 'gbekun,
Sugbon Oun de n'ijokan l'ona ti
n ko le so,
O fi eje Re bo ese mi, ko si nkan mo.

Ohun rere ni lati wa lodo Jesu
'Gba danwo de, ti oju mi si sokun,
Ki n sa ri owo ife Re li ori mi
Ki n si gbo ohun jeje Re wipe 'Ko si n kan.'

title_english: Though the world allure with its gilded charm
title_yoruba: B 'aye ba n fa mi pelu ogo re
passage_english: WHEREFORE LAY APART ALL FILTHINESS AND SUPERFLUITY OF NAUGHTINESS. JAMES 1:21
passage_yoruba: NITORINAA E FI GBOGBO EERI ATI BUBURU ASELEKE LELE LI APAKAN. JAKOBU 1:21
verses_english:
Though the world allure with its gilded charm,
I'm a child of God, whom it cannot harm;
He will me uphold by His mighty arm,
Every moment of my day.

Chorus:
I've a friend who will ev'ry need supply,
I've a home far beyond the starry sky,
And you know, that is just the reason why,
I am singing Hallelujah!

I can ne'er forget how upon the tree
Laid the Son of God, there to die for me;
Yet to save my soul, thus it had to be,
There could be no other way.

I would e'er be true to my Lord and King,
Every waking hour praises to Him sing,
Knowing that at last He my soul shall bring,
Ever more with Him to stay.
verses_yoruba:
B 'aye ba n fa mi pelu ogo re,
Ko s'ewu, omo Olorun ni mi,
Owo agbara Re yoo di mi mu,
Lojo aye mi gbogbo.

Chorus:
Mo l'ore t'o n pese f'aini gbogbo,
Mo n'ile kan loke orun giga,
Wo! Nitori idi eyii naa ni,
Emi se n ko Halleluyah!

Emi ko je gbagbe pe lori 'gi,
Ni Omo Olorun gbe ku fun mi,
Ko le sai ku lati gbokan mi la,
Ko tun si ona miran.

Un o j'olooto s'Oluwa Oba mi,
Un o maa korin 'yin sin I nigbagbogbo,
Un o mo pe laipe O yo da okan mi,
O duro pelu O laelae.

title_english: The heart that was broken for me
title_yoruba: Okan t'a gun l'oko fun mi
passage_english: FOR CHRIST ALSO HATH ONCE SUFFERED FOR SINS, THE JUST FOR THE UNJUST. I PETER 3:18
passage_yoruba: NITORI TI KRISTI PELU JIYA LEEKAN, NITORI ESE WA. I PETERU 3:18
verses_english: When tempted to wander away from the Lord, I think of the Calvary tree; Where Jesus once suffered my soul to redeem, And the heart that was broken for me.
When friends are unfaithful I know He is true, No love is so full and so free; My eyes fill with tears as I dwell on my sins, And the heart that was broken for me.
Atonement divine He has made by His blood, For ever my story shall be Of Jesus this loving Redeemer of mine, And the heart that was broken for me.
chorus_english: For me, a sinner like me, like me, His heart was broken for me; By faith I can see on Calvary, The heart that was broken for me.
verses_yoruba: Gba ba n fe ya mi kuro lod'Oluwa, Mo rant' igi Kalfari ni Nibi Jesu jiya fun 'rapada mi At'okan t'a gun l'oko fun mi.
Ore je eleke Oun je Olooto, Ife Re pe ofe si ni Mo sokun gba ri 'ra mi n'nu ese, At'okan t'a gun l'oko fun mi.
Etutu mimo lo ti f'eje Re se, Un o maa so itan naa titi, Itan ti Jesu Olurapada mi At'okan t'a gun l'oko fun mi.
chorus_yoruba: Fun mi elese. b'emi, b'emi A gun Un loko fun mi; Mo fi gbagbo ri i ni Kalfari: Okan t'agun l'oko fun mi.

title_english: Is my name written there
passage_english: AND GOD SAID UNTO HIM, BECAUSE THOU HAST ASKED THIS THING, AND HAST NOT ASKED FOR THYSELF LONG LIFE. 1 KINGS 3:11
passage_yoruba: OLORUN SI WI FUN UN PE, NITORI IWO BEERE NKAN YII, TI IWO KO SI BEERE EMI GIGUN. 1 AWON OBA 3:11
verses_english: Lord, I care not for riches, neither silver nor gold; I would make sure of heaven, I would enter the fold; In the book of Thy kingdom, with its pages so fair, Tell me, Jesus, my Saviour, Is my name written there?

Lord, my sins they are many, like the sands of the sea, But Thy blood, O my Saviour! Is sufficient for me; For Thy promise is written, In bright letters that glow, 'Tho' your sins be as scarlet, I will make them like snow.'

O! that beautiful city, with its mansions of light, With its glorified being, In pure garments of white; Where no evil thing cometh, to despoil what is fair; Where the angels are watching, yes, my name's written there.
chorus_english: Is my name written there, On the page white and fair? In the book of Thy kingdom, Is my name written there?
verses_yoruba: Oluwa n ko beere fun fadaka oun wura Un o jijakadi f'orun un o si wonu agbo N'nu iwe ijoba Re ti o l'ewa pupo So fun mi, Oluwa mi, ooko mi ha wa nbe
Oluwa ese mi po, bi 'yanrin okun Sugbon eje Re Jesu ti to fun gbogbo re 'Tori Iwo ti seleri ninu oro Re pe, B'ese re pon b'ododo, un o fo won fun bi sno.
Ni 'lu daradara ni, at' opo ibugbe re, Nibit' awon mimo wa, nin'aso funfun won T'ohun eeri kole de lati b'ewa re je Bit 'awon Angeli n so, ooko mi ha wa n be
chorus_yoruba: Ooko mi ha wa n'be? N'nu iwe nla ni Iwe ti ijoba Re Ooko mi ha wa n'be.

title_english: Where He leads me I will follow
title_yoruba: Ona to yan l' emi o to
passage_english: GO OUT INTO THE HIGHWAYS. LUKE 14:23
passage_yoruba: JADE LO SI OPOPO. LUKU 14:23
verses_english: I can hear my Saviour calling, I can hear my Saviour calling, I can hear my Saviour calling, Take thy cross, and follow, follow Me.
I'll go with Him through the garden, I'll go with Him through the garden, I'll go with Him through the garden, I'll go with Him, with Him, all the way.
I'll go with Him thro' the judgement, I'll go with Him thro' the judgement, I'll go with Him thro' the judgement, I'll go with Him, with Him, all the way.
He will give me grace and glory, He will give me grace and glory, He will give me grace and glory, And go with me, with me, all the way.
chorus_english: Where He leads me I will follow, Where He leads me I will follow, Where He leads me I will follow; I'll go with Him, with Him, all the way.
verses_yoruba: Mo gbo Olugbala mi n pe, Mo gbo Olugbala mi n pe; Mo gbo Olugbala mi n pe, 'Gb'agbelebu re si tele mi
Em'o ba koja ogba ni Em'o ba koja ogba ni Em'o ba koja ogba ni Em'o tele E, tele E titi lae.
Em'o ba koja idajo Em'o ba koja idajo Em'o ba koja idajo Emi o tele; tele titi lae.
Yoo fun mi l'oore at'ogo Yoo fun mi l'oore at'ogo Yoo fun mi l'oore at'ogo Yoo je t'emi t'emi titi lae.
chorus_yoruba: Ona t'O la l'emi o rin Ona t'O la l'emi o rin Ona t'O la l'emi o rin Em'o tele E, tele E titi lae.

title_english: He knoweth the way that I take
title_yoruba: O mo ona ti emi n gba
passage_english: LO, I AM WITH YOU ALWAYS. MATTHEW 28:20
passage_yoruba: E KIYESI EMI WA PELU YIN NIGBA GBOGBO. MATTEU 28:20
verses_english: I have a Friend who is ever nigh Whether I sleep or wake; Ever He guards with a watchful eye, He knoweth the way that I take.
I have a Friend who is always near One who will ne'er forsake; What though my pathway be dark and drear, He knoweth the way that I take.
I have a Friend who will guide me on Until the shadows break, Leading me on, till my crown is won, He knoweth the way that I take
chorus_english: He knoweth the way that I take, And keeps me when asleep or awake; And lead me for His own name's sake, He knoweth the way that I take.
verses_yoruba: Mo l'ore kan t'owa nitosi L'osan ati l'oru, O n fi oju Re so mi titi O mo ona ti emi n gba.
Mo ni ore kan to sunmo mi Ko je ko mi sile, Bi ona mi tile s'okunkun O mo ona ti emi n gba.
Mo lore kan ti yo maa to mi Tit' opin yoo fi de O n to mi titi un o fi d'ade O mo ona ti emi n gba.
chorus_yoruba: O mo ona ti emi n gba, O si n pa mi mo losan, loru O n to mi li oruko Re, O mo ona ti emi n gba.

title_english: Simply trusting
passage_english: THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD; I SHALL NOT WANT. PSALM 23:1
passage_yoruba: OLUWA LI OLUSO-AGUNTAN MI, EMI KI YOO SE ALAINI. ORIN DAFIDI 23:1
verses_english: Simply trusting Christ my Saviour, In His presence i'm so blest, That the storms which beat around me Drive me closer to His breast.
Humbly trusting in the shadow. When the sun is hid from view; Not a cloud so dense and low'ring. But His love can still shine through.
Ever trusting in the sunshine With all fear and doubting gone On the mountain top with Jesus, Stil 'tis better farther on
chorus_english: Simply trusting day by day, Trusting Jesus all the way; Doubting not what'er befall; Trusting Jesus, that is all.
verses_yoruba: Ki n gbekele Olugbala, L'odo Re mo ni 'bukun, Ki wahala to yi mi ka Mu mi sunmo odo Re.
Ni'gbekele ojiji Re, Nigbati oorun ko si; B'o ti wu k'oju orun su, Ife Re yoo tan 'mole.
Gbekele imole Re lae Ko 'yemeji at'eru; L'ori oke pelu Jesu Gbe okan re s'oke sii.
chorus_yoruba: Gbekele E lojojumo, Gbekele Jesu titi; Ohunkohun t'o le de, Gbekele Jesu nikan.

title_english: I have Christ and need no more
title_yoruba: Mo ni Krist' ko s'aini mo
passage_english: BUT WHAT THINGS WERE GAIN TO ME, THOSE I COUNTED LOSS FOR CHRIST. PHILLIP. 3:7
passage_yoruba: SUGBON OHUNKOHUN TI O TI JASI ERE FUN MI, AWON NI MOT I KA SI OFO NITORI KRISTI. FILLIP 3:7
verses_english: Time may tarnish earth treasures, Take what I have lov'd before; Jesus gives abiding pleasures Having Him, what need I more?
Tho' the beams of worldly gladness, Fail to light the pathway dim, Jesus takes away my sadness, All I need I find in Him
To His boundless stores of blessing, Jesus opens wide the door, All-in-all in Him possessing, I shall never want for more
chorus_english: I have Christ and need no more From His hand rich gifts outpour, Lo, I'm singing o'er and o'er, I have Christ, I need no more.
verses_yoruba: Oro aye le di 'baje Ohun ti mo fe le bo, Itura n be lodo Jesu, Ki l'ohun ti mo tun fe?
Bi ayo aye ba kuna, Lati mu inu mi dun, Jesu ti ru 'banuje mi, N'nu Re mo r'ohun gbogbo.
Sinu ibu ibukun Re, Jesu si 'lekun sile, Ninu Re mo l'ohun gbogbo, Aini ko si fun mi mo.
chorus_yoruba: Mo ni Krist' ko s'aini mo Owo Re n tu ebun ka Un o maa ko'rin 'yin titi Mo ni Krist' ko s'aini mo.

title_english: Wonderful Bible
passage_english: THY WORD IS A LAMP UNTO MY FEET, AND A LIGHT UNTO MY PATH. PSLAM 119:105
passage_yoruba: ORO RE NI FITILA FUN ESE MI, ATI IMOLE SI IPA ONA MI. ORIN DAFIDI 119:105
verses_english: Wonderful Bible! Book of God; Guide and counsel to mortals giv'n; Lamp to the path by the ransomed trod, Lighting the way from earth to heav'n.
Wonderful Bible! Law of the Lord; And all its precepts in grace abound And in their keeping is great reward, Life everlasting there is found.
Wonderful Bible! Radiance bright; Ray serene from the world above, Fairest of stars in humanity's night, Fill now our hearts with light and love.
chorus_english: Shine, O wonderful light divine, Lamp of Truth, in this dark world shine Shine thr'o the night of doubts and fears, Shine till the morn of God appears.
verses_yoruba: Bibeli iwe iyanu Ti o n f'ona han araye, Fitila ti n tan si ona wa, Lat'aye yii s'oke orun.
Bibeli, ofin Oluwa Ti o kun fun ore-ofe; Ni pipamo re, ere nla nbe, N'nu re l'a ri 'ye ailopin.
Bibeli, iwe imole, Ti o tan lati oke wa; Iranwo ti o l'ogo julo, Da 'na ife si okan wa.
chorus_yoruba: Tan 'wo 'mole at'oke wa. Tan si okunkun aye yii, Tan ninu 'ye meji Titi ooro titun yoo fi de.

title_english: I am coming to the cross
passage_english: LET US THEREFORE COME BOLDLY UNTO THE THRONE OF GRACE, THAT WE MAY OBTAIN MERCY, AND FIND GRACE TO HELP IN TIME OF NEED. HEB. 4:16
passage_yoruba: NITORINAA E JE KI A WA SI IBI ITE OORE-OFE PELU IGBOYA, KI A LE RI AANU GBA, KI A SI RI OORE-OFE LATI MAA RANNILOWO NI AKOKO TI O WO. HEB. 4:16
verses_english: I am coming to the cross; I am poor and weak and blind; I am counting all but dross; I shall full salvation find.
In the promises I trust; Now I feel the blood applied; I am prostrate in the dust; I with Christ am crucified.
Jesus comes! He fills my soul! Perfected in Him I am; I am every whit made whole: Glory, glory to the Lamb!
chorus_english: I am trusting, Lord, in Thee. Blessèd Lamb of Calvary; Humbly at Thy cross I bow. Save me, Jesus, save me now.
verses_yoruba: Mo n bo nib' agbelebu Emi abosi julo, Mo ka gbogbo nkan s' ofo Lati ri 'gbala kikun
Mo gbekele'le leri Re, At' agbara eje ni, Mo pon ara mi loju, Mo n ru agbelebu Re.
Jesu fi ayo kun mi Oun si so mi di pipe Mo ni ilera pipe Ogo ni f'Odagutan.
chorus_yoruba: Mo gbekele o Jesu Odo agutan Kalfari Mo fi 'rele teriba Gba mi, Jesu loni yii.

title_english: Since Christ my soul from sin set free
title_yoruba: Bi Kristi' ti da okan mi nde
passage_english: A LIGHT TO LIGHTEN THE GENTILES, AND THE GLORY OF THY PEOPLE ISRAEL. LUKE 2:32
passage_yoruba: IMOLE LATI MO SI AWON KEFERI, ATI OGO ISRAELI ENIYAN RE. LUK 2:32
verses_english: Since Christ my soul from sin set free, This world has been a Heav'n to me; And 'mid earth's sorrows and its woe, 'Tis Heav'n my Jesus here to know.
Once Heaven seemed a far-off place, Till Jesus showed His smiling face; Now it's begun within my soul, 'Twill last while endless ages roll.
What matters where on earth we dwell? On mountain top, or in the dell? In cottage, or a mansion fair, Where Jesus is, 'tis Heaven there.
chorus_english: O hallelujah, yes, 'tis Heav'n, 'Tis Heav'n to know my sins forgiv'n; On land or sea, what matters where? Where Jesus is, 'tis Heaven there.
verses_yoruba: Bi Kristi' ti da okan mi nde Aye mi ti dabi orun Laarin 'banuje at'aro Ayo ni lati mo Jesu
Mo ti ro pe orun jinna Sugbon nigbati Jesu de Lorun ti de 'nu okan mi Nibe ni yoo si wa titi.
Nibo la ko le gbe laye Lor'oke tabi petele L'ahere tabi agbala Ko s'ewu Jesu wa nibe.
chorus_yoruba: Halleluyah! ayo lo je Pe mo ti ri 'dariji gba Ibikibi ti mo ba wa Ko s'ewu, Jesu wa nibe

title_english: There's a new name written down in glory
title_yoruba: Ooko titun t'a ko sile n'n ogo
passage_english: SON, BE OF GOOD CHEER; THY SINS BE FORGIVEN THEE. MATT. 9:2
passage_yoruba: OMOKUNRIN, TUJUKA A DARI ESE RE JI O. MATT. 9:2
verses_english: I was once a sinner, but I came Pardon to receive from my Lord: This was freely given, and I found That He always kept His word.
I was humbly kneeling at the cross, Fearing naught but God's angry frown; When the heavens opened and I saw That my name was written down.
In the Book 'tis written, Saved by Grace, O the joy that came to my soul! Now I am forgiven, and I know By the blood I am made whole.
chorus_english: There's a new name written down in glory, And it's mine, O yes, it's mine! And the white robed angels sing the story, A sinner has come home. For there's a new name written down in glory, And it's mine, O yes, it's mine! With my sins forgiven I am bound for Heaven, Never more to roam.
verses_yoruba: Leekan, mo j'elese, sugbon mo Ti gba 'dariji lodo Oluwa, L'ofe la fi fun mi mo si ri Pe o n pa oro Re mo.
Mo fi 'rele kunle lese Krist' Mo si n beru 'binu Olorun, Nigbat'a si orun, ti mo ri P'a ko 'ruko mi sile;
Oor'-ofe nikan l'ogba mi la, Ayo ki l'o de s'okan mi A ti dariji mi mo si mo P'eje Krist'mu mi pe.
chorus_yoruba: Ooko titun t'a ko sile n'n ogo T'emi ni tooto, t'emi Awon Angeli mimo n korin naa 'Elese kan wa 'le Tor'ooko titun kan ti a ko n'n' ogo T'emi ni, tooto temi, Leyin dariji ese orun ni mo n lo N ko tun sako mo.

title_english: What a friend we have in Jesus
title_yoruba: Ore wo la ni bi Jesu
passage_english: BUT HE WAS WOUNDED FOR OUR TRANSGRESSIONS, HE WAS BRUISED FOR OUR INIQUITIES. ISA 53:5
passage_yoruba: SUGBON A SA A LI OGBE NITORI IREKOJA WA, A PA LI ARA NITORI AISEDEDE WA. ISA. 53:5
verses_english: What a friend we have in Jesus, all our sins and griefs to bear! What a privilege to carry everything to God in prayer! O what peace we often forfeit, O what needless pain we bear, all because we do not carry everything to God in prayer.

Have we trials and temptations? Is there trouble anywhere? We should never be discouraged; take it to the Lord in prayer. Can we find a friend so faithful who will all our sorrows share? Jesus knows our every weakness; take it to the Lord in prayer.
