Are we weak and heavy laden, cumbered with a load of care? Precious Savior, still our refuge; take it to the Lord in prayer. Do thy friends despise, forsake thee? Take it to the Lord in prayer! In his arms he'll take and shield thee; thou wilt find a solace there.
verses_yoruba: Ore wo la ni bi Jesu, Ti O ru 'banuje wa Anfaani wo lo po bayii Lati maa gbadura sii Alaafia pupo l'a n sonu, A si ti je rora po, 'Tori a ko n fi gbogbo nkan S'adura niwaju Re.
Idanwo ha wa fun wa bi? A ha ni wahala bi? A ko gbodo so 'reti nu; Sa gbadura s' Oluwa. Ko s'olooto ore bi re Ti o le ba wa daro, Jesu ti mo ailera wa; Sa gbadura s'Oluwa.
Eru ha n wo wa l'orun bi? Aniyan ha po fun wa? Olugbala je aabo wa, Sa gbadura s'Oluwa. Awon ore ha sa o ti? Sa gbadura s'Oluwa. Yoo gbe o s'oke lapa Re Iwo yoo si ni'tunu.

title_english: Hear the tramp of the Army
passage_english: AND THEY DEPARTED FROM THE MOUNT OF THE LORD THREE DAYS' JOURNEY: AND THE ARK OF THE COVENANT OF THE LORD WENT BEFORE THEM NUMBERS 10:33
passage_yoruba: WON SI SI KURO NI OKE OLUWA, NI IRIN IJO META, APOTI MAJEMU OLUWA SI SIWAJU. NUMBER 10:33
verses_english: Hark on the highway of life a sound. As crested waves of ocean roar, Lashed by the storm in its fury spent As they beat upon, the shore
Onward they march with a faith unmoved, By any change of time or creed, There's to believe that the word of God Can supply the world's great need
Step in the ranks, you are needed there, Cling to the church and God will bless, He is the hope of the whole wide world, For the cause of righteousness
chorus_english: Hear the tramp, tramp, tramp of the Army As they march along the way of life, They are weary of the toil and the travel Of the bitterness of strife, But they hope and trust, looking ever On the path the saints before have trod, And as they march along their faith grows strong In the church of the Living God
verses_yoruba: Gbo iro li opopo aye Bi ti igbi omi okun, Ti n fi agbara re ru s'oke T'o si nkolu ebute.
Won n tesiwaju pelu 'gbagbo Ti eko-keko ko le mi; Won gbagbo pe oro Olorun Le pese f' aini gbogbo.
Dapo mo won, aaye wa sibe, Duro de bukun Olorun; Oun n'ireti gbogbo agbaye Lati sise ododo.
chorus_yoruba: Gbo iro ese omo ogun Bi won ti n rin lo li ona naa, Aare mu won fun 'se at'irin ajo Ati ija kikoro; Sugbon won gbagbo, won tejumo Ona naa t'awon mimo ti n rin, Bi won ti n lo ni 'gbagbo won N dagba n'nu Olorun alaaye

title_english: Jesus will be with you
title_yoruba: Jesu yoo pelu re lona re gbogbo
passage_english: I AM WITH YOU ALWAYS, EVEN UNTO THE END OF THE WORLD. MATT. 28:20
passage_yoruba: EMI WA PELU YIN NIGBA GBOGBO, TITI O FI DE OPIN AYE. MATT 28:20
verses_english: Jesus will be with you whereso'er you stray, Jesus will be with you and will guide your way, Through the lonely deserts, over mountains bare, Jesus will be with you, brother everywhere.
Jesus will be with you wheresoe'er you stray, Jesus will be with you and will be your stay; Through the darksome valley with its griefs and care, Jesus will be with you, brother don't despair.
Jesus will be with you wheresoe'er you stray, Jesus will be with you all along life's way; Through the chilly waters to the land so fair, Jesus will be with you, brother trust His care.
chorus_english: Jesus will be with you, Jesus will be with you, He will be your friend to comfort and defend Jesus will be with you, Jesus will be with you, Jesus will be with you to the end.
verses_yoruba: Jesu yoo pelu re lona re gbogbo, Jesu yoo pelu re yio si maa to o Laarin asale ati l'ori oke, Jesu yoo wa pelu re nigba gbogbo.
Jesu yoo pelu re l'ona re gbogbo Jesu yoo pelu re yoo si di o mu Laarin afonifoji ibanuje, Jesu yoo pelu re ma so reti nu.
Jesu yoo pelu re lona re gbogbo. Jesu yoo pelu re lona ajo re, Laarin isan 'danwo s'ona ilu ni, Jesu yoo pelu re, sa gbeke re le E.
chorus_yoruba: Jesu yoo pelu re Jesu yoo pelu re, Yoo je ore at'olutunu fun o; Jesu yoo pelu re Jesu yoo pelu re; Jesu yoo pelu re de opin.

title_english: My spirit, soul and body
passage_english: MY HEART IS FIXED. PSALM 57:7
passage_yoruba: OKAN MI TI MURA. ORIN DAFIDI 57:7
verses_english: My spirit, soul and body, Jesus, I give to Thee, A consecrated off'ring, Thine evermore to be.
O Jesus, mighty Saviour! I trust in Thy great name, I look for Thy salvation, Thy promise now I claim.
Now, Lord; I yield my members, From sin's dominion free, For warfare and for triumph, As weapons unto Thee.
Oh, blissful self-surrender, To live, my Lord, by Thee! Now, Son of God, my Saviour, Live out Thy life in me
I'm Thine, O blessed Jesus, Washed in Thy precious blood, Sealed by Thy Holy Spirit, A sacrifice to God.
chorus_english: My all is on the altar; Lord, I am all Thine own; Oh, may my faith ne'er falter! Lord, keep me Thine alone.
verses_yoruba: Emi, fokan at'ara; Jesu mo fi fun O; Fun ebo mimo lati Maa je Tire titi,
Jesu, Olugbala nla, Mo gbeke mi le O; Mo n wa igbala nla Re, Mo bere 'leri Re;
Mo gba eya ara mi Kuro labe ese; Mo fun O b'ohun elo Lati lo si segun.
Mo fi se t'ara sile Ki n le wa lodo Re, Jesu Olugbala mi, F'emi Re si'nu mi;
Tire li emi, Jesu, T'a f'eje Re we mo T'Emi ti ya si mimo, Ebo fun Olorun.
chorus_yoruba: Mo fi ara mi rubo, Jesu tire l'emi, Ki gbagbo mi mase ye Se mi n'ti Re nikan.

title_english: In the land of fadeless day
title_yoruba: Ni 'le ti ojo ki n sa
passage_english: AND HE SAITH UNTO ME, SEAL NOT THE SAYINGS OF THE PROPHECY OF THIS BOOK: FOR THE TIME IS AT HAND. REV 22:10
passage_yoruba: O SI WI FUN MI PE, MASE FI EDIDI DI ORO ISOTELE TI INU IWE YII, NITORI IGBA KU SI DEDE. IFI. 22:10
verses_english: In the land of fadeless day Lies the city four-square; It shall never pass away, And there is no night there.
All the gates of Pearl are made In the city four-square; All the streets with gold are laid, And there is no night there.
And the gates shall never close To the city four-square; There life's crystal river flows, And there is no night there.
There they need no sunshine bright, In that city four-square; For the Lamb is all the light, And there is no night there.
chorus_english: God shall wipe away all tears; There's no death, no pain, nor fears; And they count not time by years; For there is no night there.
verses_yoruba: Ni 'le ti ojo ki n sa, Ni'lu Olorun wa, Ilu naa yoo wa titi, Ko si s' oru nibe,
Enu ona Re je Pearl N' ilu Olorun wa, Ita Re si je wura, Ko si s' oru nibe.
A ki n ti enu ona T' ilu Olorun wa Omi iye n san nibe, Ko si s'oru nibe.
Won ko fe 'tansan orun N' ilu Olorun wa; 'Tori Kristi n' imole re, Ko si s' oru nibe.
chorus_yoruba: Baba yoo n' omije nu, Ko si 'ku 'rora eru, Ko si kika akoko, Tori ko s' oru n' be

title_english: Trust on trust on, believer
passage_english: IF IT BE SO, OUR GOD WHOM WE SERVE IS ABLE TO DELIVER US. DANIEL 3:17
passage_yoruba: BI O BA RI BEE, OLORUN WA TI AWA N SIN, LE GBA WA. DANIELI 3:17
verses_english: Trust on! trust on, believer! Tho' long the conflict be, Thou yet shall prove victorious; Thy God shall fight for thee.
Trust on! the danger presses; Temptation strong is near, Yet o'er life's dangerous rapids, He shall thy passage steer.
O Christ is strong to save us, He is a faithful friend; Trust on! trust on! believer, O trust Him to the end.
chorus_english: Trust on! (trust on!) Tho' dark the night and drear; Trust on! (trust on!) The morning dawn is near.
verses_yoruba: Gbekele E Onigbagbo! Bi' ja naa tile pe Iwo ni yoo sa segun, Baba yoo ja fun o
Gbekele E laarin ewu, 'Danwo nla wa n'tosi Laarin wahala aye, Yoo maa s'amona re.
Jesu to lati gba wa, Ore tooto l'O je Gbekele E, onigbagbo, Sa gbekele E dopin.
chorus_yoruba: Sa gbekele E! B' okunkun tile su Sa gbekele E! Ile fere mo na.

title_english: My soul is so happy in Jesus
title_yoruba: Okan mi n yo ninu Oluwa
passage_english: THEN THEY ASKED HIM, WHAT MAN IS THAT WHICH SAID UNTO THEE, TAKE UP THY BED, AND WALK? JOHN 5:12
passage_yoruba: NIGBANAA NI WON BII LERE WIPE, OKUNRIN WO LI ENITI O WI FUN O PE, GBE AKETE RE, KI O SI MAA RIN? JOHN 5:12.
verses_english: My soul is so happy in Jesus, For He is so precious to me; His voice it is music to hear it, His face it is Heaven to see.
He sought me so long ere I knew Him, When wand'ring afar from the fold; Safe home in His arms He hath bro't me, To where there are pleasures untold.
His love and His mercy surround me, His grace like a river doth flow; His Spirit, to guide and to comfort, Is with me wherever I go.
They say I shall some day be like Him, My cross and my burden lay down; Till then I will ever be faithful, In gathering gems for His crown.
chorus_english: I am happy in Him; (2x) My soul with delight He fills day and night For I am happy in Him
verses_yoruba: Okan mi n yo ninu Oluwa 'Tori O je iye funmi Ohun Re dun pupo lati gbo Adun ni lati r'oju Re
O ti n wa mi pe ki n to mo O 'Gbati mo rin jinna s'agbo O gbe mi wa s'ile l'apa Re Nibiti papa tutu wa
Ire at'aanu Re yi mi ka Oor'ofe Re n san bi odo Emi Re n to, o si n s 'tunu O n ba mi lo s' ibikibi
Emi yoo da bi Re ni 'jokan Un o s'eru wuwo mi kale Titi d' igba naa un o s'ooloto Ni sise oso f'ade Re.
chorus_yoruba: Emi n yo ninu Re Emi n yo ninu Re Gba gbogbo lo f' ayo kun okan mi 'Tori emi n yo ninu Re.

title_english: Come, ye that love the Lord
passage_english: WHOM HAVING NOT SEEN, YE LOVE. 1 PETER 1:8
passage_yoruba: ENITI ENYIN FE LAIRI. 1 PETERU 1:8
verses_english: Come, ye that love the Lord, And let your joys be known, Join in a song with sweet accord, Join in a song with sweet accord, And thus surround the throne, And thus surround the throne.
Let those refuse to sing, Who never knew our God; But children of the heavenly King, But children of the heavenly King, Must speak their joys abroad, Must speak their joys abroad.
The hill of Zion yields A thousand sacred sweets, Before we reach the heavenly fields, Before we reach the heavenly fields, Or walk the golden streets, Or walk the golden streets,
Then let our songs abound, And every tear be dry; We're marching through Immanuel's ground, We're marching through Immanuel's ground, To fairer worlds on high, To fairer worlds on high.
chorus_english: We're marching to Zion, Beautiful, beautiful Zion; We're marching upward to Zion, The city of our God
verses_yoruba: Eyin te fe Oluwa, E fi ayo yin han, Ejumo ko orin didun, Ejumo ko orin didun K'e si y'ite naa ka, K'e si y'ite naa ka
Je k'awon ni maa korin Ti ko m'Olorun wa, Sugbon awon omo Oba, Sugbon awon omo Oba, Yoo so ayo won ka, Yoo so ayo won ka.
Oke Sion lo n mu Egberun adun wa Ki a to de gbangba orun Ki a to de gbangba orun Pelu ita wura, Pelu ita wura.
N je ka maa korin lo, K'omije gbogbo gbe A nyan n'ile Emmanuel, A nyan n'ile Emmanuel, S'aaye didan loke, S'aaye didan loke
chorus_yoruba: A n yan lo si Sion' Sion' to dara julo A n yan goke lo si Sion, Ilu Olorun wa

title_english: Come, ye that love the Lord
passage_english: WHOM HAVING NOT SEEN, YE LOVE. 1 PETER 1:8
passage_yoruba: ENITI EYIN FE LAIRI. I PETERU 1:8
verses_english: Come, ye that love the Lord, And let your joys be known; Join in a song with sweet accord, Join in a song with sweet accord, Let those refuse to sing That never knew our God, But children of the heavenly King May speak their joys abroad.

The God of heaven is ours, Our Father and our love ; His care shall guard life's fleeting hours, Then waft our souls above, There shall we see his face, And never, never sin; There, from the rivers of his grace, Drink endless pleasures in.

Yes, and before we rise To that immortal state. The thoughts of such amazing bliss Should constant joys create, Children of grace have found Glory begun below: Celestial fruits on earthly ground, From faith and hope may grow.

The hill of Sion yields A thousand sacred sweets, Before we reach the heavenly fields, Or walk the golden streets, Then let our songs abound, And ev'ry tear be dry; We're trav'lling through Immanuel's ground, To fairer worlds on high.
verses_yoruba: Eyin te fe Oluwa, E fi ayo n yin han, E jumo ko orin didun E jumo ko orin didun; Jek'awon ni dake Ti ko m'Olorun wa; Sugbon k'awon 'ranse Oba Maa ro ayo won ka.
Olorun t'o joba, Ti n wo gbogbo aye Ti n gun awosanmo l'esin Ti n mu 'ji pa roro; Tiwa l'Olorun yii Baba Olufe wa; Yoo ran agbara t'orun wa Lati gbe wa soke.
Nibe, l'ao r'oju Re, T'a ki o d'ese mo; T'ao si maa jadun ailopin, Nipa oor'ofe Re; Looto, k'a to jinde Si iye ailopin, Ero irora nlanla naa N mu ayo wa bi sii.
N je k'orin wa goke, K'omije gbogbo gbe; A n koja lo n'le 'Manuel' S'aye rere loke.

title_english: Thou who love us we shall serve forever
title_yoruba: Iwo to fe wa la o maa sin titi
passage_english: WE LOVE HIM, BECAUSE HE FIRST LOVED US. I JOHN 4:19
passage_yoruba: AWA FERAN RE, NITORI OUN LI O KO FERAN WA. 1 JOHANU 4:19
verses_english: Thou who love us we shall serve forever, Our Lord and benefactor, O Thou who guard us in trials of the world, Holy's Thy glorious honour.
Thou who blesseth what we plant in the earth, That the earth have things to eat, O those who are prepared thus to be fruitful, They rejoice more Thy work.
O Thou who gave barren child to send errand, In Thy honour that is high, And the one that unfruitful thus give thanks, For Thy honour glorious work.
O thus he who is hungered can have joy in, Thy great power that is mighty, And those who behold Thy face thus for mercy, They rejoice more in Thy work.
O give Thy peace to Thy churches in the world, That thy grace may be so high, O that Thy people be rejoicing ever, In the glory of Thy work
chorus_english: Father, it is thee we shall serve, Father, it is thee we will worship, Oh thou who love us we shall serve forever, Holy's Thy glorious honour.
verses_yoruba: Iwo to fe wa la o maa sin titi, Oluwa oloore wa; Iwo to n so wa n'nu idanwo aye, Mimo, logo ola Re.
Iwo to n sure s'ohun t'a gbin s'aye, T'aye fi n rohun je o, Awon to mura lati maa s'ooto, Won tun n yo n'nu ise re.
Iwo to f'agan l'omo to n pe ranse, Ninu ola Re to ga; Enit'o ti s'alaileso is dupe Fun 'se ogo ola Re.
Enit'ebi n pa le ri ayo ninu, Agbara nla Re to ga, Awon to ti n woju Re fun aanu, Won tun n yo n'nu ise Re.
F'alaafia Re fun ijo Re l'aye, K'oore ofe Re maa ga, K'awon eni Tire ko maa yo titi Ninu ogo ise Re.
chorus_yoruba: Baba, iwo la o maa sin, Baba iwo la o maa bo, Iwo to fe wa l'a o maa sin titi, Mimo l'ogo Ola re.

title_english: The God of Abraham praise
passage_english: TO EXECUTE UPON THEM THE JUDGMENT WRITTEN: THIS HONOUR HAVE ALL HIS SAINTS. PRAISE YE THE LORD. PS 149:9
passage_yoruba: LATI SE IDAJO, TI A TI KOWE RE LORI WON, OLA YII NI GBOGBO ENIYAN MIMO RE NI. E FI IYIN FUN OLUWA PS. 149:9
verses_english: The God of Abraham praise, Who reigns enthroned above; Ancient of everlasting days, And God of Love; 'Jehovah, great I AM'! By earth and Heav'n confessed; I bow and bless the sacred name Forever blessed.

The God of Abraham praise, At whose supreme command From earth I rise and seek the joys, At His right hand; I all on earth forsake, Its wisdom, fame, and power; And Him my only portion make, My shield and tower.
He by Himself has sworn; I on His oath depend, I shall, on eagle wings upborne, To Heav'n ascend. I shall behold His face; I shall His power adore, And sing the wonders of His grace forevermore.

Though nature's strength decay, And earth and hell withstand, To Canaan's bounds I urge my way, At His command. The watery deep I pass, With Jesus in my view; And thro' the howling wilderness, My way pursues.
The God who reigns on high The great archangels sing, And Holy, Holy, Holy! cry, Almighty King! Who was, and is, the same, And evermore shall be: Jehovah, Father, great I AM, We worship Thee!

The whole triumphant host Give thanks to God on high; Hail, Father, Son, and Holy Ghost, They ever cry. Hail, Abraham's God, And mine! (I join the heav'nly lays,) All might and majesty are Thine, And endless praise.
verses_yoruba: Yin Olorun Abra'am, Ti o njoba l'oke Enit' o ti wa titi lae, Olorun nfe 'Jehofa nla l'Emi' Gbogbo eda jewo Mo f'ibukun f'Oruko re, Titi laelae
Yin Olorun Abra'am, Nip' ase Eniti Mo dide, mo si wa 'tunu, Lowo 'tun Re Mo ko aye sile, Ogbon at'ola Re On nikan si ni ipin mi, At' asa mi.
Oun naa ti se 'leri, Mo gbekele eyii, Un o fi iye idi goke, Lo si orun Un o ma wo oju Re, Un o si yin ipa Re Un o korin 'yanu t'or' – ofe, Titi laelae
B'agbara eda pin, T'aye at'esu nde Un o d'ojuko ona Kenaan Nip 'ase Re Un o re odo koja, Bi Jesu wa lokan Un o koja n'nu igbo didi, Lo s'ona mi.
Oba oke orun, Olor' Angeli nke Wipe Mimo, Mimo, Mimo, Oba titi Eniti ki pada, Ti yoo si wa laelae Jehofa, Baba 'Emi ni' Awa yin o.
Gbogbo egbe asegun, Yin Olorun l'oke Baba, Omo at' Emi ni Won ke titi Yin Olorun Abra'am Un o ba won korin naa, Tire l'agbara at'ola Pelu iyin.

title_english: Lord, my trust I repose on Thee
title_yoruba: Jesu, mo gbeke mi le O
passage_english: BUT IMMEDIATELY JESUS SPOKE TO THEM, SAYING, 'BE OF GOOD CHEER! IT IS I; DO NOT BE AFRAID'. MATT 14:27
passage_yoruba: SUGBON LOJUKANNA NI JESU WI FUN WON PE, E TUJUKA; EMI NI; E MA BERU. MATT 14:27.
verses_english: Lord, my trust I repose on Thee; Oh, how great is Thy love to me! Thou the strength of my life shall be: This I know! this I know!
Thou dost lead with a sweet command, Thou dost lead with a gentle hand: On the rock of Thy truth I stand: This I know! this I know!
I shall rise to a world of light, I shall rest in a mansion bright; Then my faith shall be lost in sight: This I know, this I know.
chorus_english: Thine! Thine! and only Thine, Now and ever Thine! Thou dost love me, Saviour mine! This I know, this I know.
verses_yoruba: Jesu, mo gbeke mi le O; Ife Re simi ti po to! Iwo l'agbara emi mi. Eyi da mi loju.
Ife l'O fi n pase Tire, Owo jeje l'O fi n to ni, Otito Re ni mo dimu, Eyi da mi loju.
Mo mo pe un o wo 'nu ogo, Un o maa gbe 'nu ile didan; Igbagbo lilo yoo dopin. Eyi da mi loju.
chorus_yoruba: Tire nikan l'emi, Loni titi lae O feran mi Oluwa Eyi da mi loju.

title_english: Awake, and in His strength renewed
passage_english: AWAKE, AWAKE, PUT ON STRENGTH. ISAIAH 51:9
passage_yoruba: JI, JI GBE AGBARA WO, IWO APA OLUWA. ISAIAH 51:9
verses_english: Awake, and in His strength renewed, The battle cry take up again; All enemies shall be subdued, And Christ the Lord shall reign.
Too long His foll'wers idly stood, By selfish creed and doctrine rent; Nor knew that for one Brotherhood His own short life was spent.
Unite and in His strength go on, Nor count a life as lost, but gain; And soon the vict'ry shall be won, For Jesus Christ must reign.
To dare and do for Him is meet, The struggle shall not be in vain; The trumpets shall not call 'Retreat,' For Jesus Christ must reign.
chorus_english: For Christ must reign! For Christ must reign! Our hope in Him is not in vain, For Christ must reign! For Christ must reign! Our hope in Him is not in vain, For Christ must reign!
verses_yoruba: Ji, so agbara Re d'otun Gbe 'hamora ogun Re wo; Ao segun gbogbo ota, Krist' yio si joba.
O ti pe t'awon Omo Re Ti n se yapa lori eko; Won gbagbe pe lori 'sokan Ni O n lo aye Re.
E papo li agbara Re, Aye yin yoo si je ere; Laipe e o ni isegun, 'Tori Krist yoo joba.
O ye k'a sise f'Oluwa, Ise wa ko ni je asan; A ko gbodo pada s'ehin, 'Tori Krist' yoo joba.
chorus_yoruba: Krist' yio joba Krist' yio joba, Ireti wa n'nu Re ko ye; Krist' yio joba, Krist' yio joba, Ireti wa n'nu Re ko ye Krist' yio joba.

title_english: Come, oh come, when Christ is calling
title_yoruba: Wa, nigbati Kristi n pe o
passage_english: COME UNTO ME, ALL YE THAT LABOUR … AND I WILL GIVE YOU REST. MATT. 11:28
passage_yoruba: E WA SODO MI GBOGBO EYIN TI N SISE …… EMI O SI FI ISINMI FUN YIN. MATT. 11:28
verses_english: Come, oh come, when Christ is calling, Linger not in paths of sin; Sever ev'ry tie that binds you, And the heav'nly race begin.
Come, oh come, while Christ is pleading; Oh, what love His tones convey! Will you slight His proffer'd mercy, Will you longer from Him stray!
Come, oh come, delay no longer, For th' accepted time is now; Yield, oh yield yourself to Jesus, And before His scepter bow.
chorus_english: Calling now, calling now, Hear the Saviour calling now; Calling now, calling now, Hear the Saviour calling now.
verses_yoruba: Wa, nigbati Kristi n pe o Wa ma rin 'na ese mo, Wa tu gbogb' ohun to de O Wa bere 're 'je t'orun.
Wa nigbati Kristi n bebe, Wa gbo ohun ife Re, 'Wo o ko ohun ife Re? 'Wo o si maa sako sa?
Wa, mase f'akoko d'ola, Wa, ojo 'gbala ni 'yii, Wa fi ara re fun Kristi, Wa wole ni 'waju Re.
chorus_yoruba: O n pe o nisisiyi, Gbo b'Olugbala ti n pe, O n pe o nisisiyi, Gbo b'Olugbala ti n pe.

title_english: I strive to walk the narrow way
title_yoruba: Mo n ja lati t'ona iye
passage_english: BUT HE WHO ENTERS BY THE DOOR IS THE SHEPHERD OF THE SHEEP. JOHN 10:2.
passage_yoruba: SUGBON ENITI O B ABA TIE NU ONA WOLE, OUN NI SE OLUSO AWON AGUTAN. JOHN 10:2.
verses_english: I strive to walk the narrow way, To live near Jesus everyday; To Him each trying hour I pray For saving, keeping grace.
His voice recalls my erring soul, And yielding all to His control, I feel His glory, o'er me roll The glory of His grace.
I seek my Lord on bended knee, His saving grace my only plea, And then through tear-dimmed eyes I see, The glory of His face.
chorus_english: O what wonderful grace, O what wonderful grace, For my every need, see, There's grace enough for me.
verses_yoruba: Mo n ja lati t'ona iye, Lati tubo sunmo Jesu; L'akoko 'danwo un o bebe Fun oore-ofe yii.
Ohun Re tun n pe mi pada, Gba mo si f'ara mi fun Un, Mo r'ogo Re lara mi, Ogo oore-ofe Re.
Mo n wa Krist' mi lor'eekun mi Oore-ofe Re l'ebe mi Ogbanaa li omije mo ri Ogo oore-ofe Re.
chorus_yoruba: A! oore-ofe yii, To kun fun iyanu; Oore-ofe yi to fun Ohun gbogbo fun mi.

title_english: My happy heart is singing
passage_english: BEHOLD, WHAT MANNER OF LOVE THE FATHER HATH BESTOWED UPON US, THAT WE SHOULD BE CALLED THE SONS OF GOD. 1 JOHN 3:1
passage_yoruba: e wo iru ife ti baba fi fe wa, ti a fi npewa ni omo olorun. 1 johanu 3:1
verses_english:
My happy heart is singing
My heav'nly Father's love;
He send so many blessings
Like sunbeams from above.

Tho' other joys may fail me,
And sorrows may befall,
My Saviour will be with me,
And He is best of all.

O, let me tell to others
The story of His grace,
Rejoicing in His service,
Until I see His face.

And when I view the glories,
Within the jasper wall,
I'll sing with all the ransomed,
My Saviour's best of all.
(Amen).
chorus_english:
Chorus:
But Jesus is the best of all
Yes Jesus is the best of all
Of all the joys that may surround me,
The best of all is Jesus.
verses_yoruba:
Okan ayo mi n korin
Ife baba orun;
O ran opo ibukun
B’oorun lat’oke wa.

B’ayo miran gbogbo pin,
Ti ‘banuje si de,
Jesu yio pelu mi,
Oun si san pupo ju.

Un o so fun elomiran,
Itan Oor’ofe Re,
Un o maa yo n’nu isin Re,
Titi un o r’oju Re.

‘Gba mo ba si ri ogo,
Ninu odi Jasper,
Un o korin irapada,
P’Olugbala san ju.
chorus_yoruba:
Chorus:
Sugbon Jesu lo san julo
Beeni Jesu lo san julo
N’nu gbogbo ayo to yi mi ka
Jesu nikan lo julo

title_english: When shadows darken my earthly way
passage_english: HE SHALL COVER THEE WITH HIS FEATHERS …. PSALM 91:4
passage_yoruba: yoo fi iye re bo o … orin dafidi 91:4
verses_english:
When shadows darken my earthly way,
And long and dreary seems the day,
This promise sweet comes my soul to greet,
He never forgets His own.

When cherished plans all here seems to fail,
And doubt and fear my soul assail,
'Tis then I rest on His loving breast,
Who never forgets His own.

O no, He never forgets His own,
And dearer He has daily grown,
Since that glad day when He came to stay,
And made my poor heart His own.
(Amen).
chorus_english:
Chorus:
He never forgets His own,
He never forgets His own,
Though friends deny there is one so nigh,
Who never forgets His own.
verses_yoruba:
Nigbati ona mi ba sokun,
Ti ojo ibi ba si de;
Emi n ranti ileri yii pe:
Oun ko je gbagbe Tire.

Nigbati ‘reti gbogbo ba pin,
T‘iyemeji at‘eru de,
Un o wa sinmi l‘aya Eniti,
Ko le je gbagbe Tire.

Oun ko je gbagbe Tire laelae;
O se owon fun mi pupo,
Lati ‘gbati O ti sokale.
Ti O n gbe ‘nu okan mi.
(Amin).
chorus_yoruba:
Chorus:
Oun ko je gbagbe Tire,
Oun ko je gbagbe Tire,
Bi ore sa, Oun wa nitosi,
Oun ko je gbagbe Tire.

title_english: I must needs go home by the way of the cross
title_yoruba: On‘agbelebu ni mo ni ba lo le
passage_english: THEN JESUS SAID TO THEM AGAIN, “MOST ASSUREDLY, I SAY TO YOU, I AM THE DOOR OF THE SHEEP.” JOHN 10:7
passage_yoruba: nitorinaa jesu tun wi fun won pe, looto ni mow i fun yin, emi ni ilekun awon agutan. johanu 10:7
verses_english:
I must needs go home by the way of the cross,
There's no other way but this;
I shall ne'er get sight of the gates of light,
If the way of the cross I miss.

I must needs go on in the blood sprinkled way,
The path that the Savior trod,
If I ever climb to the heights sublime,
Where the soul is at home with God.

Then I bid farewell to the way of the world,
To walk in it nevermore,
For the Lord says, "Come," and I seek my home
Where He waits at the open door.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
On‘agbelebu ni mo ni ba lo le,
Ko tun si ona mi mo;
N ko ni de enu ona ogo naa
Bi mo ba so ona yii nu.

Mo ni lati rin lona ta f‘eje won,
Ona t‘Olugbala rin;
Bi mo ba fe goke lo si orun
Nibiti okan gbe n sinmi.

‘Gbanaa un o ki aye pe “O digbose”
N ko tun rin l‘ona re mo;
‘Tori Kristi duro lenu ona
O si n pe mi pe, “Wa, maa bo”.
(Amin).
chorus_english:
The way of the cross leads home, (leads home,)
The way of the cross leads home; (leads home;)
It is sweet to know as I onward go,
The way of cross leads home.
chorus_yoruba:
Ona agbelebu yii,
Lo lo si ile ogo (tara)
O dun ki n mo bi mo ti nrin lo pe,
Oun nikan l‘ona ile.

title_english: If you are tired of the load of your sin
title_yoruba: B‘eru ese re ba n wo o l’orun
passage_english: GOD, BE MERCIFUL TO ME A SINNER. LUKE 18:13
passage_yoruba: olorun saanu fun mi emi elese. luku 18:13
verses_english:
If you are tired of the load of your sin
Let Jesus come into your heart;
If you desire a new life to begin,
Let Jesus come into your heart.

If 'tis for purity now that you sigh,
Let Jesus come into your heart;
Fountains for cleansing are flowing nearby,
Let Jesus come in to your heart.

If there 's a tempest your voice cannot still,
Let Jesus come into your heart;
If there's a void this world never can fill,
Let Jesus come into your heart.

If friends, once trusted, have proven untrue,
Let Jesus come into your heart;
Find what a friend He will be unto you,
Let Jesus come into your heart.

If you would join the glad songs of the blest,
Let Jesus come into your heart;
If you would enter the mansion of rest,
Let Jesus come into your heart.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
B‘eru ese re ba n wo o l’orun,
Pe Jesu wole okan re;
B‘o n daniyan isoji okan re,
Pe Jesu wole okan re.

Bi’ o ba nwa iwenumo kiri,
Pe Jesu wole okan re;
Omi ‘wenumo ko jinna si o,
Pe Jesu wole okan re.

B‘igbi wahala ba n gba o kiri
Pe Jesu wole okan re;
B‘afo ba wa ti aye ko le di,
Pe Jesu wole okan re.

Bi ore to gbekele ba da o
Pe Jesu wole okan re;
Oun nikan ni Olubanidaro,
Pe Jesu wole okan re.

B‘o n fe korin awon Olubukun
Pe Jesu wole okan re,
Bi o n fe wo agbala isinmi,
Pe Jesu wole okan re.
(Amin).
chorus_yoruba:
Le ‘yemeji re sonu,
Ba Oluwa re laja;
Si okan re paya fun un,
Pe Jesu wole okan re.

title_english: I have been to the fountain of cleansing
passage_english: IN THAT DAY THERE SHALL BE A FOUNTAIN OPENED TO THE HOUSE OF DAVID. ZEC. 13:1
passage_yoruba: LI OJO NAA ISUN KAN YOO SI SILE FUN ILE DAFIDI. SEKARIAH 13:1
verses_english:
I have been to the fountain of cleansing,
And plung’d ‘neath the life-giving flow,
‘Tis the blood shed on Calvary’s mountain,
That makes the soul the whiter than snow.

I have been to the fountain of cleansing,
Found peace in the Crucified One,
All my sins by His grace have been cancelled,
And heav'n in my soul is begun.

I have been to the fountain of cleansing,
And glory is flooding my soul,
Hallelujah! my heart is rejoicing,
His blood makes me ev'ry whit whole.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo ti de bi orisun ‘wenumo,
Mo ri sinu eje ti n san
Jade lat‘ori oke Kalfari
T‘o m‘okan mi funfun ju sno.

Mo ti de bi orisun ‘wenumo
Alaafia pipe je temi;
Nipa oor‘-ofe ese mi ji,
Alaafia de ‘nu okan mi.

Mo ti de bi orisun ‘wenumo,
Ogo si kun ‘nu okan mi;
Halleluya! mo ni ayo kiku,
‘Tori mo di mimo laulau.
(Amin).
chorus_english:
O yes it makes whiter than snow,
The blood cleanses me, this I know,
Since it cleans'd me from sin,
He's been living within,
His blood cleanses whiter than snow.
chorus_yoruba:
O daju p’okan mi funfun;
Mo mo p‘eje Kristi we e mo
O we gbogbo ese mi
O si n gbe inu mi,
O mu k‘okan mi fun ju sno.

title_english: I MYSELF WILL AWAKE EARLY
title_yoruba: EMI TIKARA MI YOO JI NI KUTUKUTU
passage_english: PSALM 108:2
passage_yoruba: ORIN DAFIDI 108:2
verses_english: Awake, my soul, and with the sun thy daily stage of duty run; shake off dull sloth, and joyful rise, to pay thy morning sacrifice.
Thy precious time misspent, redeem, each present day thy last esteem, improve thy talent with due care; for the great day thyself prepare.
By influence of the Light divine let thy own light to others shine. Reflect all Heaven’s propitious ways in ardent love, and cheerful praise.
Wake, and lift up thyself, my heart, and with the Angels bear thy part, who all night long unwearied sing high praise to the eternal King.
I wake, I wake; ye heavenly choir, may your devotion me inspire, that I like you my age may spend, like you may on my God attend.
All praise to Thee, who safe has kept and hast refreshed me while I slept; grant, Lord, when I from death shall wake I may of endless light partake.
Lord, I my vows to thee renew; disperse my sins as morning dew; guard my first springs of thought and will, and with thyself my spirit fill.
Direct, control, suggest, this day, all I design or do or say; that all my powers, with all their might, in thy sole glory may unite.
verses_yoruba: Ji, okan mi, ba oorun ji; mura si ise oojo Re; ma se ilora, ji kutu, k’o san gbese ebo ooro.
Ro gbogbo ojo t’o fi sofo, bere si rere se loni; kiyesi irin re laye yii; k’o si mura d’ojo nla ni.
Gba ninu imole oorun, si tan imole naa f’elomi; je ogo Olorun re han ninu iwa ati ise re.
Ji, gbon’ra nu, iwo okan mi; yan ipo re laarin Angeli, awon ti won korin iyin ni gbogbo oru s’Oba wa.
Mo ji, mo ji, ogun orun; k’emi lagbara bi ti yin; k’emi ba le lo ojo mi fun iyin Olugbala mi.
Ogo fun Eniti o so mi, to tu mi lara loj’oorun; Oluwa, bi mo ba ku, ji mi s’aye ainipekun.
Oluwa mo tun eje je, tun ese ka b’iri ooro; so akoronu mi oni si f’Emi re kun inu mi.
Oro ati ise mi loni ki won le ri bi eko Re; k’emi si f’ipa mi gbogbo sise rere fun ogo Re.

title_english: COMMIT THY WAY UNTO THE LORD
title_yoruba: FI ONA RE LE OLUWA LOWO
passage_english: PSALM 37:5
passage_yoruba: ORIN DAFIDI 37:5
verses_english: Once more the sun is beaming bright, once more to God we pray, that his eternal light may guide and cheer our souls this day.
O may no sin our hands defile, or cause our minds to rove, upon our lips be simple truth, and in our hearts be love!
Throughout the day, O Christ, in thee may ready help be found, to save our souls from Satan's wiles, who still is hovering round.
Subservient to thy daily praise our daily toil shall be; so may our works, in thee begun, be furthered, Lord, by thee.
And lest the flesh, profane and proud, subdue the yielding soul, may self-constraining temperance carnal desires control.
To God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy Ghost, eternal glory be from man, and from the angel host!
verses_yoruba: Lekansi, bi oorun ti n ran, awa n be Olorun pe ki imole Re ailopin samona wa loni.
K’a mase da esekese, k’a ma si ro ibi; k’a ni otito gan-an l’enú ati ife okan.
L’ojo oni, Olugbala, k’a ri iranwo Re, lati gba wa lọwọ esu ti n d’ode wa kiri.
Ki ise wa l’ojojumo maa je fun iyin Re; bee l’O maa n bukun ise wa ti a n bere ninu Re.
Je ka fi iwontunwonsi ka’wo ifekufe wa; ki gberaga asan ara ma bori okan wa.
Olorun Baba ati Omo ati Emi Mimo — ni ki Eda ati Angeli f’ogo ailopin fun.

title_english: I LAID ME DOWN AND SLEPT; I AWAKED; FOR THE LORD SUSTAINED ME.
title_yoruba: EMI DUBULE, MO SI SUN, MO SI JI; NITORI OLUWA TI MI LEYIN.
passage_english: PSALM 3:5
verses_english: Through all the dangers of the night, the Lord doth keep me safe, to see another morning dawn and to bow down the knee.
Oh Lord we pray keep us today, beneath Thy mighty wings; only the ones whom Thou doth keep are from all dangers free.
Let all our thoughts and all our deeds show we belong to Thee, so that our light may truly shine and beam to all the world.
O grant that we ne'er stray from Thee, Jesus, Saviour Divine, until our eyes there shall behold Thy face for ever more.
verses_yoruba: Ninu gbogbo ewu oru, Oluwa lo n so mi; awa si tun ri imole yii, a tun te eekun ba.
Oluwa, pa wa mo l’oni, fi apa Re so wa; kiki awon ti Iwo pamo lo n yo ninu ewu.
K’oro wa ati iwa wa fihan pe Tire la wa; to bee ti imole otito le tan l’aju aye.
Ma je k’a pada lodo Re, Olugbala owon; titi ao fi oju wa ri oju Re li opin.

title_english: BUT TO YOU WHO FEAR MY NAME, THE SUN OF RIGHTEOUSNESS SHALL ARISE.
title_yoruba: OORUN ODODO YIO LA, FUN EYIN TI O BERU ORUKO MI.
passage_english: MALACHI 4:2
passage_yoruba: MALAKI 4:2
verses_english: When, streaming from the eastern skies, the morning light salutes my eyes, O Sun of Righteousness Divine, on me with beams of mercy shine; chase the dark clouds of sin away and turn my darkness into day.

When to heaven's great and glorious King my morning sacrifice I bring and, grieving o'er my guilt and shame, ask mercy, Savior, in Thy name. My conscience sprinkle with Thy blood and be my Advocate with God.

When each day's scenes and labors close and wearied nature seeks repose, with pardoning mercy, richly blest, guard me, my Savior, while I rest; and as each morning's sun shall rise, oh, lead me onward to the skies!

And at my life's last setting sun, my conflict o'er, my labor done, Jesus, Thy heavenly radiance shed to cheer and bless my dying bed and from death's gloom my spirit raise to see Thy face and sing Thy praise.
verses_yoruba: Nigbat’ imole owuro ba nti ila oorun tan wa, A! Oorun ododo mimo, ma sai fi anu ran si mi! Tu isudede ebi ka, s’okunkun mi d’imole nla.
‘Gbati m ba n’ebo ooro wa ‘waju Olorun t’o logo, Olugbala, ti n ba kaanu nitori ese ti mo da, Jesu! Fi eje Re we mi, ma sai se alagbawi mi.
‘Gba gbogbo ise oojo pin, ti ara si nfe lo si mi, f’aanu t’o kun fun ‘dariji, dabobo mi, Oluwa mi; bi oorun si ti ‘maa n goke, beeni k’o gb’ero mi soke.
‘Gbat’ oorun aye mi ba wo, ti ko si si wahala mo, je k’imole Tire, Jesu! tan boji ti mo sun yika: gb’emi mi dide, Oluwa, ki n ri O, ki n si gbe O ga.

title_english: WALK BEFORE ME, AND BE THOU PERFECT.
title_yoruba: MAA RIN NIWAJU MI, KI IWO KI O SI PE.
verses_english:
1. Forth in Thy name, O Lord, I go,
My daily labor to pursue;
Thee, only Thee, resolved to know
In all I think, or speak, or do.

2. The task Thy wisdom hath assigned,
O let me cheerfully fulfill;
In all my works Thy presence find,
And prove Thy good and perfect will.

3. Preserve me from my calling’s snare,
And hide my simple heart above,
Above the thorns of choking care,
The gilded baits of worldly love.

4. Thee may I set at my right hand,
Whose eyes mine inmost substance see,
And labor on at Thy command,
And offer all my works to Thee.

5. Give me to bear Thy easy yoke,
And every moment watch and pray,
And still to things eternal look,
And hasten to Thy glorious day.

6. For Thee delightfully employ
Whate’er Thy bounteous grace hath given;
And run my course with even joy,
And closely walk with Thee to Heaven.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
1. Oluwa mi, mo n jade lo,
Lati se ise oojo mi;
Iwo nikan l’emi o mo
L’oro, l’ero, ati n’ise.

2. Ise t’o yan mi, l’aanu Re
Je ki n le se tayotayo;
Ki n r’oju Re ni ise mi,
K’emi si le f’ife Re han.

3. Dabo bomi lowo ’danwo,
K’o pa okan mimo kuro
L’owo aniyan aye yi,
Ati gbogbo ifekufe.

4. Iwo t’oju Re r’okan mi,
Maa wa l’ow’otun mi titi,
Ki n maa sise lo l’ase Re,
Ki n f’ise mi gbogbo fun O.

5. Je ki n r’eru Re t’o fuye
Ki n maa sora nigbagbogbo;
Ki n maa f’oju si nkan t’orun,
Ki n si mura d’ojo ogo.

6. Ohunkohun t’o fi fun mi
Je ki n le lo fun ogo Re
Ki n f’ayo sure ije mi
Ki n ba O rin titi d’orun.
(Amin)

title_english: O When Wilt Thou Come Unto Me
title_yoruba: Nigbawo Ni Iwo O To Mi Wa
passage_english: O WHEN WILT THOU COME UNTO ME. PSALM 101:2
passage_yoruba: NIGBAWO NI IWO O TO MI WA. ORIN DAFIDI 101:2
verses_english:
Come to me, LORD, when first I wake,
As the faint lights of morning break;
Bid purest thoughts within me rise,
Like crystal dew-drops to the skies.

Come to me in the sultry noon,
Or earth's low communings will soon
Of Thy dear Face, eclipse the light,
And change my fairest day to night.

Come to me in the evening shade,
And if my heart from Thee hath strayed,
Oh bring it back, and from afar
Smile on me like Thine evening star.

Come to me in the midnight hour,
When sleep witholds its balmy power;
Let my lone spirit find her rest,
Like John, upon my SAVIOUR's breast.

Come to me through life's varied way,
And when its pulses cease to play.
Then, SAVIOUR, bid me come to Thee,
That where Thou art, Thy child may be.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Wa s'odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Ni kutukutu owuro,
Mu k'ero rere so jade,
Lat'inu mi soke orun.

Wa s'odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Ni wakati osan gangan;
Ki 'yonu ma ba se mi mo,
Won a si s' osan mi d'oru.

Wa s'odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Nigbati ale ba n le lo,
Bi okan mi ba n sako lo,
Mu pada, f'oju re wo mi.

Wa s'odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Li oru, nigbati oorun,
Ko woju mi; je k'okan mi,
Ri 'simi je li aya Re.

Wa s'odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Nigbogbo ojo aye mi,
Nigbati emi mi ba pin
Ki n le n'ibugbe lodo Re.
(Amin).

title_english: Christ, Whose Glory Fills the Skies
passage_english: BUT UNTO YOU THAT FEAR MY NAME SHALL THE SUN OF RIGHTEOUSNESS ARISE. MALACHI 4:2
passage_yoruba: FUN EYIN T'O BERU ORUKO MI, L'OORUN ODODO YIO LA. MALAKI 4:2
verses_english:
Visit then this soul of mine,
Pierce the gloom of sin and grief;
Fill me, Radiancy divine,
Scatter all my unbelief;
More and more Thyself display,
Shining to the perfect day.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Kristi, Ologo, Olola,
Iwo Imole aye;
Oorun ododo dide,
K'o si bori okunkun
'Mole ooro, sunmo mi,
'Rawo ooro w'aya mi

Okunkun l'owuro je,
B'Iwo ko pelu re wa,
Ailayo l'ojo yii je,
B'aanu ko tan mole mi,
Fun mi n'imole Jesu,
M'okan mi gbogbo gbona.

Wa be okan mi yii wo,
Le okunkun ese lo,
F'imole orun kun mi,
Si tu aigbagbo mi ka,
Maa f'ara Re han mi sii,
Si maa ran b'osan gangan.
(Amin).

title_english: Come to the Morning Prayer
passage_english: EVENING, AND MORNING, AND AT NOON, WILL I PRAY. PS. 55:17
passage_yoruba: LALE, LOORO ATI LOSAN LIE MI O MAA GBADURA. O.D. 55:17.
verses_english:
Come to the Morning Prayer,
Come let us kneel and pray;
Prayer is the Christian pilgrim's staff
To walk with God all day.

At noon, beneath the Rock
Of Ages, rest and pray;
Sweet is that shadow from the heat,
When the sun smites by day.

At eve, shut to the door,
Round the home-altar pray,
And finding there "the House of God,"
At "heaven's gate" close the day.

When midnight seals our eyes,
Let each in spirit say,
"I sleep, but my heart waketh, Lord,
With Thee to watch and pray."
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
Wa s'adura ooro,
Kunle k'a gbadura,
Adura ni opa Kristian,
Lati b'Olorun rin

Losan, wole labe
Apat' ayeraye,
Itura ojiji Re dun
Nigbat' oorun ba mu

Je ki gbogbo ile
Wa gbadura l'ale;
Ki ile wa di t'Olorun
Ati 'bode orun

Nigbat'o d'oganjo,
Je k'a wi l'emi pe,
Mo sun, sugbon okan mi ji,
Lati ba O sona
(Amin).

title_english: The Morning Bright, With Rosy Light
passage_english: HE SHALL COVER THEE WITH HIS FEATHERS, AND UNDER HIS WINGS SHALT THOU TRUST. PSALM 91:4
passage_yoruba: YIO FI IYE RE BO O, ABE IYE APA RE NI IWO O GBEKELE. ORIN DAFIDI 91:4
verses_english:
The morning bright, With rosy light,
Hath waked me from my sleep;
Father, I own thy love alone
Thy little one doth keep.

All through the day, I humbly pray,
Be Thou my Guard and Guide;
My sins forgive, and let me live,
Blest Jesus, near Thy side.

O make Thy rest within my breast,
Great Spirit of all grace;
Make me like Thee; then shall I be
Prepared to see Thy face.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Imole ooro didun yii,
Ji mi nin'oorun mi,
Baba, ife Tire nikan,
L'o pa omo Re mo.

Ni gbogbo oni, mo be O,
Maa se Oluso mi,
Dariji mi, Jesu mimo,
Ki n je Tire loni.

Wa se 'bugbe Re ninu mi,
Emi oore ofe,
So mi do mimo laye yii,
K'emi le r'oju Re.
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, Sun of Righteousness
passage_english: MY VOICE SHALT THOU HEAR IN THE MORNING. PSLAM 5:3
passage_yoruba: OLUWA OHUN MI IWO O GBO LI OWURO. ORIN DAFIDI 5:3
verses_english:
Jesus, Sun of righteousness,
Brightest beam of love divine,
With the early morning rays
Do thou on our darkness shine,
And dispel with purest light
All our night.

As on drooping herb and flower
Falls the soft refreshing dew,
Let thy Spirit's grace and power
All our weary souls renew;
Showers of blessing over all
Softly fall.

Like the sun's reviving ray,
May thy love with tender glow
All our coldness melt away,
Warm and cheer us forth to go,
Gladly serve thee and obey
All the day.

Lead us all our days and years
In thy straight and narrow way;
Lead us through the vale of tears
To the land of perfect day,
Where thy people, fully blest,
Safely rest.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, Oorun ododo,
Iwo imole ife
Gbat' imole owuro,
Ba n t'ila oorun tan wa,
Tan mole ododo Re
Yi wa ka.

Gege bi iri ti se,
Sori eweko gbogbo,
K'Emi oore ofe Re
So okan wa di otun,
Ro ojo ibukun Re
Sori Wa.

B'imole oorun ti n ran,
K'imole ife Tire
Si maa gbona l'okan wa,
K'o si mu wa l'ara ya
K'a le maa f'ayo sin O.
L'aye wa.

Amona ireti wa,
Ma fi wa sile titi,
Fiwa sabe iso Re
Titi opin emi wa,
Sin wa la ajo wa ja
S'ile wa.

Pa wa mo n'nu ife re,
Lojo aye wa gbogbo
Si mu wa bori iku,
Mu wa de 'le ayo naa
K'a le b'awon mimo gba
Isinmi.
(Amin).

title_english: Holy Father, Hear Me
passage_english: O GOD, THOU ART MY GOD; EARLY WILL I SEEK THEE. PS. 63:1
passage_yoruba: OLORUN, NI KUTUKUTU L'EMI O MAA S'AFERI RE. ORIN DAFIDI 63:1
verses_english:
Holy Father, hear me;
Thou art my defender,
Be thou ever near me,
Loving, true and tender.

Jesus, blessèd Saviour,
Lord of life and glory,
Grant me now thy favour
As I kneel before thee.

Comforter benignest,
Who abiding in me
All my need divinest,
Move me, draw me, win me.

Holy, holy, holy,
Come, and leave me never,
Thine abode most lowly,
Only thine for ever.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Baba mi gbọ temi!
'Wọ ni alaabo mi,
Mas sun mọ mi titi;
Oninu're julọ!

Jesu Oluwa mi,
Iye at'ogo mi,
K 'igba naa yara de,
Ti un ó de ọdọ Rẹ.

Olutunu julọ,
'Wọ ti n gbe inu mi,
'Wọ t'o mọ aini mi,
Fa mi, k'o si gba mi.

Mimọ, Mimọ, Mimọ,
Ma fi mi silẹ lae,
Se mi n 'ibugbe Rẹ,
Tirẹ nikan laelae.
(Amin)

title_english: Glory to Thee, My God, This Night
passage_english: WHEN THOU SLEEPEST, IT SHALL KEEP THEE. PROVERB 6:22.
passage_yoruba: NIGBATI IWO BA SUN, YOO MAA SO O. OWE 6:22.
verses_english:
Glory to thee, my God, this night,
For all the blessings of the light:
Keep me, O keep me, King of kings,
Beneath thine own almighty wings.

Forgive me, Lord, for thy dear Son,
The ill that I this day have done;
That with the world, myself, and thee,
I, ere I sleep, at peace may be.

O may my soul on thee repose,
And with sweet sleep mine eyelids close;
Sleep that shall me more vigorous make
To serve my God when I awake.

When in the night I sleepless lie,
My soul with heavenly thoughts supply;
Let no ill dreams disturb my rest,
No powers of darkness me molest.
verses_yoruba:
Ogo f'Olorun l'ale yii,
Fun gbogbo oore Imole,
So mi, Oba awon Oba
Labe ojiji iye Re.

Oluwa f'ese mi ji mi,
Nitori omo Re loni
K'emi le wa l'alaafia,
Pelu iwo ati aye

Je k'okan mi le sun le O,
K'oorun didun p'oju mi de,
Oorun ti yoo m'ara mi le,
Ki n le sin O li owuro.

Bi mo ba dubule laisun,
F'ero orun kun okan mi,
Ma je ki n lala bururu,
Ma je k'ipa ookun bo mi

Yin Olorun, gbogbo eda;
Ti n be nisale aye yii,
E yin In loke, eda Orun,
Yin Baba, Omo oun Emi
(Amin).

title_english: We Lift Up Our Eyes to Thee
passage_english: O THOU THAT HEAREST PRAYER, UNTO THEE SHALL ALL FLESH COME. PSALM 65:2
passage_yoruba: IWO TI N GBO ADURA, SI ODO RE NI GBOGBO ENIYAN N BO. O.D 65:2
verses_english:
We lift up our eyes to Thee,
And our hands and all our hearts,
Lord accept the prayer we make,
Though unworthy, weak and faint.

Lord grant that we may know Thee,
May we all know Thy great name,
Help us here to do Thy will,
As is done up there in heaven.

When we sleep, at dead of night,
Guard us, keep and stand by us,
And when breaks forth morning light,
Let us wake, and praise Thy Name.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Agboju soke si O,
At'owo, ati okan;
Tewogba adura wa,
B'o tile se ailera.

Oluwa je k'a mo O,
Je k'a mo oruko Re;
Je k'awa se ife Re,
Bi won ti n se li orun.

Nigbati a sun l'oru
So wa, k'o duro ti wa;
Nigbati ile si mo,
Ka ji, k'a fi 'yin fun O.
(Amin).

title_english: The Sun Is Sinking Fast
passage_english: THE LIFTING UP OF MY HANDS AS THE EVENING SACRIFICE. PSLAM 141:2
passage_yoruba: JE KI IGBE OWO MI SOKE DABI EBO ASALE. ORIN DAFIDI 141:2
verses_english:
The sun is sinking fast,
The daylight dies;
Let love awake, and pay
Her evening sacrifice.

As Christ upon the cross
His head inclined,
And to his Father's hands
His parting soul resigned;

So now herself my soul
Would wholly give
Into his sacred charge
In whom all spirits live;

So now beneath his eye
Would calmly rest,
Without a wish or thought
Abiding in the breast;

Save that his will be done,
Whate'er betide;
Dead to herself, and dead
In him to all beside.

Thus would I live: yet now
Not I, but he,
In all his power and love,
Henceforth alive in me.

One sacred Trinity,
One Lord divine,
May I be ever his,
And he for ever mine.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oorun fere wo na,
Ojo lo tan
K'ife k'o ji dide
K'o rubo asale.

Bi Jesu lor 'igi,
Ti teriba,
T'O jowo emi Re
Le baba Re lowo

Bee ni mo f'emi mi
Fun un l'afuntan,
Nipamo Re mimo
L'emi gbogbo sa wa.

N je emi o sinmi
Lodo Re je,
Laije k'ero kanso
Yo okan mi l' enu.

'Fe Tire ni sise
L'onakona;
Mo d'oku s'ara ni
Ati s'ohun gbogbo.

Bee l'emi ye; sugbon
Emi ko, Oun
Ni n be laaye n'nu mi,
L'agbara ife Re.

Metalokan Mimo,
Olorun kan
Lae ki n sa je Tire
K' Oun je temi titi
(Amin).

title_english: Through the Day Thy Love Has Spared Us
title_yoruba: Ife Re Da Wa Si Loni
passage_english: HE THAT KEEPETH THEE WILL NOT SLUMBER. PS. 121:3
passage_yoruba: ENITI N PA O MO, KI YIO TO GBE. ORIN DAFIDI 121:3
verses_yoruba:
Ife re da wa si loni
l' aare a si dubule
Maa so wa ni'dake oru
k'ota ma yo wa lenu
Jesu, se olutoju wa
iwo lo dun gbekele.
Jesu se olutoju wa
iwo lo dun gbekele.

Ero at'alejo l'aye
A n gb' aarin awon ota
Yo wa at'ile wa lewu
L 'apa Re ni ka sun si
N'ijo iyoun ayo pin
Ka le sinmi sodo Re
N'ijo iyoun ayo pin
Ka le sinmi sodo Re.
(Amin)

title_english: Abide with Me
passage_english: ABIDE WITH US: FOR IT IS TOWARD EVENING. LUKE 24:29
passage_yoruba: BA WA DURO; NITORI O DI OJO ALE. LUKE 24:29
verses_english:
Abide with me; fast falls the eventide;
The darkness deepens; Lord with me abide.
When other helpers fail and comforts flee,
Help of the helpless, O abide with me.

Come not in terrors, as the King of kings,
But kind and good, with healing in Thy wings,
Tears for all woes, a heart for every plea—
Come, Friend of sinners, and thus bide with me.

I need Thy presence every passing hour.
What but Thy grace can foil the tempter's power?
Who, like Thyself, my guide and stay can be?
Through cloud and sunshine, Lord, abide with me.

I fear no foe, with Thee at hand to bless;
Ills have no weight, and tears no bitterness.
Where is death's sting? Where, grave, thy victory?
I triumph still, if Thou abide with me.
verses_yoruba:
Wa bami gbe! ale fere 'le tan;
Okunkun n su, Oluwa ba mi gbe
Bi Oluranlowo miran ba ye,
Iranwo alaini wa ba mi gbe!

Ojo aye mi n sare lo s'opin
Ayo aye n ku, ogo re n womi,
Ayida at'ibaje ni mo n ri,
'Wo ti ki yipada, wa ba mi gbe.

Ma wa l'eru b'Oba awon oba
Sugbon ki o maa bo b'oninure;
Ki O si maa kaanu fun egbe mi,
Wa, Ore elese, wa ba mi gbe!

Mo n fe O ri, ni wakati gbogbo
Kil' o le segun Esu b'oore Re?
Tal'o le se amona mi bi Re?
N'nu 'banuje at'ayo ba mi gbe!

Pelu 'bukun Re, eru ko ba mi
Ibi ko wuwo, ekun ko koro,
Oro iku da? Segun isa da?
Un o segun sibe, b'Iwo ba mi gbe.

Wa ba mi gbe, ni wakati iku,
Se 'mole mi si toka si orun,
B'aye ti n koja, k'ile orun mo,
Ni yiye, ni kiku, wa ba mi gbe.
(Amin).

title_english: Sun of My Soul, Thou Savior Dear
passage_english: I Will Both Lay Me Down in Peace. Psalm 4:8
passage_yoruba: Emi O Dubule Li Alaafia. Orin Dafidi 4:8
verses_english:
Sun of my soul, thou Savior dear,
it is not night if thou be near;
O may no earthborn cloud arise
to hide thee from thy servant's eyes.

When the soft dews of kindly sleep
my wearied eyelids gently steep,
be my last thought, how sweet to rest
forever on my Savior's breast.

Abide with me from morn till eve,
for without thee I cannot live;
abide with me when night is nigh,
for without thee I dare not die.

If some poor wandering child of thine
has spurned today the voice divine,
now, Lord, the gracious work begin;
let him no more lie down in sin.

Watch by the sick, enrich the poor
with blessings from thy boundless store;
be every mourner's sleep tonight,
like infants' slumbers, pure and right.

Come near and bless us when we wake,
ere through the world our way we take,
till in the ocean of thy love
we lose ourselves in heaven above.
verses_yoruba:
Iwo imole okan mi,
Li odo Re, oru ko si,
Ki kuuku aye ma bo O,
Kuro l'oju iranse Re.

Nigbat' oorun ale didun
Ba n pa ipenpeju mi de,
K' ero mi je lati sinmi,
Lae, l'aya Olugbala mi.

Ba mi gbe l'ooro tit'ale
Laisi Re, emi ko le wa,
Ba mi gbe gbat'ile ba n su,
Laisi Re, emi ko le ku.

Bi otosi omo Re kan
Ba tapa s'oro Re loni,
Oluwa sise oore Re,
Ma je k' osun ninu ese.

Bukun fun awon alaisan,
Pese fun awon talaka,
K' oorun alawe l' aye yii
Dabi oorun omo titun.

Sure fun wa nigbat'a ji
K'a to m'ohun aye yii se
Titi awa de b'ife
T'a o si de Ijoba Re.

title_english: At Even, Ere the Sun Was Set
passage_english: When the Sun Did Set, They Brought Unto Him All That Were Diseased. Mark 1:32
passage_yoruba: Nigbati O Si Di Asale, Ti Oorun Wo Won Ko Gbogbo Awon Olokunrun To O Wa. Marku 1:32
verses_english:
At even, ere the sun was set,
the sick, O Lord, around thee lay;
O, in what diverse pains they met!
O, with what joy they went away!

Once more 'tis eventide, and we,
oppressed with various ills, draw near;
what if thy form we cannot see?
We know and feel that thou art here.

And some have found the world is vain,
and yet from the world they break not free;
And some have friends who give them pain,
yet have not sought a friend in thee.

And none, O Lord, have perfect rest,
for none are wholly free from sin;
And they who fain would serve thee best
are conscious most of wrong within.

Thy touch has still its ancient power.
no word from thee can fruitless fall;
hear, in this solemn evening hour,
and in thy mercy heal us all.
verses_yoruba:
L'oju ale 'gba't oorun wo,
Won gbe abirun w'odo Re,
Oniruuru ni aisan won,
Sugbon won f'ayo lo' le won.

Jesu a de l' oj 'ale yii,
A sunmo t'awa t'arun wa,
Bi a ko tile le 'ri O,
Sugbon a mo p'O sunmo wa.

Olugbala, wo osi wa,
Omi ko san, mi banuje,
Omi ko ni ife si O,
Ife elomi si tutu.

Omi mo pe, asan l'aye
Beeni won ko f'aye sile,
Omi l'ore ti ko se 're,
Beni won ko fi O s'ore.

Ko s'okan ninu wa t'o pe
Gbogbo wa si ni elese,
Awon t'o si n sin O tooto
Mo ara won ni alaipe.

Sugbon Jesu, Olugbala,
Eni bi awa n 'Iwo se
'Wo ti ri'danwo bi awa
'Wo si ti mo ailera wa.

Agbar'owo Re wa sibe,
Ore Re li agbara,
Gbo adura ale wa yii,
Ni aanu, wo gbogbo wa san.

title_english: Father, Again in Jesus' Name We Meet
title_yoruba: Un O Dide, Un O To Baba Mi Lo
passage_english: I Will Arise and Go to My Father. Luke 15:18
passage_yoruba: Un O Dide, Un O To Baba Mi Lo. Luku 15:18
verses_english:
Father, again in Jesus' name we meet,
And bow in penitence beneath Thy feet;
Again to Thee our feeble voices raise,
To sue for mercy, and to sing Thy praise.

Oh we would bless Thee for Thy ceaseless care,
And all Thy work from day to day declare;
Is not our life with hourly mercies crown'd?
Does not Thine arm encircle us around?

Alas! unworthy of Thy boundless love,
Too oft with careless feet from Thee we rove;
But now, encouraged by Thy voice, we come,
Returning sinners to a Father's home.

Oh by that name in whom all fulness dwells,
Oh by that love which every love excels,
Oh by that blood so freely shed for sin,
Open blest mercy's gate and take us in.
verses_yoruba:
Baba, a tun pade l'ooko Jesu,
A si wa teriba lab'ese Re,
A tun fe gb'ohun wa soke si O
Lati wa aanu, lati korin 'yin

A yin O fun itoju 'gbagbogbo
Ojojumo l' ao maa royin 'se Re,
Wiwa laaye wa, aanu Re ha ko o?
Apa Re ki o fi n gba ni mora?

O se! A ko ye fun ife nla Re,
A sako kuro lodo Re poju,
Sugbon kikankikan ni O si n pe
Nje, a de a pada wa 'le Baba

Nipa ooko t'o bor'ohun gbogbo
Nipa ife t'o ta 'fe gbogbo yo
Nipa eje ti a ta fun ese,
S'ilekun aanu, si gbani si 'le

title_english: One Sweetly Solemn Thought
passage_english: For Now Is Our Salvation Nearer Than When We Believed. Romans 13:11
passage_yoruba: Nisisiyi Ni Igbala Wa Sunmole Ju Lgbati Awa Ti Gbagbo Lo. Romu. 13:11
verses_english:
One sweetly solemn thought,
Come to me o'er and o'er,
I am nearer my home to-day,
Than I ever have been.

Nearer my Father's house,
Where many mansions be,
Nearer the great and snow-white throne,
Nearer the crystal sea.

Nearer the bond of life,
Where we lay our burden down,
Nearer shall I leaving the cross,
Nearer gaining the crown.

But the waves of that silent sea,
Roll dark upon my sight,
Which brightly on the other side,
Break on a shore of light.

Father perfect my trust,
Strengthen the grasp of my faith,
Let me feel Thee near when,I stand,
Along on the shore of death.

Feel Thee near when my feet,
Are slipping over the brink,
For it may be I'm nearer home,
Nearer now than i think.
verses_yoruba:
Ero di/dun kan /n so,
S' okan/mi /fi/ rifi/ri,
Mo sunmo 'le/mi lo/ni,
Ju bi mo ti sunmo ri.

Mo sunmo/ 'te nla/ni,
Mo sunm'/okan /Kristal/li,
Mo sunmo/'le Ba/ba,
Nibit /'bugbe/pupo/wa.

Mo sunm'o /pin e/mi,
T'a/so e/ru ka/le,
T'a/gb'agbele/bu si/le,
T'a/si be /re gb'a/de.

Lagbedeme/ji ey/ii,
Ni/ 'san‐o/mi du/du,
Ti a o la ko/ja dan/dan,
K'a/ to de/mole naa.

Jesu, joo/se mi/pe,
So 'gba/gbo mi/di li/le,
Je ki n mo p'O/sunmo/mi,
Le/ti be/be i/ku.

Ki n mo p'O sunmo/mi,
Gba/n ba n jin/si ko/to;
O le je pe mo/n sunmo/le,
Sunmo/ju bi/mo ti/ro.

title_english: Lead, Kindly Light
passage_english: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire. Psalm 78:14
passage_yoruba: Li osan pelu o fi awo sanmo se amona won, ati loru gbogbo pelu imole ina. Orin Dafidi 78:14
verses_english:
Lead, kindly Light, amid th'encircling gloom,
lead thou me on!
The night is dark, and I am far from home;
lead thou me on!
Keep thou my feet; I do not ask to see
the distant scene; one step enough for me.

I was not ever thus, nor prayed that thou
shouldst lead me on;
I loved to choose and see my path; but now
lead thou me on!
I loved the garish day, and, spite of fears,
pride ruled my will: remember not past years!

So long thy power hath blessed me, sure it still
will lead me on.
O'er moor and fen, o'er crag and torrent, till
the night is gone,
And with the morn those angel faces smile,
which I have loved long since, and lost awhile!

Meantime along the narrow, rugged path
Thyself hast trod,
Lead, Savior, lead me home in childlike faith,
Home to my God,
To rest forever after earthly strife
In the calm light of everlasting life.
verses_yoruba:
Nigbakan ri, emi ko be O, pe
Maa sin mi lo,
Beeni n ko fe O, sugbon nigba yii,
Maa sin mi lo,
Afe aye ni mo ti n to leyin,
Sugbon Jesu, ma ranti igbani.

Ipa Re l'o ti n di mi mu, yoo si
Maa sin mi lo.
Ninu ere ati yangi aye,
Maa sin mi lo
Titi em'o fi ri awon wonni
Ti mo fe, ti won ti f'aye sile

K'o to d'igbanaa, l'ona aye yii
T' Iwo ti rin,
Maa sin mi lo, Jesu Olugbala
S' ile Baba,
Ki n le sinmi leyin ija aye
Ninu imole ti ko nipekun.

title_english: Savior, Breathe an Evening Blessing
passage_english: He that keepeth shall neither slumber. Psalm 121:4
passage_yoruba: Eniti n pa o mo ki togbe. Orin Dafidi 121:4
verses_english:
Savior, breathe an evening blessing
Ere repose our spirits seal;
Sin and want we come confessing:
Thou canst save, and Thou canst heal.

Though destruction walk around us,
Though the arrow past us fly,
Angel guards from Thee surround us;
We are safe if Thou art nigh.

Though the night be dark and dreary,
Darkness cannot hide from Thee;
Thou art He who, never weary,
Watchest where Thy people be.

Father, to thy holy keeping
Humbly we ourselves resign;
Savior, who hast slept our sleeping,
Make our slumbers pure as thine.

Blessèd Spirit, brooding o'er us,
Chase the darkness of our night,
Till the perfect day before us
Breaks in everlasting light.
verses_yoruba:
K'a to sun, Olugbala wa,
Fun wa n'ibukun ale,
Ajewo ese wa fun O,
Iwo lo 'le gba wa la.

B'ile tile ti su dudu,
Ookun ko le se wa mo,
Iwo eniti ki saare,
N so awon eniyan Re.

B'iparun tile yi wa ka,
Ti ofa n fo wa koja,
Awon Angeli yi wa ka,
Awa o wa lailewu.

N'irele awa f'ara wa,
S'abe aabo Re, Baba,
Jesu, 'Wo t'osun bi awa,
Se oorun wa bi Tire

Emi mimo, rado bo wa,
Tan'mole s'okunkun wa,
Tit' awa o fi ri ojo
Imole ayeraye.

title_english: Sweet Savior, Bless Us
title_yoruba: Jesu, bukun wa k'a to lo
passage_english: For the Lord shall be thine everlasting light. Isaiah 60:20
passage_yoruba: Oluwa yoo je imole ainipekun fun o. Isaiah 60:20
verses_english:
Sweet Savior, bless us ere we go;
Thy Word into our minds instill,
And make our lukewarm hearts to glow
With lowly love and fervent will.

The day is done, its hours have run,
And Thou hast taken count of all,
The scanty triumphs grace hath won,
The broken vow, the frequent fall.

Do more than pardon; give us joy,
Sweet fear, and sober liberty,
And simple hearts without alloy
That only long to be like Thee.

Labor is sweet, for Thou hast toiled,
And care is light, for Thou hast cared;
Let not our works with self be soiled,
Nor in unsimple ways ensnared.

For all we love, the poor, the sad,
The sinful, unto Thee we call;
O let Thy mercy make us glad:
Thou art our Jesus, and our All.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, bukun wa k'a to lo,
Gbin oro Re si aya wa;
K'o si mu k'ife gbigbona
Kun okan ilowoowo wa,

Ile ti su, Oorun ti wo,
'Wo si ti siro iwa wa,
Die n' isegun wa loni,,
Isubu wa l'o papoju.

Jesu, dariji wa, fun wa
L'ayo ati eru mimo
At'okan ti ko l'abawon,
K'a ba le jo O l'ajotan.

Laalaa dun, tori' Iwo se ri;
Aniyan fere, O see ri,
Ma je k'a gbo t'ara nikan,
K'a ma bo sinu idewo

A n be O f'awon alaini,
F'elese at'awon t'a fe,
Je ki aanu Re mu wa yo,
Wo Jesu l'ohun gbogbo wa.

Jesu bukun wa, ile su,
Tikalare, wa ba wa gbe,
Angel' ere n so ile wa
A tun f'ojo kan sunmo O

title_english: The Day Thou Gavest, Lord, Is Ended
title_yoruba: Oluwa, ojo t'O fun wa pin
passage_english: And to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord, and likewise at even. I Chronicles 23:30
passage_yoruba: Ise won ni lati duro looro lati dupe, ati lati yin Oluwa; ati bee gege li asale. I Kronika 23:30
verses_english:
The day Thou gavest, Lord, is ended,
The darkness falls at Thy behest;
To Thee our morning hymns ascended,
Thy praise shall sanctify our rest.

We thank Thee that Thy church, unsleeping,
While earth rolls onward into light,
Through all the world her watch is keeping,
And rests not now by day or night.

As o'er each continent and island
The dawn leads on another day,
The voice of prayer is never silent,
Nor dies the strain of praise away.

The sun that bids us rest is waking
Our brethren 'neath the western sky,
And hour by hour fresh lips are making
Thy wondrous doings heard on high.

So be it, Lord; Thy throne shall never,
Like earth's proud empires, pass away:
Thy kingdom stands, and grows forever,
Till all Thy creatures own Thy sway.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, ojo t'O fun wa pin,
Okunkun si del'ase Re,
'Wo l'a korin owuro wa si,
Iyin Re yoo m'ale wa dun.

A dupe ti ijo Re ko n sun,
B'aye ti n yi lo s'imole,
O si n sona ni gbogbo aye,
Ko si sinmi tosan-toru.

B'ile si ti n mo lojoojumo,
Ni orile at'ekusu,
Ohun adura ko dake ri,
Bee l'orin iyin ko dekun

Oorun t'o wo fun wa, si ti la,
S'awon eda iwo-oorun,
Nigbakugba li enu si n so
Ise 'yanu Re di mimo.

Bee, Oluwa, lae n'joba Re,
Ko dabi ijoba ye;
O duro, o si n se akoso,
Tit'eda Re o juba Re.

title_english: Our God Who Art in Heaven
passage_english: Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy. Exodus 20:8
passage_yoruba: Ranti ojo isinmi, lati ya a si mimo. Eksodu 20:8
verses_english:
Our God who art in heav'n,
Who in only six days,
Created everything on earth,
And rested on the seventh.

It is Thy strict command,
To allow the seventh day,
But for those who will not obey,
Thine anger will wax hot.

Each ancestor of ours,
In darkness of sin died,
They were die-hard idolaters,
Without knowing thy law.

Here we come Jesus Lord,
Following Thy command,
After our six days of labour,
Gathered to do Thy will.

Day of rest is holy,
We ought to rest in it,
Assembled are we in Thy house,
To hear Thy Holy word.

There is still one great rest,
For Thy people, Oh Lord
O Jesus Lord,
Thou blessed Son
Lead us unto Thy rest.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun wa orun,
T'o fi ojo mefa,
Da nkan gbogbo ti n be l'aye,
Sinmi n'ijo keje.

O pase k'a bowo
Fun ojo isinmi;
Ibinu Re tobi pupo,
S'awon t'oru 'fin yii.

Awon baba nla wa,
Ti ku nin 'okunkun;
Won je ogbo aborisa,
Won ko mo ofin Re.

Awa de Oluwa,
Gege bi ase Re;
Leyin ise ojo mefa,
Lati se ife Re.

Mimo l'ojo oni,
O ye ki a sinmi,
K'a pejo ninu ile Re,
K'a gbo 'ro mimo Re.

Isinmi nla kan ku
F'awon eniyan Re;
Om' Olorun, Alabukun
Mu wa de 'sinmi Re!

title_english: O Lord Our God Hear Thou Our Prayer
passage_english: The Lord will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly. Psalm 84:11
passage_yoruba: Oluwa yoo fun ni li oore-ofe ati ogo; ko si ohun ti yoo fa seyin lowo awon ti nrin deedee. Orin Dafidi 84:11
verses_english:
O Lord our God hear Thou our pray'r,
In this Thy house on thisThy day,
And own as grate sacrifice,
Let our song be acceptable.

Sweet is Thy rest, O Lord my God,
But there's a greater rest above,
Still, with expectation of joy,
Thus our thirsty soulk now desire.

No more fatigue, no more labour,
Nor sin, nor death shall reach the place,
The voice of pain shall not sound there,
Which warble from immortal tongue.

No rude alarms of ranging foes,
The rest without anxiety,
The daylight will not be dark there,
But sacred day, eternal noon.

O Lord expected day begin,
Dawn on this realms of world of pain,
With joy we shall walk path of joy,
And sleep in death to rest with Lord.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa gbo adura wa
N'nu le Re l'ojo mimo yii;
Bi ebo ope n'ile yi,
K'orin wa je itewogba.

Oluwa, isinmi Re dun
Sugbon t'oke ju t'aye lo;
Sibe pelu 'reti ayo,
Li okan oungbe wa n sare.

Ko si aare, ko si ise,
Ese, iku ki yoo de 'be,
Ohun irora ki yoo dun,
Nibiti ahon aiku wa.

Ko si idagiri ota,
Isinmi laisi aniyan,
Oju ojo ko su nibe,
Osan gangan ayeraye.

Bere, Ojo t'a ti n reti,
Mo si aye irora yii,
Ao f'ayo rin l'ona t'ayo
Ao si sun ninu Oluwa

title_english: Come, Let Us Join Our Cheerful Songs
passage_english: This is the day which the Lord hath made. Psalm 118:24
passage_yoruba: Eyi li ojo ti Oluwa da. Orin Dafidi 118:24
verses_english:
Come, let us join our cheerful songs
with angels round the throne.
ten thousand thousand are their tongues,
but all their joys are one.

Jesus is worthy to receive
honor and power divine;
and blessings more than we can give,
be, Lord, forever thine.

Let all that dwell above the sky,
and air, and earth, and seas,
conspire to lift thy glories high,
and speak thine endless praise!

The whole creation join in one,
to bless the sacred Name
of him who sits upon the throne,
and to adore the Lamb.
verses_yoruba:
Wa, jek'a jumo f'ohun kan
Korin yi ite ka;
Oni l'ojo t'Oluwa da
T'O si pe ni Tire.

Ojo yi l'Olorun bukun,
Laarin ojo meje;
Apere 'sinmi ailopin
T'awon t'orun n gbadun,

Nje k'a maa korin l'ooko Re
K'a maa reti ojo
T'Oludande yoo sokale
T'asan aye yoo pin.

Lojoojumo titi aye
Ni ki a maa korin;
K'a maa yo ninu Oluwa
Titi ayeraye.

title_english: O Day of Rest and Gladness
passage_english: The Lord's Day. Revelation 1:10
passage_yoruba: Ojo Oluwa. Ifihan 1:10
verses_english:
O day of rest and gladness,
O day of joy and light,
O balm of care and sadness,
Most beautiful, most bright:
On Thee, the high and lowly,
Through ages joined in tune,
Sing holy, holy, holy,
To the great God Triune

On Thee, at the creation,
The light first had its birth;
On Thee, for our salvation,
Christ rose from depths of earth;
On Thee, our Lord, victorious,
The Spirit sent from Heaven,
And thus on Thee, most glorious,
A triple light was given.

Today on weary nations
The heavenly manna falls;
To holy convocations
The silver trumpet calls,
Where Gospel light is glowing
With pure and radiant beams,
And living water flowing,
With soul refreshing streams

New graces ever gaining
From this our day of rest,
We reach the rest remaining
To spirits of the blessed
And there our voice upraisng,
To Father, and to Son;
The Church her voice upraises to Thee, blessed Three in One.
verses_yoruba:
Ojo 'sinmi at'ayo
Ojo inu didun
Itunu fun ibanuje
Ojo dida julo
Ti awon eni giga
Niwaju ite Re
N ko mimo, mimo, mimo
S' Eni Metalokan

L'ojo yi ni 'mole la
Nigba dida aiye
Ati fun igbala wa
Kristi jinde loni
L'ojo oni l' Oluwa
Ran Emi t'orun wa
Ojo ologo julo
T'o ni mole pipe

Orisun 'tura ni O,
L'aye aginju yi
L'ori Re, bi ni Pisga
L'a n wo 'le ileri
Ojo ironu didun
Ojo ife mimo
Ojo ajinde lati
Aiye si nkan orun

L'oni s'ilu t'aare mu
Ni Manna t'orun bo
Si ipejopo mimo
N'ipe fadaka ndun
Nibiti ihin-rere
N tan imole mimo
Omi iye nsan jeje
Ti ntu okan lara

K'a r'oore-ofe titun
L'ojo 'sinmi wa yii
K'a si de sinmi t'o ku
F'awon alabukun
Nibe k'a gbohun soke
Si Baba at'Omo
Ati si Emi Mimo
N' iyin Metalokan

title_english: Great Shepherd of Thy People
passage_english: How amiable are thy tabernacles. Psalm 84:1
passage_yoruba: Ago Re wonni ti li ewa to! Orin Dafidi 84:1
verses_english:
The hearing ear, the seeing eye,
the contrite heart bestow;
and shine upon us from on high,
that we in grace may grow.
verses_yoruba:
Olus'agutan eni Re
Fi oju Re han wa,
'Wo fun wa n'ile adura
M'okan wa gbadura.

K'ife ati alaafia
K'o ma gbe ile yii!
F'irora f'okan iponju
M'okan ailera le

K'a fi gbagbo gbo oro Re
K'a fi 'gbagbo bebe
Ati niwaju Oluwa
K'a se aroye wa.

title_english: The Lord's Own Hallowed Day of Rest
passage_english: Six days shalt thou labour. Exodus 20:9
passage_yoruba: Ni ijo mefa ni iwo o sise. Eksodu 20:9
verses_english:
The Lord's own hallowed day of rest,
O day most beautiful and bright,
A day given to us by God,
For us, a day therein to rest.

Six days He provided for us,
To do all that we have to do,
The seventh day He set aside,
It is God's hallowed day of rest.

Our vain pursuits let us forsake,
Our duties hath performed six days,
Our work today, let hallowed be,
For unto God the day belongs.

Strength from above enerves us well,
For service in the house of God,
A joyful anthem let us rend,
This early morn the Lord hath made.

In the morn of the Sabbath day,
On the Lord's hallowed day of rest,
A joyful chorus let us raise,
And let us lift our hearts to pray.
verses_yoruba:
Ijo mefa l'O fi fun wa,
K'a fi se ise wa gbogbo;
Sugbon ojo keje yato,
Ojo 'sinmi Olorun ni.

K'a fi 'se asan wa sile,
Ti awa n se n'ijo mefa;
Mimo ni ise ti oni,
Ti Olorun Oluwa wa.

A para de nisisiyii,
Ninu ile Olorun wa;
Jek'a korin didun si,
Li owuro ojo oni.

Ni kutukutu 'jo keje
Ni ojo isinmi mimo
Je k'a jumo korin didun,
Je k'a si jumo gbadura.

title_english: How our hearts long for Thee
title_yoruba: A be, a fe ri o
passage_english: Won Kigbe Li Ohun Rara Wipe Yio Ti Pe To Oluwa. Rev. 6:10
passage_yoruba: Won Kigbe Li Ohun Rara Wipe Yio Ti Pe To Oluwa. Ifihan 6:10
verses_english:
How our hearts long for Thee,
Thou hallowed day of rest
All the week long, we long for Thee,
Thou hallowed day of rest.

Thou hast taught us to know
Christ rose up from the dead,
All the week long, we long for thee,
Thou hallowed day of rest.

Telling us we shall rise
As Jesus also rose
All the week long, we long for thee,
Thou hallowed day of rest.

We heard of heav'nly rest
The peaceful land of God
The blessing of the holy men
Thou hallowed day of rest.
verses_yoruba:
A be, a fe ri o,
Ojo 'sinmi rere
Gbogbo ose a maa wipe,
Iwo o ti pe to!

O ko wa pe Kristi
Jinde ninu oku
Gbogbo ose a maa wipe
Iwo o ti pe to!

O so t'ajinde wa
Gege bi ti Jesu
Gbogbo ose a maa wipe
Iwo o ti pe to!

Iwo so t'isinmi
T' ilu Alaafia
T' ibukun eniyan mimo
Iwo o ti pe to!

title_english: Lord of the Sabbath
passage_english: For The Son Of Man Is Lord Even Of The Sabbath Day. Matt. 12:8
passage_yoruba: Nitori Omo Eniyan Je Oluwa Ojo Isimi. Matt. 12:8
verses_english:
Lord of the Sabbath,
Hear us pray In this Thy house,
on this Thy day Now met to pray and bless,
Thy name Whose mercies flow each day the same.

Thine earthly Sabbaths,
Lord we love But there's a nobler rest above,
To that our bab'ring souls aspire,
With ardent hope and strong desire.

In Thy blest kingdom we shall be,
From every mortal trouble free,
No sighs shall mingle with the songs,
Resounding from immortal tongues.

O long-expected day, begin!
Dawn on these realms of woe and sin,
Fain would we leave this weary road,
And sleep in death to rest with God.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa ojo isinmi,
Gbo ti wa, pelu wa loni,
A wa pade fun adura,
A fe gb'oro t'o fi fun wa.

Isinmi t'aye yii rorun,
Sugbon isinmi t'orun dun;
Laalaa okan wa fe 'jo na,
T'a o sinmi lailese da.

Ko si 'ja, ko si 'dagiri,
Ko s'aniyan bi t'aye yii,
T'yoo dapo mo ikorin wa,
T'o n t'ete aiku jade wa.

Beere, ojo t'a ti n reti,
A femoju re l'a fe ri,
A fe yo lona ise yii,
K'a sun n'iku, k'a ji l'ayo.

title_english: Jesus, we love to meet
passage_english: For Today Is A Sabbath Unto The Lord. Exs. 16:25
passage_yoruba: Oni Li Ojo Isinmi Si Oluwa. Exs. 16:25
verses_english:
We dare not trifle now,
On this Thy holy day;
In silent awe we bow,
On this Thy holy day;
Check every wandering thought,
And let us all be taught
To serve Thee as we ought
On this Thy holy day.

We listen to Thy Word
On this Thy holy day;
Bless all that we have heard
On this Thy holy day;
Go with us when we part,
And to each troubled heart
Thy saving grace impart
On this Thy holy day.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, a fe pade,
L'ojo Re mimo yii;
A si y'ite Re ka,
L'ojo Re mimo yii:
'Wo ore wa orun,
Adura wa n bo wa,
Bojuwo emi wa
L'ojo Re mimo yii.

A ko gbodo lora,
L'ojo Re mimo yii,
Li eru a kunle
L'ojo Re mimo yii;
Ma taro ise wa,
K'Iwo k'o si ko wa,
Ka sin O b'o ti ye
L'ojo Re mimo yii.

A teti s'oro Re
L'ojo Re mimo yii;
Bukun oro t'a gbo,
Lojo Re mimo yii;
Ba wa lo 'gba t'a lo,
F'oore igbala Re
Si aya wa gbogbo,
L'ojo Re mimo yi.

title_english: How sweet The word of God to hear
title_yoruba: Bi mo ti yo lati gb'oro,
passage_english: I Was Glad When They Said Unto Me Let Us Go Into The House Of The Lord. Psalm. 122:1
passage_yoruba: Inu Mi Dun Nigbati Won Wi Fun Mi Pe, E Je Ka Lo Si Ile Oluwa. Orin Dafidi 122:1
verses_english:
How sweet The word of God to hear,
From the mouth of our friends,
That we should gather in Zion,
To keep the holy day.

Its env'rons and the gates I keep,
The decorated house,
The house that we built for our God,
Which His mercy, to show.

The courtyard of the house of joy,
Where holy tribes went forth,
On the throne, the son of David,
ls judging matters there.

He hears our praises and our cries,
Like His tremendous voice,
That separate sinners to his doom,
In tremble we rejoice.

Let Thy blessing be in the place,
And joy of often time,
Let us give friends, and His goodness,
To all that serves Him there.

My Soul's now pleading for Zion,
While I am still alive,
There all the relatives and friends,
Our Saviour too is there.
verses_yoruba:
Bi mo ti yo lati gb'oro,
L'enu awon ore;
Pe, "Ni Sion ni k'a pe si,
K'a p'ojo mimo mo".

S'agbala ile ayo naa,
L'eya mimo si lo,
Omo Dafid' wa lor'ite,
O n da ejo nibe.

O gbo iyin at'igbe wa;
Bi ohun eru Re
Ti n ya elese sib'egbe,
A n yo ni 'wariri

K'ibukun pelu ibe naa
Ayo nigbakugba;
K'a fi ore ati oore,
F'awon ti n sin nibe.

Okan mi bebe fun Sion'
Nigbati emi wa;
Nibe ni 'batan at'ore
At'Olugbala wa.

title_english: When shall it Be my Saviour Lord
passage_english: There The Weary Be At Rest. Job 3:17
passage_yoruba: Nibe Li Alaare Wa Ninu Isinmi Jobu 3:17
verses_english:
When shall it Be my Saviour Lord,
Gentle, Thee, I may see,
In Thine rest ladden with blessing,
Without a covering veil.

Be of help to me while I trod,
Amidst earthly desires,
May in love pray unto Thee,
Harken unto my prayers.

Father, Thy saving grace l plead,
My soul l offer Thee,
All of me receive to be Thine,
Offer Thine self to me.

Thine Spirit, Father, me endow,
Let Him abide with me,
Shinning Light, be Him to my feet,
Unto eternal rest.
verses_yoruba:
Nigbawo Olugbala mi,
L'emi o ri O je?
N'isinmi t'o ni ibukun,
Laisi 'boju laarin.

Ran mi lowo n'irinkiri,
L'aye aniyan yii;
Se mi li n fi 'fe gbadura,
Si gba adura mi.

Da mi si' Baba, da mi si,
Mo f'ara mi fun O,
Gba ohun gbogbo ti mo ni,
Si f'ara Re fun mi.

Emi Re, Baba, fifun mi,
K'o le maa pelu mi,
K'o se imole ese mi,
S'isinmi ailopin.

title_english: Another six days' work is done
passage_english: There The Prisoners Rest Together. Psalm 3:18
passage_yoruba: Nibe Ni Awon Igbekun Sinmi Po. Jobu 3:18
verses_english:
Another six days' work is done
Another Sabbath is begun;
Return, my soul, enjoy thy rest,
Improve the day that God hath blest.

O that our thoughts and thanks may rise
As grateful incense to the skies!
And draw from Heaven that sweet repose
Which none but he who feels it knows.

A heavenly calm pervades the breast
Is the dear pledge of glorious rest,
Which for the Church of God remains,
The end of cares, the end of pains.

With joy, great God, Thy works we view,
In various scenes, both old and new;
With praise we think on mercies past,
With hope we future pleasure taste.

In holy duties let the day,
In holy comforts pass away;
The Sabbath thus we love to spend,
In hope of one which ne'er shall end.
verses_yoruba:
Ojo mefa t'ise koja
Okan t'isinmi si bere,
Wa, okan mi si 'simi re,
Yo s'ojo t'Olorun busi.

Ki 'rorun at'ope wa nde,
Bi ebo turari s'orun,
K'o le fa inu didun wa
T'o je teni t'o mo nikan.

Ibale aya orun yii,
L'eri isinmi t'o logo;
T'o wa fun eniyan mimo,
Opin aniyan at'aisan.

Olorun, a yo si 'se Re,
L'oniruuru t'ogbo t'otun;
A fi 'yin ro aanu t'o lo,
A ni 'reti s'eyi ti n bo.

F'oni se'sin mi mimo jale,
K'o si se inu didun sii,
B'o ti dun lati l'ojo yii,
Ni' reti okan ailopin.

title_english: This is the day the Lord hath made
passage_english: This Is The Day Which The Lord Hath Made. Ps 118:24
passage_yoruba: Eyii Li Ojo Ti Oluwa Da. Orin Dafidi 118:24
verses_english:
Today He rose and left the dead,
And Satan's empire fell;
Today the saints His triumphs spread,
And all His wonders tell.

Hosanna to th'anointed king,
To David's holy Son;
Help us, O Lord; descend and bring
Salvation from Thy throne.

Blest be the Lord, who comes to men
With messages of grace;
Who comes in God His Father's name,
To save our sinful race.

Hosanna in the highest strains
The Church on earth can raise;
The highest heav'ns, in which He reigns,
Shall give Him nobler praise.
verses_yoruba:
Eyi l'ojo t'Oluwa da,
O pe 'gba naa n tire;
K'orun k'o yo, k'aye k'o yo
K'iyin yi 'te naa ka.

Loni, O jinde 'nu oku,
Ijoba Satan 'tu
'Won mimo tan segun Re ka
Won n soro 'yanu Re.

Hosanna si Oba t'ayan
S'Omo mimo Dafidi,
Oluwa, joo sokale wa
T'Iwo t'igbala Re.

Abukun l'Oluwa t'o wa
N'ise oore-ofe
T'o wa l'oruko Baba Re,
Lati gba ran wa la.

Hosanna ki ohun gooro,
L'orin Ijo t'aye,
Orin t'oke orun lohun,
Yio dun ju bee lo.

title_english: All times and seasons, months and years
passage_english: God Rested The Seventh Day. Exodus 20:11
passage_yoruba: Oluwa Si Simi Nijo K'Eje. Eksodu 20:11
verses_english:
All times and seasons, months and years,
These are created by God,
Day is given for us to work,
But the night is meant for sleep.

He also made a day of rest
Out of seven days He gave one,
So that man may have a whole day,
Given to worship his God.

Six days there are in which to work,
Let us do it as we ought,
On the seventh, let us gather,
In God's house to worship there.

On this day, we all meet to pray,
And we sing our songs to Him
We praise and glorify our God,
Who is the greatest of all.

Now let us lift high our praises
The praises of our Lord God,
Raise the anthem, swell the music
In sweet praises of our God.
verses_yoruba:
Akoko odun at'osu
Gbogbo won l'Olorun da;
Ojumo ni fun ise wa,
Oru si ni lati sun.

O si da ojo isinmi;
N'nu 'jo meje, I mu 'kan,
K'eniyan ba le r'aaye se,
Ati sin Olorun won.

L'ojo kefa ni k'a sise,
B'o ti ye ni ki a see;
L'ojo keje je k'a pejo,
Ni ile Olorun wa.

L'ojo naa yii a n gbadura,
A n korin didun si I,
A si yin Olorun l'ogo,
T'o ju ohun gbogbo lo.

Nissiyi korin iyin,
T'Olorun Oluwa wa;
Korin didun, Korin soke,
Ni yiyin Oluwa wa.

title_english: How delightful is the Lord's day
passage_english: Even Them I Will Bring To My Holy Mountain, And Make Them Joyful In My House Of Prayer. Isa. 56:7
passage_yoruba: Awon Ii Emi O Si Mu Wa Si Oke Mimo Mi, Emi O Si Mu Inu Won Dun Ninu Ile Adura Mi. Isa. 56:7
verses_english:
How delightful is the Lord's day,
The hell that rings, the word we hear,
When I feel sad and sorrowful,
They always make my hearts so glad.

How delightful also the hour,
That I observe within Thy courts,
To know the sweet pleasure in prayer, Partake the manna of Thy Word.

There is delight in the "Amen"
From many lips that fill the house,
It pours out from the throat of men,
And passes to the Father's throne.

The world may wish to tie me down,
To its six-day labour burden,
Break up the chain, remove the snare Release my soul and set me free.
verses_yoruba:
Ayo l'ojo 'sinmi fun mi
At' agogo at'iwasu
Gbat'a ba mi n'nu 'banuje,
Awon l'o n mu inu mi dun.

Ayo si ni wakati naa,
Ti mo lo n'nu agbala Re,
Lati mo adun adura,
Lati gba manna oro Re.

Ayo ni idahun 'Amin'
T'o gba gbogbo ile naa kan,
Lekookan l'o n dun t'o n role,
O n koja lo sodo Baba.

B'aiye fe f'agbara de mi,
Mo ise ijo mefa Re;
Oluwa, jo tu ide naa,
K'O so okan mi d'ominira.

title_english: Sweet is the work, my God, my King
passage_english: For Thou, Lord, Hast Made Me Glad Through Thy Work .Psalm 92:4
passage_yoruba: Nitori Iwo Oluwa Li O Ti Mu Mi Yo Nipa Ise Re. Orin Dafidi 92:4
verses_english:
Sweet is the work, my God, my King,
To praise Thy Name, give thanks and sing;
To show Thy love by morning light
And talk of all Thy truth at night.

Sweet is the day of sacred rest,
No mortal cares disturb my breast;
O may my heart in tune be found
Like David's harp of solemn sound!

My heart shall triumph in my Lord
And bless His works, and bless His word:
Thy works of grace, how bright they shine!
How deep Thy counsels, how divine!

Lord I shall share a glorious part,
When grace has well refined my heart;
And fresh supplies of joy are shed,
Like holy oil to cheer my head.

Then shall I see, and hear, and know
All I desired and wished below;
And every power find sweet employ
In that eternal world of joy.
verses_yoruba:
Didun n 'ise naa, Oba mi,
Lati maa yin Oruko Re,
Lati se 'fe Re l'owuro
Lati so oro Re l'ale.

Didun l'ojo 'sinmi mimo,
Laalaa ko si fun mi loni,
Okan mi, maa korin iyin,
Bi harpu Dafidi didun.

Okan mi yo' nu Oluwa,
Yoo yin ise at'oro Re
Ise oore Re ti po to!
Ijinle si ni imo Re.

Emi o yan ipo ola
'Gb' oore-ofe ba we mi nu,
Ti ayo pupo si ba mi
Ayo mimo lat'oke wa.
